title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administration Assistant

Store: Specsavers Hearcare Derby

Hours: Full Time - 37.5 hours (Weekend work is essential)

Benefits: £11.70 an hour plus bonus potential

Experience: Would be useful to have previous Specsavers systems knowledge but not essential as full training will be given

For our stores to run like clockwork and keep our patients at the heart of everything we do, we need sound support behind the scenes – and that’s where you come in.

So, what does it take to be a successful Admin Assistant? You’ll be organised and equipped to tackle a variety of tasks, including all aspects of optical and audiology administration, answering & transferring calls, updating & filing records, processing invoices and sending out correspondence. The aim is to provide a top-notch administrative service that will support the store’s success. You will be willing to learn all aspects of optics and audiology to increase your knowledge and ensure you are able to answer all queries with confidence.

Main duties would involve:

  • NHS Debtor Reconciliation
  • Sundry Debt Management
  • Socrates back-office store report processing
  • Scanning of documents

We’re looking for someone to join our friendly team, who is able to prioritise tasks and efficiently manage a changing workload, maintaining accuracy & attention to detail. An organised, pro-active approach is key – a skilled Administrator who’s flexible and understands the changing needs of the store.

If you are interested, please click Apply as this vacancy will close once we have filled all available places.

INDR

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £11.70 per hour

Expected hours: 37.5 per week

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Health & wellbeing programme
  • Referral programme

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Weekend availability

Supplemental pay types:

  • Bonus scheme

Work Location: In person

title: Office Administrator
description:
Office Administrator - Asbestos

Oracle Solutions Asbestos

Salary:
Salary and package are based on your experience and what you can bring to the role, from £19,000 - £24,000 per year.

Location:
Kettering, Northamptonshire

The Company:
Oracle Solutions are looking for an experienced administrator to join our Asbestos Team. We offer the opportunity to grow into more than just a job – we build fulfilling and well-paid careers.

With more than 15 years in the asbestos business, we are proud of the fun and inclusive workplace culture we have developed. We’re excited to add more motivated people to our team of 50+ asbestos professionals.

We believe in promoting from within, after all, when you help build the company, you should have a say in how it’s run. If you’re interested in growing with the company, the opportunities are abundant.

The Position:
Oracle has several positions to fill, and there are some big opportunities for the right candidates.

We are looking for professional Administrators to join our busy team. A minimum of 1 years Administration experience required. We will teach you all the skills you need to excel in this fast-paced and exciting role.

On a daily basis, you’ll:

  • Undertake require bookings of pre-start, client meetings and projects as required. Including communication with customer and site contacts.
  • Complete required quote and customer follow up communication - all business areas.
  • Answer and manage incoming customer calls ensuring all are dealt with in a fast and professional manner including any sales element.
  • As required contract all projects in line with system.
  • As needed sending and managing of customer account forms and credit checking. Ensuring if required PO is received before site attendance.
  • As needed preparation of quotations and following the quotation system.
  • As needed general liaison with all customers to ensure their satisfaction.
  • General duties including making up of files, ad hoc telephone duties and any other administration tasks that maybe required for the company to deliver their services. This will include all departments as required.
  • Raising of POs if required for contract/projects.
  • Complete as required information for dashboards and KPI boards.
  • Gather prices for purchasing and hire as requested and log in line with system.
  • Manage and update hire log in line with system.
  • Filing and archiving as required in line with system.

The Benefits:

  • Pay: Up to £24,000 per year - dependant on experience and qualifications
  • Competitive pension plan
  • Social events

Job Type: Full Time

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £19,000.00-£24,000.00 per year

  • Bereavement leave
  • Company events

  • On-site parking

  • Administration: 1 year (required)

title: Business Administration Apprentice
description:
Level 3 Apprentice Business Administration Standard

Founded in 2007, Unifabs started life as a manufacturer and provider of sheet metal components, from one small factory.

Soon after the sole ownership of our company passed to the current Directorship, we added Industrial Design Services to our capabilities, allowing us to design and manufacture full industrial solutions to the warehousing and logistics sectors, and many more today.

We are seeking one Apprentice Business Administrator

Working week:

Monday - Thursday 09:00-17:00

Friday - 9:00-13:30

Total hours per week: 34.5

Expected apprenticeship duration:

21 Months

Planned start date:

9th March 2024

Apprenticeship level:

Advanced Level 3

What does the job role involve?

This role will be supporting the Operations Support Team which in turn supports the business operations. It will involve work with the Transport function and Health and Safety. It will involve the use of transport and planning systems, purchase orders, administration of cars and vans, liaison with suppliers, customers and internal depot staff

Duties include:

  • Answering the phones, taking messages and transferring calls to the relevant person
  • Processing customer orders
  • Responding to emails in a timely and professional manner
  • Printing CAD drawings
  • Record management, managing systems and providing comprehensive reports
  • Collating documents
  • Responding to customer enquiries by email and phone
  • Assist with general office admin tasks
  • Data entry

What training will the apprentice take and what qualification will the apprentice get at the end?

As well as gaining a broad range of professional knowledge and experience, you will gain academic and vocational qualifications such as the Business Administrator Level 3 qualification.

What is the expected career progression after this apprenticeship?

Upon successfully completing your apprenticeship the options are endless. You could continue to develop your career by choosing to obtain further qualifications, develop and improve your management and leadership skills or even move across the different areas of the business to pursue a career in your chosen field.

Desired skills:

  • Communication skills
  • Organisational skills
  • Problem solving skills
  • Analytical skills

Desired personal qualities:

  • Logical
  • Able to work as part of a team
  • Good initiative
  • Customer focused

Qualifications:

Applicants must have 4 x GCSE (at A-C) or equivalent, including Maths, English and preferably a Science subject. Applications without the necessary qualifications will not be progressed any further.

Things to consider:

Are you able to travel to this work location on a daily basis?

EQUALITY & DIVERSITY: Train’d Up will work to remove any barriers which might deter people from applying to Train’d Up, either as staff or learner / customers. Train’d Up aims to provide an inclusive environment which values diversity and maintains a working, learning and social environment in which the rights and dignity of all its staff and learner / customers are respected to assist them in reaching their full potential.

Job Types: Full-time, Apprenticeship

Salary: £7.50 per hour

Expected hours: 34.5 per week

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Free parking
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Sales Administrator
company: Warwick University Enterprises Ltd t/a Unitemps Birmingham
description:
Role
Our client based at Crosspoint Business Park are looking a Sales Administrator to join their team. You will be working alongside the Operations and Sales Managers to provide administrative support to the team.

This is a full time role office based role (37.5 Hours per week, Monday to Friday) and the salary for the role is 23-25k dependant on experience.We are looking for someone to start ASAP - However we are also wanting to find the right person so are willing to wait for a notice period.

Duties and responsibilities
We are looking for someone who can come in and help with the sales processes to support the sales manager to allow them to do their daily tasks.Duties for this role will include

  • Liaising with the director to process sales orders.
  • Sending out price lists and following up leads/enquiries.
  • Following up tasks in an appropriate timeframe.
  • Communicating with customers via their preferred method (Email, Call, Message).
  • Vetting potential clients to do due diligence on them.
  • Completing customer application forms
  • Utilising the new Microsoft Business Central
  • Booking deliveries via phone and email.

Skills and experience

  • We are looking for someone with an excellent attention to detail.
  • You will have some previous administration experience and be able to manage your own time.
  • You will be able to take the initiative to deal with emails and messages that you are copied into.
  • You will have excellent communication skills to build relationships with the team as well as customers.
  • You will be using Microsoft Excel on a daily basis so an understanding of this would be desired.
  • Training on the specific systems would be available.

INDUNI

title: Office Administrator
description:
Internationally successful: The Wienerberger Group

Come and join us as an Office Administrator on a part time basis at our Kingsbury site in Tamworth.

Who are we?

Wienerberger are a leading international provider of building materials and infrastructure solutions. We improve the quality of life and shape the future of construction.

With our 19,000 employees at 216 locations in 28 countries, we improve the lives of people all over the world. Our products and system solutions enable energy-efficient, healthy, climate-friendly and affordable living.

About the Role

As Office Administrator you will…

  • Administer wages ensuring a high level of accuracy
  • Deliver an effective administration service to the factory management team
  • Dealing efficiently and professionally with visitors to site
  • Diary management / room booking / providing refreshments
  • Dealing with Contractors
  • Provide SAP cover as required

Hours of Work: 8.00am to 4.00pm, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday

About You

  • Previous experience working as an Administrator
  • Experience of administrating a weekly payroll system
  • Ability to multitask and prioritise your workload effectively
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Able to work well under your own initiative as well as part of a team
  • Excellent Microsoft Office and Excel skills
  • Work well under pressure
  • Thorough attention to detail
  • Knowledge of SAP is desirable but not essential

About our Benefits

  • Professional growth, training and opportunities to hone your skills and knowledge
  • Annual bonus scheme
  • Ability to purchase additional holidays
  • Company Pension
  • SIP – ability to become a shareholder via our Share Scheme
  • Life Assurance
  • Flexible benefits offering (including health, wellbeing and money saving opportunities)

So what are you waiting for? Come and join Wienerberger as an Office Administrator and start growing your career with us today!

The closing date for this role is subject to change and may be closed earlier than advertised.

Meet our People & View our Vacancies

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
If you are organised, like working with people & are interested in a career within the NHS, then this could be the job for you.

As the PMO Admin Assistant Apprentice you will be part of the Trust Programme Management Office (PMO), which comprises of a team of project professionals concerned with improving the successful delivery of projects by providing a range of Project & Programme Management services.

You will be enrolled on a paid for Level 3 Business Admin course and develop your skills whilst you provide an administrative support service to the Trust PMO Team and key Improvement Teams.

Currently, you will work mainly from home and partly work in the office.
Joining our team you’ll be responsible for general admin duties, providing diary management & meeting organisation, assisting with the preparation of documents for meetings and training events, produce minutes, reports and maintain databases as required.

You will need good communications skills and will be supported to develop lots of new skills. You will be an enthusiastic team player with good organisational skills. You will need to be well motivated & reliable. You will be able to understand and accurately convey verbal and written information and be able to remain calm under pressure. You will present a professional and polite attitude at all times.

We encourage you to learn and develop within your role and beyond!

In addition to the brief list above you must familiarise yourself with the full job description and person specification attached to this advert prior to applying.

Please note that the UK government require non-UK nationals to have lived in the UK for 3 years to be eligible for apprenticeship funding.

As the PMO Admin Assistant Apprentice, whilst working on your Level 3 Business Administration Qualification, you would develop your skills to support the Trust PMO Team and to Key Improvement Teams, including:

Undertaking general office duties

Diary management and meeting organisation

Provide admin for training programmes

Produce communications and website content

You will be working within the Trust PMO team.

We are a small and motivated team who oversee and support the successful delivery, change and improvement projects at NUH.

Within NUH we are the 'project management specialists' so you will get a wide view of different aspects of an acute hospital and application of
your admin skills in the context of project management.

Currently, we are mainly working from home and work partly in the office.

Joining this team will not only allow you to interact and gain knowledge from your professional peers, but will also equip you for future roles within the NHS. We are a friendly and hard-working team that support each other but we also trust each team member to be able to function independently.

Working with us will create opportunities to further build on your skills, whilst really making a difference to the NHS and the people we care for.

Working under the direction of the PMO System Administrator to develop skills to:

Provide diary management & meeting organisation for the Trust PMO team and Key Improvement Teams.

Deal with enquiries referring on as appropriate.

Provide configuration management for documentation within the PMO.

Assist with the preparation of documents for meetings and training events, photocopying, collating and distributing.

Compile Reports for programme meetings.

Attend meetings and subsequently produce & distribute notes and actions.

Maintain the PMO system and produce simple reports.

Provide ad hoc admin support to projects where deemed necessary.

Provide admin for the PMO training programmes.

Progress to more complex PMO duties to aid personal development and potential career opportunities.

Please refer to the job description and person specification attached to the advert for the full details of the vacancy.

title: Business Administrator
description:
Details

Reference number

340925

Salary

£25,752 - £27,116
Pro-rata
A Civil Service Pension with an average employer contribution of 27%

Job grade

Administrative Officer
HMPPS Band 3

Contract type

Permanent

Type of role

Administration / Corporate Support

Working pattern

Part-time

Number of jobs available

2

Contents

    Location

    About the job

    Benefits

    Things you need to know

    Apply and further information

Location

This position is based at HM Prison Gartree, LE16 7RP

About the job

Job summary

Please refer to Job Description

Job description

We encourage applications from people from all backgrounds and aim to have a workforce that represents the wider society that we serve. We pride ourselves on being an employer of choice. We champion diversity, inclusion and wellbeing and aim to create a workplace where everyone feels valued and a sense of belonging. To find out more about how we do this visit: https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/ministry-of-justice/about/equality-and-diversity.

Organisation Level Delivery - The jobs at this level will be task focused delivering defined activity or services.

Overview

Job holders within this Group Profile provide administrative support to managers and frontline staff by undertaking transactional work in a particular area.

The job holder is expected to be competent in their area of work, any specific qualifications or training required will be detailed in the relevant job description.

This is a non operational role which may involve contact with prisoners depending on their area of work.

This role has no line management responsibilities.

Characteristics

Typical tasks associated with this Group Profile include:

  • Organise, produce and maintain accurate records for area of work
  • Act as contact point for all communications to the team. Prioritise and distribute communications to the appropriate person or relevant department in establishment
  • Complete monitoring returns for area of work
  • Input requisitions on to the finance database and process requisitions for defined area of work
  • Co-ordinate any awareness sessions for area of work
  • Prepare paperwork for checking by manager, conducting initial checks as required
  • Correspond with relevant stakeholders and agencies to ensure that they are aware of information so that information is adequately shared
  • Maintain and check establishment databases, manual filing systems and logs of information, responding within agreed timescales and producing reports as required
  • Collate information relating to relevant Service Delivery Indicators (SDI's)
  • Act as secretary to meetings as required including organising agenda, taking, distributing minutes and action points

Job Descriptions relating to this Group Profile

The job holder once in post will be in matched to a job description; a sample list is shown below. The post is rotational so the job holder could during their career carry out the role of different job descriptions.

  • Business Administrator : Activity Hub
  • Business Administrator : Business Hub
  • Business Administrator : Equality
  • Business Administrator : Estates
  • Business Administrator : Management Coordinator
  • Business Administrator : Offender Management Hub
  • Business Administrator : People Hub
  • Business Administrator : Programmes
  • Business Administrator : Psychology
  • Business Administrator : Safe Decent and Secure
  • Business Administrator : Safer Custody
  • Business Administrator : Security Intelligence Collator
  • Business Administrator : Substance Misuse and Drug Strategy
  • Business Administrator : Healthcare
  • Business Administrator : Observation, Categorisation and Allocation (OCA)
  • Business Administrator : Establishment Television Systems
  • Business Administrator: Mobilisation, Transition and Transformation Administration Support
  • Business Administrator: Regional Admin support Wales
  • Business Administrator: Regional Estates Team
  • Business Administrator: Safe Decent and Secure Benchmark
  • Business Administrator: Equality Benchmark
  • Business Administrator: Safer Custody Benchmark
  • Business Administrator: Resettlement Worker Benchmark
  • Business Administrator: OMU Benchmark
  • Business Administrator: Regional Admin Support (North East)
  • Business Administrator: Regime Development


Essential Skills/ Qualifications/ Accreditation/ Registration

  • Job holders must complete specific training in their specialism once they take up post.
  • An ability to fulfil all spoken aspects of the role with confidence through the medium of English or (where specified in Wales) Welsh

Person specification

Please refer to Job Description

Behaviours

We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:

  • Changing and Improving
  • Communicating and Influencing
  • Working Together
  • Managing a Quality Service
  • Delivering at Pace

Benefits

Alongside your salary of £25,752, HM Prison & Probation Service contributes £6,978 towards you being a member of the Civil Service Defined Benefit Pension scheme. Find out what benefits a Civil Service Pension provides.
  • Access to learning and development
  • A working environment that supports a range of flexible working options to enhance your work life balance
  • A working culture which encourages inclusion and diversity
  • A Civil Service pension with an average employer contribution of 27%
  • Annual Leave
  • Public Holidays
  • Season Ticket Advance


For more information about the recruitment process, benefits and allowances and answers to general queries, please click the below link which will direct you to our Candidate Information Page.


Things you need to know

Selection process details

This vacancy is using Success Profiles (opens in a new window), and will assess your Behaviours and Strengths.
https://justicejobs.tal.net/vx/candidate/cms/About%20the%20MOJ

Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.

Security

Successful candidates must undergo a criminal record check.
People working with government assets must complete baseline personnel security standard (opens in new window) checks.

Nationality requirements

This job is broadly open to the following groups:

  • UK nationals
  • nationals of the Republic of Ireland
  • nationals of Commonwealth countries who have the right to work in the UK
  • nationals of the EU, Switzerland, Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein and family members of those nationalities with settled or pre-settled status under the European Union Settlement Scheme (EUSS) (opens in a new window)
  • nationals of the EU, Switzerland, Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein and family members of those nationalities who have made a valid application for settled or pre-settled status under the European Union Settlement Scheme (EUSS)
  • individuals with limited leave to remain or indefinite leave to remain who were eligible to apply for EUSS on or before 31 December 2020
  • Turkish nationals, and certain family members of Turkish nationals, who have accrued the right to work in the Civil Service
Further information on nationality requirements (opens in a new window)

Working for the Civil Service

The Civil Service Code (opens in a new window) sets out the standards of behaviour expected of civil servants.

We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles (opens in a new window).
The Civil Service embraces diversity and promotes equal opportunities. As such, we run a Disability Confident Scheme (DCS) for candidates with disabilities who meet the minimum selection criteria.

Apply and further information

This vacancy is part of the Great Place to Work for Veterans (opens in a new window) initiative.
Once this job has closed, the job advert will no longer be available. You may want to save a copy for your records.

Contact point for applicants

Job contact :

    Name :
    SSCL Recruitment Enquiries Team
    Email :
    Moj-recruitment-vetting-enquiries@gov.sscl.com
    Telephone :
    0845 241 5358

Recruitment team

    Email :
    Moj-recruitment-vetting-enquiries@gov.sscl.com

Further information

Appointment to the Civil Service is governed by the Civil Service Commission’s Recruitment Principles. I you feel a department has breached the requirement of the Recruitment Principles and would like to raise this, please contact SSCL (Moj-recruitment-vetting-enquiries@gov.sscl.com) in the first instance. If the role has been advertised externally (outside of the Civil Service) and you are not satisfied with the response, you may bring your complaint to the Commission. For further information on bringing a complaint to the Civil Service Commission please visit their web pages: http://civilservicecommission.independent.gov.uk/civil-service-recruitment/complaints

title: Operations Administrator
description:
Job Title: Warehouse Administrator

Salary: £22,000 - £28,000per annum

Location: Leicester

Hours: Monday - Friday, full-time, 08:30 - 5pm

Potential to WFH - 2 days a week after probation

Reporting to: Operations Manager

Purpose of Job

To provide administrative support to the Operations Manager, Team Leaders, Co-Ordinators, and the Operational team in line with the agreed guidance. Ensuring data is collected and stored in a timely and accurate way, including KPIs, Maintenance data, SOPs, Consumable orders. To support the delivery of the departmental objectives, maintaining excellent communication with other areas of the business.

Key Responsibilities

  • To manage the incoming email and diary of the Operations Manager ensuring that the work is prioritised, and time is allocated sensibly in line with the objectives of the business and other demands.
  • To arrange and co-ordinate meetings and events.
  • To prepare and edit correspondence, communications, presentations, and other documents.
  • To ensure the accurate and timely completion of production performance trackers and communicate progress versus plan as defined by the Operations Manager
  • To support the performance improvement and downtime reduction using departmental tools in a timely and accurate way, including:
  • Escalation forms timely completion and regular updates.
  • Root cause analysis
  • Downtime dashboards
  • Production Output trackers
  • Consumable spares stock and ordering
  • Agility order raising, completion and documentation.
  • To understand the production process’ and the products that are manufactured through the plant.
  • Ensuring that there is a presence on the shopfloor and interactions with the manufacturing areas.
  • To liaise with departments and suppliers outside of operations appropriately and as required
  • Raising and managing the purchase orders for the department, in the appropriate systems and ERP

Experience Required:

  • Previous experience in a manufacturing or warehouse Administration environment.
  • Experience with MRP/ERP systems
  • Experience with writing SOPs (Standard Operation Procedures)

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

title: Sales Executive
description:
Market leading multi-brand operational leasing organisation are looking to recruit a sales support executive for 12 months to cover maternity leave. This role is hybrid working 2/3 days from the office in Coventry, the other days can be worked from home.
The Opportunity
The Indirect Sales Support Executive will join the Indirect Sales Department department and will be responsible for dealing with all inbound queries from our Retailer and Broker networks.

Key Responsibilities & Deliverables include:
  • Working closely with Retailers and Brokers, together with the Zone Managers and Broker Managers, to ensure renewal customers have been contacted and we maximise customer retention.
  • Optimise the conversion of new business opportunities, in conjunction with other members of the Indirect Sales Team, by working proactively in order to increase penetration.
  • Maximise Contract Hire business volumes via the Retailer and Broker Networks, through proactive calls to less engaged Retailers and efficient, effective and professional handling of all enquiries
  • Increase the penetration of additional value adding products / services (e.g. Maintenance, Tyres, etc.), through effective modelling and presentation of quotations and identifying upselling opportunities.
  • Involvement and contribution to Retailer Network and Broker meetings (both virtually and in person), working alongside Zone Managers and Broker Manager to retain existing customers (through advocacy) and assisting in securing new customers.
Supporting Zone Managers and Broker Managers in the production of rate books, rate matrixes and more complex quoting requirements to develop business volumes through specific Retailer and Broker partner within budgetary and departmental controls. - Take Responsibility within the Indirect Sales Support Team for developing a strategy to communicate and animate quarterly campaigns to the Retailer and Broker Networks.

Maintain and develop up-to-date comprehensive product, system and process knowledge to act as a centre of expertise on contract hire to provide an effective service to the Retailer and Broker Network.

About You

A successful candidate for this role should have the following:
  • Ability to meet customer expectations
  • Oral and written expression skills
  • Oral and written comprehension
  • Persuasive skills
  • Listening skills
  • Strong communication skills/very good dialectical skills
  • Ability to analyse a problem and quickly find the most effective solution
Diversity and Inclusion

There is a real power in being different. We believe in creating a diverse and inclusive culture where each one of our employees can bring their authentic self to work, thrive, be creative and feel empowered to reach their full potential.

Successful applicants will be required to pass a credit and criminal record check - the cost of this will be met by us.

Adecco acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers. The Adecco Group UK & Ireland is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

By applying for this role your details will be submitted to Adecco. Our Candidate Privacy Information Statement explains how we will use your information - please copy and paste the following link in to your browser https://www.adecco.co.uk/candidate-privacy

title: Administrator
description:
Job Description


We're looking for an Administrator to join our clients Highways Lighting team based in Derby.

Here you'll be responsible for carrying out a variety of administration tasks and providing excellent service to the customers. You will assist in the preparation and management of documentation, ensure effective programming of work to meet customer and company timescales and maintain accurate records. Not only will you liaise with a variety of customers, you'll also build relationships with colleagues across the Highways Lighting and the wider business.

Key Activities:

  • Provide administrative support and assist in document management.
  • Ensure efficient work scheduling and maintain high customer service standards.
  • Maintain accurate records and foster strong relationships with staff and customers.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Deliver high-quality and customer-focused services.
  • Support employees, maintain company procedures, and gather data.
  • Prioritise health, safety, and environmental concerns.
  • Improve operational processes and respect confidentiality.

Key Skill Requirements:

  • 2 years administration experience
  • Relevant business qualification (e.g., NVQ level 2 Business Administration).
  • Previous customer service experience.
  • Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
  • Organisational and numerical skills.
  • Proficiency in PC-based systems and adaptability.

Rullion celebrates and supports diversity and is committed to ensuring equal opportunities for both employees and applicants.

title: Database Administrator
description:
£25-26k salary
Based - Nuneaton, Warwicks, CV10
Mon - Fri 9am - 5pm
Hybrid working option once training has been completed
Advanced Excel experience essential

Role:
The Database Administrator is pivotal in working towards continuous improvement and therefore making
the business more successful. An ability to analyse and manipulate large and complex excel data sets
is essential, including monitoring and entering of information onto the internal database system accurately
and efficiently. The role requires a strong capability in interpreting complex packaging weights,
packaging levels and different material types.

Duties:The Database Administrator will:
  • Analyse and manipulate large excel data sets
  • Manage and develop established supplier relationships
  • Develop a sound understanding of packaging data, packaging levels and material types
  • Ensure the collection of the accurate information to maintain the packaging database
  • Collaborate with suppliers extensively via phone and email
  • Work closely alongside colleagues to build strong working relationships with team members, customers,
and suppliers

Skills:
Good depth of outlook, MS Word and Excel technical knowledge (Conditional Formatting, Vlookup,
SUMIF,Pivot tables, running of set macros)
Analytical and problem-solving approach with previous data gathering and reporting experience
Highly numerate and able to analyse complex information
High standard of data accuracy and attention to detail
Excellent customer-focussed approach
Excellent communication skills, both verbally and written
Organised with the ability to manage and prioritise own workload to multi-task and work to deadlines
Previous office-based experience within customer focused role
Previous data entry and database experience
Adecco acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers. The Adecco Group UK & Ireland is an Equal Opportunities Employer.
By applying for this role your details will be submitted to Adecco. Our Candidate Privacy Information Statement explaining how we will use your information is available on our website.

title: Business Administrator
description:
Salary 1
£25,752 - £27,116 Pro-rata
Number of jobs available 1
2
Detail of reserve list 1
12 Months
Region 1
East Midlands
City/Town 1
Market Harborough
Building/Site 1
HM Prison Gartree, LE16 7RP
Grade 1
AO
Organisation Grade for HMPPS 1
Band 3
Post Type 1
Permanent
Working Pattern 1
Part Time
Role Type 1
Administration / Corporate Support
Job description 1

Organisation Level Delivery - The jobs at this level will be task focused delivering defined activity or services.

Overview

Job holders within this Group Profile provide administrative support to managers and frontline staff by undertaking transactional work in a particular area.

The job holder is expected to be competent in their area of work, any specific qualifications or training required will be detailed in the relevant job description.

This is a non operational role which may involve contact with prisoners depending on their area of work.

This role has no line management responsibilities.

Characteristics

Typical tasks associated with this Group Profile include:

  • Organise, produce and maintain accurate records for area of work
  • Act as contact point for all communications to the team. Prioritise and distribute communications to the appropriate person or relevant department in establishment
  • Complete monitoring returns for area of work
  • Input requisitions on to the finance database and process requisitions for defined area of work
  • Co-ordinate any awareness sessions for area of work
  • Prepare paperwork for checking by manager, conducting initial checks as required
  • Correspond with relevant stakeholders and agencies to ensure that they are aware of information so that information is adequately shared
  • Maintain and check establishment databases, manual filing systems and logs of information, responding within agreed timescales and producing reports as required
  • Collate information relating to relevant Service Delivery Indicators (SDI's)
  • Act as secretary to meetings as required including organising agenda, taking, distributing minutes and action points

Job Descriptions relating to this Group Profile

The job holder once in post will be in matched to a job description; a sample list is shown below. The post is rotational so the job holder could during their career carry out the role of different job descriptions.

  • Business Administrator : Activity Hub
  • Business Administrator : Business Hub
  • Business Administrator : Equality
  • Business Administrator : Estates
  • Business Administrator : Management Coordinator
  • Business Administrator : Offender Management Hub
  • Business Administrator : People Hub
  • Business Administrator : Programmes
  • Business Administrator : Psychology
  • Business Administrator : Safe Decent and Secure
  • Business Administrator : Safer Custody
  • Business Administrator : Security Intelligence Collator
  • Business Administrator : Substance Misuse and Drug Strategy
  • Business Administrator : Healthcare
  • Business Administrator : Observation, Categorisation and Allocation (OCA)
  • Business Administrator : Establishment Television Systems
  • Business Administrator: Mobilisation, Transition and Transformation Administration Support
  • Business Administrator: Regional Admin support Wales
  • Business Administrator: Regional Estates Team
  • Business Administrator: Safe Decent and Secure Benchmark
  • Business Administrator: Equality Benchmark
  • Business Administrator: Safer Custody Benchmark
  • Business Administrator: Resettlement Worker Benchmark
  • Business Administrator: OMU Benchmark
  • Business Administrator: Regional Admin Support (North East)
  • Business Administrator: Regime Development


Essential Skills/ Qualifications/ Accreditation/ Registration

  • Job holders must complete specific training in their specialism once they take up post.
  • An ability to fulfil all spoken aspects of the role with confidence through the medium of English or (where specified in Wales) Welsh

Behaviours

  • Changing and Improving
  • Communicating and Influencing
  • Working Together
  • Managing a Quality Service
  • Delivering at Pace
Additional Information 1

Working Arrangements & Further Information

The MoJ offers Hybrid Working arrangements where business need allows. This is an informal, non-contractual form of flexible working that blends working from your base location, different MoJ sites and / or from home (please be aware that this role can only be worked in the UK and not overseas). Some roles will not be suitable for Hybrid Working. Similarly, Hybrid Working will not suit everyone’s circumstances. Arrangements will be discussed and agreed with the successful candidate(s) and subject to regular review.

For nationally advertised roles, the successful candidate(s) will be appointed to a MoJ office location, which may include their nearest Justice Collaboration Centre or Justice Satellite Office. This will be discussed and agreed on the completion of pre-employment checks.

Some of MoJ’s terms and conditions of service are changing as part of Civil Service reform. The changes will apply to staff joining MoJ who are new to the Civil Service. Staff joining MoJ from other civil service employers will transfer onto the new MoJ terms if they are already on 'modernised' terms in their current post or onto 'unmodernised' MoJ terms if they are on 'unmodernised' terms at their current post. Details will be available if an offer is made.

Standard working hours for this post are 37 hours per week excluding breaks which are unpaid.

If you are a current NPS employee, this vacancy may be available on a Loan basis for up to 2 years. Applications are invited from suitable qualified staff.

The Loan/Secondment is subject to the approval of the selected candidate's Business Unit, which should be obtained before confirmation of appointment.

Benefits

Annual Leave

  • The holiday year runs from 1 March. If you work a non standard work pattern your leave entitlement may be expressed in either hours or days as appropriate. Leave entitlement is calculated on a pro-rata basis and you will be advised of your actual entitlement on appointment. If you were appointed internally and your leave was previously calculated in days, this will continue to be the case.

Bank, Public and Privilege Holidays

  • You are entitled to 9 days (66 hours 36 minutes) in recognition of bank, public and privilege holidays. These hours are added to your annual leave allowance. There is a requirement to work some public and bank holidays subject to your shift pattern and the operational needs of the establishment

Pension

  • The Civil Service offers a choice of two pension schemes, giving you the flexibility to choose the pension that suits you best.

Work Life Balance

HM Prison & Probation Service (HMPPS) is keen to encourage alternative working arrangements. Work life balance provides greater opportunities for staff to work more flexibly wherever managers and establishments can accommodate requests to do so. HMPPS offers flexible working subject to completion of a satisfactory probationary period and NVQ

Season Ticket Advance

  • After two months’ service, you’ll be eligible to apply for a season ticket advance to purchase a quarterly or longer-period season ticket for travel between home and your place of work

Childcare Vouchers

For any moves across the Civil Service may have implications on your ability to carry on claiming childcare vouchers

Training

HMPPS is committed to staff development and offers a range of training and development opportunities, including areas such as Equality and Diversity, Dealing with Challenging Behaviour, Suicide Prevention and Anti Bullying Programmes

  • There are opportunities to access promotion programmes and HMPPS provides a variety of training appropriate to individual posts
  • All staff receive security and diversity training and an individual induction programme into their new roles

Eligibility

  • All candidates are subject to security and identity checks prior to taking up post
  • All external candidates are subject to 6 months probation. Internal candidates are subject to probation if they have not already served a probationary period within HMPPS
  • All staff are required to declare whether they are a member of a group or organisation which the HMPPS considers to be racist

Working for the Civil Service

The Civil Service Code sets out the standards of behaviour expected of civil servants.

We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles. Should you feel that the recruitment process has breached the recruitment principles you are able to raise a formal complaint in the following order

  • To Shared Service Connected Ltd (0845 241 5358 (Monday to Friday 8am - 6pm) or e mail Moj-recruitment-vetting-enquiries@gov.sscl.com);
  • To Ministry of Justice Resourcing team (resourcing-management-office@justice.gov.uk);
  • To the Civil Service Commission (details available here)

The Civil Service embraces diversity and promotes equal opportunities. As a Disability Confident employer, MoJ are committed to providing everyone with the opportunity to demonstrate their skills, talent and abilities, by making adjustments throughout all elements of the recruitment process and in the workplace. MoJ are able to offer an interview to disabled candidates who meet the minimum selection criteria, except in a limited number of campaigns.

You will be able to request reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process within the application form. If you need additional help completing the application form, please contact the SSCL Recruitment Enquiries Team.

We encourage applications from people from all backgrounds and aim to have a workforce that represents the wider society that we serve. We pride ourselves on being an employer of choice. We champion diversity, inclusion and wellbeing and aim to create a workplace where everyone feels valued and a sense of belonging. To find out more about how we do this visit: https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/ministry-of-justice/about/equality-and-diversity.

Interview dates 1
To be confirmed
Closing Date:

27/02/2024, 23:55 hours.

Contact information 1

If you require any assistance please call 0345 241 5358 (Monday to Friday 8am - 6pm) or e mail Moj-recruitment-vetting-enquiries@gov.sscl.com.

Please quote the job reference - 84439.

Success Profiles

Success Profiles will enable a fairer and more inclusive method of recruitment by enabling us to assess the range of experiences, abilities, strengths, behaviours and technical/professional skills required for different roles. This flexible approach to recruitment focuses more on finding the right candidate for the specific role. To find out more about Success Profiles to support your application please click here for further guidance.

if you feel that your application has not been treated in line with the Civil Service Recruitment Principles, please contact SSCL (Moj-recruitment-vetting-enquiries@gov.sscl.com) in the first instance

We have provided detail of the assessment stages and areas being assessed to help you prepare for completing your application form, and to advise of what will be assessed following this, if you successfully pass the application stage.


Application form stage assessments

Behaviours
Changing and Improving - 250 word limit
Communicating and Influencing - 250 word limit
Working Together - 250 word limit
Managing a Quality Service - 250 word limit
Delivering at Pace - 250 word limit

Interview stage assessments

There is 1 interview stage for this vacancy.
Behaviours
Changing and Improving
Communicating and Influencing
Working Together
Managing a Quality Service
Delivering at Pace
Strengths may also be assessed at interview but these are not shared in advance.

A Great Place to Work for Veterans

The "Making the Civil Service a Great Place to work for veterans" initiative includes a guaranteed interview scheme to those who meet the minimum criteria to provide eligible former members of the Armed Forces with opportunities to secure rewarding jobs. Allowing veterans to continue to serve their country, and to bring highly skilled individuals with a broad range of experience into the Civil Service in an environment, which recognises and values your previous service in the Armed Forces.
For further details about the initiative and eligibility requirements visit : https://www.gov.uk/government/news/making-the-civil-service-a-great-place-to-work-for-veterans

Redeployment Interview Scheme

Civil Service departments are expected to explore redeployment opportunities before making an individual redundant. The MoJ are committed, as part of the Redeployment Interview Scheme, to providing opportunities to those who are 'at risk of redundancy'.

MoJ are able to offer an interview to eligible candidates who meet the minimum selection criteria, except in a limited number of campaigns. Candidate's will not be eligible for the Redeployment Interview Scheme if they are applying on promotion.

This job is broadly open to the following groups:

  • UK nationals
  • nationals of the Republic of Ireland
  • nationals of Commonwealth countries who have the right to work in the UK
  • nationals of the EU, Switzerland, Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein and family members of those nationalities with settled or pre-settled status under the European Union Settlement Scheme (EUSS) (opens in a new window) https://www.gov.uk/settled-status-eu-citizens-families
  • nationals of the EU, Switzerland, Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein and family members of those nationalities who have made a valid application for settled or pre-settled status under the European Union Settlement Scheme (EUSS)
  • individuals with limited leave to remain or indefinite leave to remain who were eligible to apply for EUSS on or before 31 December 2020
  • Turkish nationals, and certain family members of Turkish nationals, who have accrued the right to work in the Civil Service

Further information on nationality requirements (opens in a new window) https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/nationality-rules

title: Administrator
description:
Administrator Ref code: NYG99094619 Customer Service & Call Centre, Office Support £10.81 - 11.76 per hour Leicester, Leicestershire, England Temporary / Interim Hybrid Working SF Recruitment are recruiting an Administrator to join their client who is Loughborough Based. This is a hybrid position where you are required in the office 3/5 days, this post is suitable for individuals who have an eye for detail and enjoy administrative tasks. This is initially offered as a temporary role and the salary for this position is £10.81 - £11.76 per hour and this will be for initially a 10 week period, possibility to extend for right person (£20,800 - £22,630) The role is working within a busy HR function and requires you to provide an effective and efficient customer focus for the support of the HR team. Duties include: - Ensuring records are maintained, checking and ensuring electronic files are aligned - Inputting Data in to the system - Support Right to work checks - Processing and managing compliance - Onboarding - Administering of contracts and handling their queries - Handling inbox Key Skills and Experience: - Experience in data administration - Confident telephone manner - Ability to communicate well with customers - Accurate and timely working ability - Administration experience is beneficial as well as an interest in compliance If you are available to start immediately I would love to speak to you!


Natalie Gear

Email Natalie
Call Natalie

title: Administrator
description:
Administrator Ref code: EYM99094855 Customer Service & Call Centre, Office Support £ 22000 per year Thurmaston, Leicestershire, England Permanent Hybrid Working Job Title: Procurement Administrator Contract: Full Time, Permanent Location: Thurmaston, Leicester Salary: £22,000 Start Date: ASAP - Happy to work around notice periods Hybrid working options. 3 days office based. The Commercial Division at SF Recruitment are currently recruiting for a Purchasing Administrator for a growing company based in Leicestershire, LE4 area on a full time, permanent basis. As an Administrator working in the procurement department, you will report directly into the Procurement and Sales Manager, ensuring that all tasks are completed within agreed company timeframes. Your daily responsibilities as an Administrator in the procurement team will include: - Raising and preparing purchase orders - sending order requests to suppliers, updating records and following up with vendors to check if orders are being processed. - Liaising between internal UK sites, ensuring that they have the correct levels of materials, and each site accounts are maintained accurately updated. - Maintaining accurate stock level reports. - Liaising with department managers to determine requirements, sourcing suppliers of goods and services and inviting tenders. - Tracking of low supplies and ensuring orders are being made in advance of stock running out. - Working collaboratively with suppliers to resolve the issues that may arise with shipments or orders being incorrect or late. - Providing general administration support as and when required to the procurement and inventory team. The successful candidate will ideally have some of the above listed experience, however, this is not essential. What is key, is that you have strong attention to detail when inputting data and maintaining customer and supplier accounts. Ideally you will have knowledge or experience using Excel, however, training will be provided on all internal systems/databases. There is limited progression opportunities within this role, so ideally we are looking for somebody who wants to be a valued member of a successful team and reputable business in the UK. If you would like to find out more regarding the above position, please click '' with a copy of your up-to-date CV. Or alternatively, send across a copy of your CV to emaloney@sfrecruitment.com and I will be in contact.


Emma Maloney

Email Emma

description:

Main area
Finance & Procurement
Grade
Apprenticeships: Apprenticeship
Contract
Apprenticeship: 15 months
Hours
Full time - 37.5 hours per week (Mainly remote working from home plus office as required.)
Job ref
164-5850045
Site
Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust
Town
Nottingham
Salary
£10,296 £200 per week
Salary period
Yearly
Closing
25/02/2024 23:59

Job overview

If you are organised, like working with people & are interested in a career within the NHS, then this could be the job for you.

As the PMO Admin Assistant Apprentice you will be part of the Trust Programme Management Office (PMO), which comprises of a team of project professionals concerned with improving the successful delivery of projects by providing a range of Project & Programme Management services.

You will be enrolled on a paid for Level 3 Business Admin course and develop your skills whilst you provide an administrative support service to the Trust PMO Team and key Improvement Teams.

Currently, you will work mainly from home and partly work in the office.
Joining our team you’ll be responsible for general admin duties, providing diary management & meeting organisation, assisting with the preparation of documents for meetings and training events, produce minutes, reports and maintain databases as required.

You will need good communications skills and will be supported to develop lots of new skills. You will be an enthusiastic team player with good organisational skills. You will need to be well motivated & reliable. You will be able to understand and accurately convey verbal and written information and be able to remain calm under pressure. You will present a professional and polite attitude at all times.

We encourage you to learn and develop within your role and beyond!

Main duties of the job

In addition to the brief list above you must familiarise yourself with the full job description and person specification attached to this advert prior to applying.

Please note that the UK government require non-UK nationals to have lived in the UK for 3 years to be eligible for apprenticeship funding.

As the PMO Admin Assistant Apprentice, whilst working on your Level 3 Business Administration Qualification, you would develop your skills to support the Trust PMO Team and to Key Improvement Teams, including:

Undertaking general office duties

Diary management and meeting organisation

Provide admin for training programmes

Produce communications and website content

Working for our organisation

You will be working within the Trust PMO team.

We are a small and motivated team who oversee and support the successful delivery, change and improvement projects at NUH.

Within NUH we are the 'project management specialists' so you will get a wide view of different aspects of an acute hospital and application of
your admin skills in the context of project management.

Currently, we are mainly working from home and work partly in the office.

Joining this team will not only allow you to interact and gain knowledge from your professional peers, but will also equip you for future roles within the NHS. We are a friendly and hard-working team that support each other but we also trust each team member to be able to function independently.

Working with us will create opportunities to further build on your skills, whilst really making a difference to the NHS and the people we care for.

Detailed job description and main responsibilities

Working under the direction of the PMO System Administrator to develop skills to:

Provide diary management & meeting organisation for the Trust PMO team and Key Improvement Teams.

Deal with enquiries referring on as appropriate.

Provide configuration management for documentation within the PMO.

Assist with the preparation of documents for meetings and training events, photocopying, collating and distributing.

Compile Reports for programme meetings.

Attend meetings and subsequently produce & distribute notes and actions.

Maintain the PMO system and produce simple reports.

Provide ad hoc admin support to projects where deemed necessary.

Provide admin for the PMO training programmes.

Progress to more complex PMO duties to aid personal development and potential career opportunities.

Please refer to the job description and person specification attached to the advert for the full details of the vacancy.

Person specification

Training & Qualifications

Essential criteria

  • Good general education to GCSE standard.
  • Demonstrates a high level of computer literacy

Desirable criteria

  • Trained in Microsoft Excel & Access

Experience

Essential criteria

  • Experience of working in a team or group

Desirable criteria

  • Experience of working in an administrative setting
  • Experience of working in Healthcare

Communications and Relationships

Essential criteria

  • Communicates straightforward, factual information correctly and accurately
  • Listens carefully in order to understand the needs of others
  • Keeps information up to date, paying particular attention to detail
  • Recognises own role as part of a working team and helps others in the team

Planning and Organisation

Essential criteria

  • Able to plan own workload to deliver deadlines
  • Ability to prioritise
  • Demonstrates enthusiasm and self -confidence for work and is conscientious, always seeing a job through to completion

Physical Skills

Essential criteria

  • Standard keyboard use

Analytical and Judgment

Essential criteria

  • Able to work systematically and with an organised approach.

___________________________________________________________________________________

Come and join our wonderful team at NUH. We are big believers in diversity and welcome new ideas to help develop our team in order to deliver world class healthcare to the vast patient populations we serve. With endless personal development opportunities available, at the NUH we will endeavour to turn your job into a career!

We particularly welcome applications from people who identify as Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic, or Disabled, as we are striving to be better represented at NUH.

Closing Dates: Please submit your application form as soon as possible to avoid disappointment; we reserve the right to close vacancies prior to the published closing date if we receive a sufficient number of completed application forms.

Communication: All communication related to your application will be via the email address you have provided. Please ensure you check your email account including your junk email regularly.

Easy read application: if you have a disability and find it difficult to complete our online application form, you can apply via our easy read application which you can find on the intranet https://www.nuh.nhs.uk/easy-read-job-application

NUH are now able to offer application completion support and interview preparation support. Please follow the link to book onto our sessions: Support for NUH Job Applications

Salary: The quoted salary will be on a pro rata basis for part time workers.

Disability Confidence: All applicants who have declared a disability and who meet the essential criteria for the post will be shortlisted.

At Risk of redundancy: NHS employees within the East Midlands who are ‘at risk’ of redundancy will be given a preferential interview where they meet the essential criteria of the person specification.

International Recruitment: If you are applying for a role with us from outside of the UK then please read the guidance on applying for a health or social care job in the UK from abroad.

ID and Right to work checks: NUH authenticate ID and right to work documentation including passports and driving licenses through a system called Trust ID. NUH will scan your ID and right to work documentation in to the Trust ID system at your face to face ID appointment. The system will run a check against the key security features within your documentation. The system will provide us with an outcome of your check which will be stored securely on your personal file along with all other pre-employment check documentation.

Consent:

  • Transfer of information: If I have previous NHS service - I consent to the transfer of my Electronic Staff Record (ESR) data between this and other NHS Trusts. I also consent to the Occupational Health Department confidentially accessing my occupational health records from my current or previous employer in order to check the status of my vaccinations, immunisations s and screening tests as relevant to the post. I understand this is an automated process and the information will only be used for these purposes prior to me taking up the position at NUH.
  • Disclosure and Barring Service: Your post maybe subject to a DBS check which incur a cost dependent on the level of check required (£42.90 for enhanced and £22.90 for standard). I agree to reimburse Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust the cost of a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check if it is required (by deduction from first month’s pay). Should I decide to withdraw from my job offer, I agree to reimburse Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust the cost of the DBS check undertaken by cheque or other agreed method.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
We are looking for a part time adminitrator for our bridal shop, This role will be for between the hours of approx 9.30/10am - 2-2.30pm 2 days per week

You must have previous experience as an administrator.

The role will consist of the following duties:

- Provide administrative support to ensure efficient operation of the office

- Answer and direct phone calls in a polite and professional manner

- Scanning Contracts on to our systems

- Archiving

- Schedule and coordinate meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements for staff

- Prepare and distribute memos, emails, letters, and forms

- Maintain filing systems, both electronic and physical

- Perform data entry and update records as needed

- Manage inventory of office supplies and place orders when necessary

- Payment Chasing

You must have the following skills:

- Proficient in Google Suite (Docs, Sheets, Slides) and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

- Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines

- Excellent clerical skills including typing, data entry, and record keeping

- Excellent phone etiquette and customer service skills

title: Business Administrator
description:
Job Role: Business Administrator

Location: Head Office, Coventry

Salary: Depending on experience

Contract Type: Part Time - 16 hours a week

Big Parking is a leading Events Company who manages an event from the planning stage to the implementation of the big day. We specialise in car park and traffic management with our in house built ANPR system to make ingress and egress as swift as possible. We work and have worked at some of the largest events in the world including, Rugby World Cup, Champions League Final, Olympics, Premiership Football, Premiership Rugby, Championship Football, Music Festivals, Concerts and many more!

Our head office is based on School Lane in Coventry. We are looking for an individual who wants to grow with us and develop their skills in our various roles.

We are actively seeking to recruit a Business Administrator to join the team. The role is a brilliant opportunity for someone who is seeking to move into events or develop themselves within an exciting team.

The duties and responsibilities of this role include;

  • Helping coordinate staffing requirements for events
  • Assisting in the planning and preparation of events
  • Dealing with calls and emails from customers and helping them with their enquiries
  • Maintaining paper and electronic files
  • Dealing with suppliers and keeping track of inventory such as stationary
  • Updating weekly boards with upcoming events
  • Diary management for yourself and your manager
  • Researching travel and accommodation for staff
  • Participating in meetings and taking minutes
  • Updating our client websites with event information

For this role we will require you to have;

  • Previous experience in office administration
  • Proficient in the use of IT including admin software
  • Strong organisational skills and the ability to multi-task
  • Good written/verbal communication skills to all business levels
  • Able to use initiative and have the ability to work to process
  • Ability to work towards and achieving deadlines
  • Flexibility in working hours to meet our clients needs

If you have any questions or queries please do not hesitate in calling us on 02476 997605.

We look forward to receiving your application.

Schedule:

title: Sales Administrator
description:
Are you curious about us? Because we’re curious about you!

The Curious Guys Limited is a national wealth management company based in a splendid Grade 2 listed building in Loughborough. We are seeking an ambitious Sales Administrator to help us with three companies:

● The Curious Guys Limited - Wealth Management and Tax Planning business

● Oak Shields Estate Planning Limited - Estate Planning (Wills, Powers of Attorney etc)

● Three Sirens Limited - An Online Department Store

If you are an experienced Sales Administrator who is creative, proactive and free-thinking, we'd love to hear how you could assist our busy Sales Director and Sales Department. It’s an extremely varied role in a vivacious team; every day is different and we laugh A LOT.

What we expect from the candidate:

  • The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of being a fully-fledged Sales Administrator and should be able to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Responsibilities will include assisting the Sales Director with regular tasks, liaising with the large team of Clients and Introducers, communicating with suppliers, assisting with monthly sales targets.
  • Providing administrative support to the Sales team.
  • This is a small team, so interaction with your colleagues will be critical.
  • Entering information onto business systems, such as the CRM, and keeping these up to date.
  • Completing product applications and other documents with accuracy.
  • Have a commercial perspective.
  • Providing cover for departmental colleagues as required.
  • Any other duties that may be required from time to time for the smooth running of the businesses.

Skills and Qualifications:

  • 2+ years' experience as a Sales Administrator or in a Sales environment.
  • Desired Education Level:5+ GCSE’s grades at A - C (9 - 5) or equivalent.
  • A high standard of written English is essential.
  • Intermediate standard of spreadsheet software experience required.
  • Excellent attention to detail.
  • Ability to clearly, accurately and appropriately communicate with clients in writing, in person, and via telephone.
  • Be able to maintain strict confidentiality.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite although Google for Business is the preferred company software.
  • Time and Diary Management. We use a communal diary which can become hectic, and this role is required to oversee the Director’s diary.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team to achieve goals.
  • Problem solving and multi-tasking.
  • Prioritising.
  • Reporting and scheduling.
  • Minute-taking.

Additional Job Information:

  • 15% staff discount from our online department store.
  • Personal Costco annual membership* (T&C Apply).
  • Hours: 37.5 per week, 10am to 6pm.
  • Extended Christmas/New Year break (2 weeks) - paid or unpaid dependent upon holiday accrued.
  • Mileage and expenses are paid at the standard rate.
  • Holidays: 22 days with one day extra per year served, to a maximum of 25, plus statutory bank holidays.
  • On-site free car parking and secure bike rack.
  • Full, clean driving licence desirable.

title: Administrator
description:
Are you an experienced administrator with great attention to detail, able to multi-task and looking for a new opportunity in the Tamworth area? If yes, look no further!

Benefits include 31 days holiday including all Bank Holidays plus the option to purchase an additional 5 days at a salary sacrifice, a Healthcare Cash Plan (Discounts available and access to a 24-hour Doctor) and Access to Employee Assistance Programme (EAP).

You will be working for a well-established organisation based within the manufacturing and distribution industry who have been established for 30+ years based in Tamworth – Free car parking is available. Hours of work are Monday to Friday, between the hours of 8.30 am to 5 pm, working 37.5 hours per week.

You will be joining a fast-paced team, offering full administration support and cover to the Customer Service department.

As the Administrator, general duties will include:

  • Full admin support, liaising with many departments across the business.
  • Running and analysing reports to spot trends and proactively resolve issues.
  • Order processing for marketing point of sale boards (stock and bespoke)
  • Track and report to relevant departments on any marketing board orders
  • Quality replacement orders
  • Booking in of deliveries for key customers
  • Processing customs declarations cover
  • Entering of orders and debit notes on to in house system cover
  • Switchboard overflow and full reception cover
  • Monitoring and ordering stationery for head office
  • Scanning and validating documents on to our archive system
  • Organising collections with carriers for returns/quality department
  • Monitoring and reporting on arranged collections
  • Overseeing carrier daily delivery reports. Corresponding with carriers, Customer Service and warehouse to get a resolution on all failed deliveries Actioning all claims, cross referencing carrier invoice with our claims to ensure complete with the admin team
  • Any other ad-hoc office administration duties as and when required to support customer service and other departments

As the Administrator, you will have:

  • Previous administration and/or reception experience would be preferred
  • Experience in Customer Service Administration functions, would be beneficial, however, not essential
  • Good Excel knowledge is desirable
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and organisational skills
  • Computer literate with knowledge of Microsoft Office including Excel and Sage would be advantageous but training will be given
  • You may have experience of the following: Administrator, Office Assistant, Office Coordinator, Customer Service Assistant, Customer Service Advisor, Communications Assistant, Office Assistant, Call Centre Operative, Contact Centre Operative, Membership Co-ordinator, Customer Service Admin or Helpdesk and Contact Centre Administrator

Salary is £23,000 per annum depending on experience plus a fantastic range of benefits.

title: IT Support
description:
IT Support Analyst & Office 365 Lead

Circa £38,000

Coventry, On-site


Who we are?


At LEVC we have been transformed from a traditional vehicle manufacturer of the iconic black cab, into a modern electric vehicle company with high performing tech. We operate a green global footprint, with offices and operations across Europe and key overseas markets. The TX electric taxi heralded a new generation of personal transport, bringing zero-emissions-capable operation to cities around the world.

Why work at LEVC?

Our talented team are dedicated to driving green transport solutions that will accelerate the journey to cleaner cities. With our principle ‘Sustainable Innovation’ at the heart of everything we do, we’re proud of what we’ve achieved already and excited to bring and develop talent into the EV industry. 2024 promises to be another exciting year with all the foundations in place to embark on an ambitious growth journey.

About the role

The IT Support Analyst & Office 365 Lead will provide 1st & 2nd line support and additionally, take a lead in the O365 User Administrator duties. Responsible for providing technical support and maintaining the efficient operation of our information technology systems, with a focus on O365 administration, including SharePoint, Exchange Server, and Active Directory. You will serve as the first point of contact for all IT-related issues and play a critical role in ensuring the smooth functioning of our technology infrastructure. This role requires technical, communication and collaboration skills, to work effectively with both business and IT Teams.

Help design and drive O365 strategy and usage across the company.

Take a lead role in O365, administering user accounts, permissions, and access rights for including SharePoint, Exchange Server, and Active Directory.

Provide 1st& 2nd line support for all IT-related issues and inquiries from employees across the organization

Document and maintain accurate records of support requests, resolutions, and system configurations


Experience to succeed


Relevant experience in a 1st & 2ndline computer & associated service role

ITIL v4 Foundation desirable

Good communication skills

Microsoft accreditation in Windows 10/11 &/or Office 365 are desirable

Experienced supporting a sizeable, fast-moving business

Knowledge and experience in the fields of collaborative services, especially the configuration & optimisation of smart devices/mobile computing, video conferencing systems & printing


What we can offer you

Competitive salary


25 days’ annual leave plus bank holidays


Life insurance, cycle to work scheme, and a salary sacrifice pension scheme

Health and wellbeing support, including Medicash health care scheme, Employee Assistance Programme, available 24/7 365 days and network of mental health first aiders.

Salary extras giving you discounts across various retailers (e.g supermarkets, eating out, and leisure activities.)

Modern offices with free parking and EV charging

Offices include use of onsite gym (Ansty location), subsidised canteens, regular companywide events

Dedicated Learning & Development team help you to unlock your potential through technical & behavioural training. Oh, and did we mention you can get access to LinkedIn Learning too!

At LEVC, whatever your role, you truly have the opportunity to join a team that helps you perform at your best.

title: Business Administrator
description:
Are you an experienced administrator looking to work within a growing and expanding business? If so, this role is for you!

Fidaris are pleased to partner with a market leader in their industry looking for an experienced administrator to support their growing sales team. Working within a busy function, this role will be integral to the company's growth and success throughout 2024.

The Person

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, capable of engaging effectively with team members, clients, and external partners.
  • Teamwork and collaborative ability
  • Strong team player with a proven track record of contributing to team success and maintaining a positive work environment.
  • Multi-tasking and flexibility
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously with a flexible approach to adapt to changing priorities.
  • Strong skills in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and familiarity with email and calendar management tools like Outlook. Additional proficiency in CRM systems is highly desirable.
  • Skilled in administrative tasks with proficiency in creating, managing, and adapting to new systems and procedures.

The Role

  • Act as a backbone for the Sales team, assisting in various day-to-day operational tasks.
  • Scheduling meetings, preparing sales materials, and co-ordinating communication between team members and clients.
  • Diligently manage the CRM system, ensuring all client information, sales quotes, and activities are up-to-date and accurately recorded.
  • Organising and participating in promotional events, preparing marketing materials, and supporting briefing outreach campaigns.
  • Regularly support compiling and analysing market data to provide actionable insights to the Business Development team.

The salary for this role is paying up to £28,000 plus benefits.

For more information, Apply Now!
