title: Helpdesk Manager
description:
We have an opportunity for a Helpdesk Administrator to join our busy team in the Estates department to cover a period of maternity leave until 31 October 2024.

The post holder will form part of the existing Helpdesk team and will be the first point of contact for all calls received from Trust staff, external customers and contractors regarding breakdowns, maintenance tasks, transport, portering jobs, mechanical repairs, incidents, equipment issues, new work requests, room bookings and hospitality.

You will provide a friendly and proactive service to customers raising job sheets, reconciling time records, as well as general administrative work to assist the Department including monitoring of contractors and raising purchase orders relating to their work.

Please note this post does not meet skill level required for a Skilled worker visa. Applicants requiring a Skilled Worker visa will usually need to be in a role which is at Band 3 or above, however please note not all Band 3 roles are capable of sponsorship. You can determine the likelihood of obtaining Sponsorship against the relevant skill and pay criteria here Immigration Rules - Immigration Rules Appendix Skilled Occupations - Guidance - GOV.UK (www.gov.uk)

With strong administrative skills and customer focus, you will be required to record accurate details of all calls using the CAFM (Computer Aided Facilities Management System (FSI Concept), demonstrating an efficient handling of each query which may be giving an update on how an issue/job is progressing and reassuring the caller that their job will be dealt with in a timely manner, ensuring the details are processed correctly and passed onto the appropriate team for action.

Nottinghamshire Healthcare employs over 10,000 colleagues who help #MakeADifference every day. We provide intellectual disability, mental health, community health, forensic and offender healthcare services across Nottinghamshire, Leicestershire, Lincolnshire and South Yorkshire. Care is delivered from over 120 sites within the community from acute settings and across low, medium and high secure environments including prisons.

As one of the largest mental health and community trusts in the East Midlands and one of the biggest employers in Nottinghamshire. We are also home to national and regional services such as the National High Secure Deaf Service and the Nottingham Centre for Transgender Health.

We are committed to flexible and agile working, including the opportunity to join our bank.

Your health and wellbeing is our priority and as such we invest significantly in this via our in-house Occupational Health Service, Staff Counselling Service and Health and Wellbeing Team.

We offer a number of employee-led staff networks, including Equality, Diversity and Inclusion (EDI) groups, our Green Champions Network, Freedom to Speak Up Network. Health and Wellbeing Champions Network and Menopause Champions. We provide care to a diverse range of communities and are passionate about supporting diversity and inclusion in the Trust.

If you believe in our values of Trust, Honesty, Respect, Compassion and Teamwork, then we would love to hear from you!

#TeamNottsHC

This role requires an experienced Helpdesk Administrator who is able to effectively communicate with internal and external departments, agencies and contractors whilst employing consistent and rigorous attention to detail and confidentiality with the ability to provide a pleasant and efficient response to a wide range of callers and enquiries on a daily basis. The post holder will work independently but also as part of a team and be expected to use their own initiative in all areas of their work.

You will need to have:
A good standard of general education to GCSE level or equivalent
Knowledge of a customer services environment
Experience of working in an office environment
Good telephone/customer services manner
Good communication skills
Self-motivation, enthusiasm and professionalism
Conversant with Microsoft office packages
Accurate keyboard skills
Able to work using your own initiative
Good organisational skills
Familiar with electronic diary systems
Positive attitude

Flexibility with working on helpdesk and administrative duties.

title: Business Administrator
description:
We are looking for a ‘can-do’ person who is organised, enjoys administrative activities and works well with a diverse range of tasks. As a Business Administrator Apprentice you will be an important part of our team working on a diverse range of activities where your output can make a real difference. Being supported and mentored by our Production Controller, your typical day will involve general office administration, ,such as processing sales orders, raising purchase orders & reception duties.


If you feel you have the right attributes and are willing to commit to a full time Apprenticeship, whereby you will commit to the 20% off-the-job training requirements alongside your normal day-to-day job. Then get in touch....


Background Information:

ADS Laser is a family run business and is the premier metal laser cutting, precision folding, fabricating and finishing company in the U.K. From Bespoke to Volume Solutions, we have the capability of working from design through to project completion on a wide range of projects from intricately designed Point of Sale materials to volume components. These find their way into Rail systems for Siemens, Trains for Tfl, Apartment Balconies for Sapphire and sales aids for L’Ancome Fragrances. Our highly skilled and happy team is important to our business and that of our customers. This translates into exceptional service and quality. Since founding, ADS has grown tremendously YOY and continues to grow from continuing investment in machinery, infrastructure and in highly-skilled people, employing over 95 in an 87,000 square feet unit whilst possessing the very latest technology.


DUE TO CONTINUED EXPANSION WE’RE HIRING…

Vacant Job Position: Business Administrator Apprentice


Key Responsibilities:


  • Provide administrative support to the operations administration team.
  • Answer calls from customers and being the point of contact for any questions and queries.
  • Support and learn all aspects of sales order entry, being able to help during busy periods and holidays.
  • Support and learn all aspects of purchasing, being able to put on orders and speak with suppliers to receive best price and delivery.
  • Chase proforma payments from customers and liaising with the accounts department.
  • Work closely with the buyer to establish a supplier tier system
  • Provide cover for reception during breaks, lunch and holidays.
  • Support and learn the role of a general administrator to be able to help during busy periods and holidays.
  • Assist in the reporting of KPI’s along with the guidance of Production Controller and the Buyer.
  • General administration and data entry duties.

Be proficient in the use of Microsoft Office to complete daily administration tasks, using Outlook to email suppliers, customers and internal colleagues and Excel to produce reports to be sent to suppliers such as supplier evaluation.


Skills, Experience & Personal Attributes:

  • Good Communication Skills- Building good relationships is fundamental to the delivery of services.
  • Organisational Skills- The ability to manage your own workload and to work to team and project deadlines.
  • Teamwork and Cooperation- The ability to work flexibly in a team and contribute to a supportive work environment.
  • Adaptability and flexibility- Apprentices work in fluid, fast-paced & exciting environments.

Benefits of Working for ADS:

  • Non contractual quarterly bonus scheme
  • Above statutory holiday entitlement and additional service linked holiday
  • Christmas shutdown for one week
  • 40 hour working week, days
  • Onsite Gym
  • Pension scheme
  • Commitment to investing in training and development
  • Company workwear and PPE provided
  • Onsite parking
  • Staff canteen
  • Employee Assistance Programme

STRICTLY NO AGENCIES

title: Service Administrator
description:
Services Administrative Officer:
Full / Part Time: Up to 37.5hours

First Steps ED is an evidence-based charity based in the Midlands whose impact is much wider dedicated to supporting individuals and their families impacted by eating disorders. We are seeking a highly motivated and organised Administrative Officer to join our multidisciplinary team. This role will provide essential administrative assistance across various areas within the organisation, including supporting the administrative lead with the management of Peer Support Workshops and Guided Self-Help services, and analysis and reporting of impact and outcomes. Additionally, the role will involve general office duties including engaging with our clients and stakeholders to ensure the smooth operation of our charity.

What will the role involve?

  • Support the service leads.
  • Workshop Management: Provide administrative support for our workshops, including organising participant registration, liaising with workshop facilitators, preparing materials, and ensuring smooth logistical arrangements.
  • General Office Duties: Undertake various administrative tasks, including answering phone calls, responding to emails, and maintaining office supplies and the environment at Woburn House.
  • Collaborative Support: Work closely with other team members to provide administrative support in various areas, as needed, fostering a positive and cooperative working environment.
  • Manage referrals from our NHS partners.
  • First point of contact and allocating the service user to the relevant staff member and updating the database.
  • Analysis and reporting working in support of service line managers.

What skills, knowledge and experience are we looking for?

  • Previous experience in an administrative business support role is preferred.
  • Excellent organisational and time management skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritise work effectively.
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy in all administrative tasks.
  • Proficient computer skills, including MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and familiarity with database management systems.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to interact professionally with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Ability to work independently as well as part of a team, demonstrating a proactive and self-motivated approach.
  • Sensitivity and empathy towards individuals affected by eating disorders is highly valued.
  • Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and work under pressure when required.

Qualifications:

  • GCSE grades A to C minimum.

Why should you join First Steps ED?

We are a registered charity who are passionate and active in understanding how to support those whose lives are affected by eating difficulties and disorders. We’re an organisation and charity that really values our people and we’re immensely proud of our community of staff, workers, volunteers, and befrienders who have created a culture based on compassion and raising each other up. We thrive on collaboration and relish our monthly development days where you’ll be encouraged to bring your ideas for service improvement and innovation to our agenda for growth. You’ll fit right in if you’re driven by making a difference to lives impacted by poor mental health, satisfied with working autonomously from home, and great at juggling priorities and being part of our multi-award-winning team.

  • 28 days holiday, plus bank holidays (pro-rata)
  • A supportive working environment
  • Progression and Training, as well as monthly organisational development days

[Please note: for safeguarding purposes, all roles will require a DBS check.)

A bit more about us:
First Steps ED are an evidence-based eating disorder charity based in Derby and serving communities throughout the UK. We have been innovators in eating disorder support since 2004 and passionate about early intervention, prevention, and quality-assured support for those struggling with eating difficulties and disorders, offering hope, opportunities and choice to those in recovery. We define our values as our 5-P’s:

1. Passion
We are inspired by our service users and stakeholders and passionate about making a difference.

2. People
As a team, we are empathic, understanding, and non-judgmental which flows through every single service and support pathway we offer.

3. Potential
We recognise potential, both in our team and our service users. We understand the importance of acknowledgement and achievement as we continue to develop.

4. Partnership
We are inclusive, open and value all experience and contribution which is why we our team adopt a supportive, entrepreneurial working environment that fosters collaboration.

5. Professional
We are ethical, accountable expert leaders in eating disorders and mental health.

To apply for this position, please submit your CV and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in joining First Steps ED. Applications should be emailed to amy@firststepsed.co.uk

First Steps ED is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
About this Role

About this role

Administration Assistant

Farndon Fields Primary School

Grade 5 Pay Point 7-8 (£23,117 - £23,504).

20 hours per week, 39 weeks per year. Monday to Friday 11:30am - 15:30pm

Permanent

PLEASE NOTE: We do not accept applications via Indeed. Please go to My New Term to review the job description and person specification, and to submit your application - https://mynewterm.com/jobs/138345/EDV-2024-FFPS-08446.

Farndon Fields Primary School are seeking to appoint a highly organised and motivated Administrator to work within or successful school team to provide confidential, effective, efficient and flexible administrative support to the school and wider community with minimal supervision.

Why choose Farndon Fields?

It is our mission to provide our pupils with a stimulating and engaging curriculum in a safe and secure environment. We believe that emotional wellbeing is essential in developing positive behaviour and academic success. We value and respect all individuals and our ethos gives our community the confidence to achieve their full potential and to be the best that they can be, and in doing so make a positive contribution to society.

Main Duties and Responsibilities

  • To provide a courteous reception service, resolving routine queries and those relating to our area of work and calling an appropriate person to assist where necessary.
  • To monitor and maintain the school e-mail account on a daily basis, responding directly to routine enquiries, filtering marketing information and/or forwarding e-mails to the appropriate person.
  • To check deliveries to the school against the delivery note / order, noting any discrepancies and reporting them to the supplier in a timely manner.
  • To process routine documentation and check for completeness and errors, taking appropriate steps to resolve basic/routine issues and referring more complex queries to the appropriate person.

We are looking for someone who has:

  • Level 2 qualifications in Mathematics/numeracy and English/literacy OR able to demonstrate numeracy/literacy skills sufficient for the demands of the post.
  • Experience of responding to members of the public in a working setting.
  • Knowledge of child protection procedures.
  • Ability to use standard office equipment and software

Please refer to the Job Description and Person Specification attached to support with your application.

If you have any questions about this role or would like to visit the school, please contact the school office on 01858 464744 or office@dsatfarndonfields.org.

PLEASE NOTE: We do not accept applications via Indeed. Please go to My New Term to review the job description and person specification, and to submit your application - https://mynewterm.com/jobs/138345/EDV-2024-FFPS-08446.

What we offer:

  • Flexible working options
  • Support for continuous professional development in the role
  • Opportunities to visit other organisations for professional learning
  • Highly committed and motivated Team
  • A role which has the opportunity to make a real difference whilst having fun
  • Free car parking
  • Annual incremental pay increases with the pay scale range
  • A defined benefit pension scheme
  • Employee Assistance Programme - EAP
  • Employee self-service portal.
  • Eyecare voucher scheme.
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Retail discounts
  • Dental support
  • Gym discount
  • Be an integral member of the team in a vibrant school
  • Create an outstanding learning environment for the success of all of our children
  • Play a significant part in continuing to develop our school
  • Be part of a wider community of Discovery Schools Trust
  • Excellent opportunities for personal and career development
  • An established Central Services Team who support schools and wider colleagues

More about Discovery Schools Trust

Discovery Schools Trust is dedicated to improving learning and teaching by creating a culture that promotes excellence. The needs of all children are placed at the heart of all decision making regardless of the school they attend. Teaching and learning excellence are shared through learning networks, sharing of ideas and materials as well as leading practitioners between schools. Discovery has developed a school improvement system which focuses on improving outcomes for all children. It also places staff development, talent management and succession planning at the heart of achieving outstanding organisations.

Please note that interviews for this position may be made earlier than the stated closing date if a suitable candidate is identified. Therefore, we encourage interested applicants to submit their applications promptly. Early submission will not only ensure consideration for the position but also increase the likelihood of being invited for an interview. We appreciate your understanding and look forward to receiving your application.

Safeguarding Statement: We are committed to safeguarding our pupils; therefore, the successful applicant will require an Enhanced Disclosure from the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) and references.

title: Administrator
description:
JOB TITLE: Administrator / PA to MD
LOCATION: Hinckley / Nuneaton / Atherstone
SALARY: £24,000 to £26,000

The COMPANY
Our client is a very well-established nationwide provider of business-critical services to thousands of SME organisations all over the UK for over 75 years. Our client is one of the UK's leading businesses in their field with 130,000 clients worldwide and have one of the best trained and rewarded staff in the industry. They are currently looking for Business Support Coordinator.
The ROLE
The successful Administrator/PA will be required to do the following:

  • To work alongside the Managing Director and assist with administrative work, minute taking, drafting letters etc.
  • To maintain office systems, including data management and filing.
  • To assist with incoming calls when the Managing Director is unavailable.
  • To produce documentation relating to project work, where required.
  • To arrange travel and accommodation where required.
  • To delegate work in the absence of the Managing Director.
  • To organise and maintain the Managing Director's diary and make appointments, including any print outs required for scheduled meetings and preparation of meeting agendas where required.
  • To assist the Managing Director and management team with any internal reporting, the preparation of reports for the Board Meetings, MLI Meeting etc.

CANDIDATE
Our client is looking for a strong Administrator/PA/Business Coordinator with the following experience and attributes:

  • Excellent word processing and IT skills, including knowledge of Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint.
  • High level of confidentiality, integrity and reliability.
  • Excellent organisational and time management skills with the ability to prioritise.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines.
  • Attention to detail is essential.
  • Previous PA experience is not essential, but would be helpful.

Atherstone

title: Administrator
description:

We are looking for a responsible part time or full time (hours can be discussed, from Monday - Friday) Administrator to join our small and friendly team in Nuneaton.

Small company in Nuneaton specialising in automotive insulation, looking for enthusiastic and hands on Office Administrator who can join our small and friendly team and be able to perform on their own.

- Knowledge of general office procedures and administrative tasks.

- Strong phone etiquette and communication skills.

title: Administrator
description:
Administrator (Legal Sector)

Loughborough

£23,000 - £25,000

· Do you have strong admin experience and consider yourself to have a great eye for detail?

· Are you confident in speaking to people at all levels and understand the importance of compliance?

· Do you want to be a part of a well-established Legal Consultancy where you will provide all-round admin support to consutants?

The Company:

ER Recruitment are working with our client, a leading organisation with an outstanding reputation. They work within the legal sector as a consultantcy, offering specialist advice and assistance to the sector by providing support to law professionals.

Role & Responsibilities of the Administrator:

· Assisting with all administration tasks involved in obtaining and maintaining clients accreditations, including writing documents, reviewing client templates and providing support during audits

· Assisting with new firm applications to the Solicitors Regulation Authority and the Bar Standards Board

· Assisting clients with bespoke compliance software, including providing training and assisting with maintaining their records

· Preparing client care letters and terms of engagement

· Providing compliance advice and assistance in a number of areas, including but not limited to; Anti-Money Laundering, Data Protection, SRA Standards and Regulations, Accounts Rules, Legal Aid Agency contracts

· Filtering and replying to emails

· Monitoring the CRM System to ensure that the client records are updated and maintained

· Answering telephone calls to the office, transferring callers to the appropriate member of staff or taking sufficiently detailed messages

· Diary management and arranging client visits

· Assisting with other duties as necessary, e.g. photocopying, producing delegate packs for conferences, etc.

About You as the Administrator:

· Strong Administration experience

· Competent with Microsoft Word / Excel

· Interest in the sector – please note this role wouldn’t be right for someone looking to progress into a legal career, it’s a consultancy role working alongside law professionals.

· Strong written and oral communication skills

· Excellent telephone manner

· Competent time and work management

· Organisational skills

· Good attention to detail

· Able to work on own and a desire to show initiative

· Ability to stay calm under pressure

Please note by applying for this role you give consent for ER Recruitment to retain your CV for up to 24 months for the purposes of assisting you to find your next role unless you notify us otherwise.

While we aim to get back to all applicants however if you do not receive a response within seven working days then unfortunately your application has been unsuccessful on this occasion.

We are here to help with your career so please send a copy of your CV to us. If you know of anyone else who is looking for their next opportunity, please feel free to refer them to us or pass on our details.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Business Administrator
description:
We are looking for an organised enthusiastic administrator to join our growing team at Utility Market Watch (an Energy Consultancy). Reporting directly to the Senior Business Administrator you will become a vital part of the business.

You will be providing administrative support to our sales team. The role is busy and varied meaning that there's lots to do and plenty to learn. In the role, you'll always be one step ahead, foreseeing things that need to be done and focusing on quality to ensure that the team adds value, saves time, and makes things simple for our sales team. This role provides an excellent opportunity for someone looking to start their career in the energy sector.

What’s included in the role?

  • To quality control any contract submissions that come through from our sales team - this will involve, processing the sales via the various supplier portals.
  • To Listen to and audit sales calls in order to assess compliance and quality of the sales.
  • Repair contract errors on the sales team’s behalf where possible.
  • Liaising with suppliers either written or verbally to resolve any issues with contract submissions
  • Managing emails responding to the sales teams and suppliers’ questions and queries.
  • Working with the CRM system to input data and make sure we are using the most up to date information.
  • Coordinate communication between internal departments to facilitate seamless sales processes.
  • Perform a variety of administrative and clerical tasks to support the smooth operation of the business
  • Maintain and update company records and databases
  • Handle phone calls, emails, and other correspondence with professionalism and excellent phone etiquette
  • Provide general administrative support to staff members

What so we need from you?

  • Strong organisational skills
  • Attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and record keeping
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Proficiency in using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and able to confidently use a PC.
  • Enjoy working as a team as well as individually.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Enjoy working a fast – paced environment.
  • Proven experience in an administrative or clerical role
  • Knowledge of the energy industry is preferred but not essential as full training will be given to the successful candidate.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality of sensitive information

Whats on offer?

  • No Weekends (Office hours 8:45am - 5.00pm Monday to Friday)
  • 28 days holiday (including bank holidays)
  • Free on-site parking
  • Government Pension Scheme
  • Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
  • Refer a friend payment scheme

Expected hours: 20 – 30 per week

Benefits:

  • Driving Licence (preferred)

  • Leicester, LE4 9LZ (required)

title: Sales Administrator
description:
DUNGS - SAFE AND SECURE FOR THE FUTURE

Karl Dungs Limited is a subsidiary of Karl Dungs GmbH & Co KG, a successful manufacturer of gas control components and systems.
We are one of the leading names in the industry and our success is based on high quality products and focused customer service.

In the UK we are looking for support of our Sales team as:
Senior Sales Administrator (m/f/d)

With this job you are playing a key role in driving successful sales operations and supporting our sales team.
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Handling incoming customer calls and emails (often of a technical nature)
  • Processing & monitoring customer orders
  • Manage stock control system (SAP) ensuring adequate stock levels are maintained
  • Maintenance of customer price lists and company gross price list files
  • Liaise with the technical/production team to ensure on time delivery of control systems
YOUR PROFILE

  • You have minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role
  • You have SAP experience
  • Good overall standard of education (technical/engineering qualifications desirable)
  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
  • MS365 (Outlook/Excel/Word/Sharepoint)
  • You are a professional, friendly team player who can work on your own initiative
YOUR BENEFITS

Product Training locally & in German HQ

Life, GIP and private health insurance

25 days of
annual leave

International Sales Network

5% pension contribution

Flexible salary structure and Global Bonus Payment

This role is well suited to an enthusiastic individual looking to be part of a fast paced, small but fun team where career development is always on the horizon. You will have previous experience in Administration paired with excellent communication skills and good working knowledge of MS Office systems to include MS Excel.

This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who is looking to develop their administrative career within the legal sector.

title: Database Administrator
description:
Overview and what we offer


  • Monday - Friday 37.5hrs
  • Chester office hybrid days home and 2 in the office
  • Refer a friend for £1000 bonus which is unlimited!
  • Extra earning potential with Incentive Scheme
  • Generous holiday entitlement
  • Paid day off for your birthday
  • Staff Awards
  • Hotel and airline discounts
  • Discounts on sporting events and tickets
  • Exclusive discounts for mobile phone providers, designers, retailers, days out, gym memberships and much more
  • Employee Assistance Programme
  • OUR COMPANY CULTURE IS..... Bright, Energetic, Fast Paced and Rewarding, where we PROVIDE you with the opportunity for that brighter FUTURE!
  • At Clarity we not only listen, we adapt and we deliver


Who are we?

Clarity Business Travel
A top 10 UK-based Travel Management Company which is part of The Portman Travel Group click here to view our LinkedIn Careers Page
and includes Brighter Event, Elegant Resorts, If Only and Destination Sports Group


Clarity promotes a sustainable approach to business travel and by 2030 will be carbon neutral.

We know this has become really important to the people who work with us and you as a candidate, you can read more here on how CLICK HERE to see how we’ll get there.


Purpose of the role overview
Based in our office in Derby you will be supporting the payroll team in processing monthly payroll and assisting with the maintenance of the ichris system and it’s data, providing advice and a support service for any process or technical related queries.


Accountabilities

  • Checking the data on the payroll submission from HR is correct before the payroll is run.
  • Supporting the payroll team with processing the monthly payroll where required.
  • Understanding configurations and processes within ichris, such as creating new positions and shift patterns, setting up relationships and checking holiday entitlements.
  • Working with the wider HR team to ensure the system is maintained with correct data – carrying out regular checks and audits.
  • Checking and approving expense claims in line with company policy.
  • Regular reporting on HR and payroll data, creating new reports as required.
  • Administration of company benefits such as company cars and insurances – updating systems and spreadsheets, downloading invoices.
  • Provide payroll information for audits.
  • Documenting Process Mapping
  • Support Payroll and HR Projects as required
  • Any other ad-hoc duties


Essential

  • Computer literate with experience of Microsoft office.
  • Excellent attention to detail, accuracy, and the ability to follow instructions.
  • The ability to work within a team environment to achieve team/department objectives
  • Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadline

title: Service Administrator
description:
Job Introduction

To provide administrative support to the Service Department to ensure the smooth running of site installs, service work and spares contracts.

Main Responsibilities
  • Responsibility for organising the correct documentation to enable the Field Service Engineers to travel to customer sites. To include (but not limited to) :
    • Accurate training records, in conjunction with the H&S Team
    • Appropriate medical records
    • Complete travel arrangements
    • Travel Visas
    • Passport documentation
  • Organisation and coordination of medical appointments for vaccinations and check-ups in line with Field Service down time and availability.
  • To assist in the smooth operation of dispatching tapchanger spares kits to customers.
  • Scanning/cataloguing drawings and other historical data.
  • Order input.
  • Handling customer enquiries.
  • Progress chasing.
  • Processing of timesheets and expenses.
  • Stationery and workwear ordering.
  • Control of lease vehicles.
  • Processing warranty claims.
  • Ensure spreadsheets (Diary Hours/KPI’s) are updated weekly/monthly.
  • Update site requirements in a timely manner, which will involve interpreting drawings.
  • Creating purchase requisitions.
  • Creating site packs.
Person Specification
  • Proven track record in a similar role.
  • NVQ in Business and Administration or similar.
  • Product knowledge of transformers and associated equipment would be preferable.
  • Proven track record in developing and maintaining highly effective working relationships at all levels. A clear understanding of Microsoft systems and related software, especially Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Outlook.
About Us

BRUSH Transformers provide agile and adaptive engineering solutions and products, including consultancy services, design, and project management as well as award-winning product technology, to a wide range of projects.

A chosen partner for national and regional power generation and distribution network operators, through innovation and a commitment to delivering solutions that address grid-resilience and drive system change, we support the global drive to net-zero, helping create a future-proof Infrastructure.

title: Apprentice
description:
Business Admin Apprenticeship - St Michael's CE Academy


St Michael’s is a vibrant and successful school and children’s centre where the education, health, emotional and spiritual wellbeing of our children and families, is at the heart of everything we do..


Apprenticeship summary:

Contract: 16 months Fixed Term Apprenticeship Contract

Qualification: Level 3 Business Administrator

Working Pattern: Monday to Friday, 30 hours per week, shifts to be discussed on interview.

Wage: £5.28 (Paid Monthly)

Holiday: 28 days holiday (Bank Holidays not included)
Notice Period: 1 Month

Training Provider: LMP Education (Rated 8th best apprentice provider in UK)! Training will be delivered online.

Requirements: Applicants to have achieved English and/or Maths grade C/4 or above or functional skills Level 2.


Broad Description


Provides a reception and clerical support service for the school, under the guidance of the Academy Business Partner.

Work is governed by established procedures and carried out without close supervision other than that provided through working arrangements, methods and procedures.


JOB DETAILS


The job description is not necessarily a comprehensive definition of the post. It will be reviewed at least once a year, and it may be subject to modification and amendment at any time after consultation with the post holder.


Main Accountabilities


This will include:

RESPONSIBILITY FOR OTHERS: The post has some impact on the well-being of individuals or groups (i.e. physical, mental, social, health and safety).

RESPONSIBILITY FOR STAFF: The post has no direct responsibility for supervising other staff though may be expected to demonstrate tasks or advise/guide new employees, work experience or trainees.

RESPONSIBILITY FOR FINANCE: The post has limited direct responsibility for financial resources through handling cash, processing cheques, invoices etc.

RESPONSIBILITY FOR PHYSICAL RESOURCES: The post has some direct responsibility for physical resources, involving the careful, accurate, confidential and secure handling and processing of information.


Main Activities


Office Duties:

  • Undertake reception duties
  • Help to create a pleasant welcoming atmosphere
  • Deal with visitors to the school, issue visitor passes and notify person they have come to see.
  • Give information and guidance to parents and others as appropriate.
  • Be a point of contact for pupils requiring help and support, referring them on as appropriate.
  • Deal with incoming and outgoing post, e.g. sort and distribute, ensuring urgent post is sent.
  • Deal with telephone enquiries, taking messages and passing on for dealing with as appropriate.
  • Filing, e.g. invoices, personnel documents etc.
  • Generate standard letters – amend with up-to-date information e.g. letters to parents re events in school.
  • Produce documents from drafts, e.g. from teachers and the head teacher.
  • Distribute documents and materials within the school.
  • Maintain stock of office stationery and alert colleagues when stock needs ordering.

Financial:

  • Undertake routine financial administration which involves the collecting, counting, recording of cash collected.
  • Prepare electronic dinner registers and maintain the corresponding financial records.

Records:

  • Maintain pupil and staff data on the schools management system, as instructed by the Business Partner or Administrator.
  • Complete absence returns for staff for Business Managers approval.
  • Record and maintain attendance data and complete records for admissions and leavers
  • Maintain records, files and databases, update, retrieve information and collate reports under direction.
  • Assist in completing statutory returns.

Other:

  • Assist with making arrangements for visits.
  • Assist with pupil welfare, liaising with parents.
  • Stand in for the Administrator, but would not be expected to cover the full range of duties.
  • Attend and participate in relevant meetings as required with a view to providing a clerking service to the Governing body.

DEVELOPING SELF AND WORKING WITH OTHERS


Effective relationships and communication are important in a school role and you will be expected to manage yourself and relationships well. Through performance management and effective continuing professional development practice, you will be expected to achieve high standards. You will be committed to your own continuing professional development.

This will include:

  • Valuing people and treating them fairly, equitably and with dignity and respect to create and maintain a positive school culture in accordance with the Christian beliefs underpinning the school.
  • Ensuring own CPD included development in education
  • Develop and maintain a culture of high expectations for self
  • Regularly reviewing own practice, setting personal targets and taking responsibility for own personal development.
  • Managing own workload to allow for reflection and an appropriate work/life balance

KEY ORGANISATIONAL ACTIVITIES


  • The post holder will contribute to the school’s objective in service delivery by:
  • Enactment of Health and Safety requirements and initiatives as directed.
  • Ensuring compliance with Data Protection legislation
  • At all times operating within the school’s Equal Opportunities framework
  • Commitment and contribution to improving standards for pupils as appropriate
  • Contributing to the maintenance of a caring and stimulating environment for pupils.

SUPPORTING THE WORK OF THE MULTI ACADEMY TRUST


As part of the Diocese of Coventry Multi Academy Trust the Apprentice Business and Admin Assistant will be expected to develop and maintain strong, positive relationships with colleagues in the Multi Academy Trust, within the family of Multi Academy Trust academies and the Diocesan family of schools.


STRENGTHENING THE COMMUNITY


Schools exist in a distinctive social context, which has a direct impact on what happens inside the school. School leadership should commit to engaging with the internal and external school community to secure equity and entitlement. All staff should collaborate with other schools in order to share expertise and bring positive benefits to their own and other schools. They should work collaboratively at both strategic and operational levels with parents and carers and across multiple agencies for the well-being of all children.


This will include:

  • Building a school culture and curriculum which takes account of the Church Foundation and the richness and diversity of the school’s communities
  • Creating and promoting positive strategies for challenging racial and other prejudice and dealing with racial harassment.
  • Ensuring learning experiences for pupils are linked into and integrated with the wider community, the local church and diocesan communities.
  • Ensuring a range of community-based learning experiences, including building links with local churches and Coventry Diocese.
  • Collaborating with other agencies in providing for the academic, spiritual, moral, social, emotional and cultural well-being of pupils and their families
  • Creating and maintaining an effective partnership with parents and carers, (including those who may be described as ‘hard to reach’, those with learning disabilities and those for whom English is an additional language), to support and improve pupils’ achievement and personal development.
  • Building bridges with the school’s diverse communities, seeking opportunities to invite the whole range of parents and carers, community figures (including clergy and church representatives), businesses or other organisations into the school to enhance and enrich the school and its value to the wider community.
  • Contributing to the development of the education system by, for example, sharing effective practice, working in partnership with other schools and promoting innovative initiatives.
  • Co-operating and working with relevant agencies to protect children.

SAFEGUARDING CHILDREN AND SAFER RECRUITMENT


This school is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people as required under the Education Act 2002 and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. The Class teacher plays a role in this within the school and the post is subject to enhanced DBS disclosure, prohibition and disqualification checks.


St Michaels will ensure that:

  • The policies and procedures relating to safeguarding and safer recruitment and adopted by the governing body are full implemented and followed by all staff.
  • Sufficient resources and time are allocated to enable the designated person and other staff to discharge their responsibilities in relation to safeguarding, including taking part in strategy discussions and other inter-agency meetings and contributing to the assessment of children.
  • All staff and volunteers feel able to raise concerns about poor or unsafe practice in regard to children, and that such concerns are addressed sensitively and effectively in a timely manner in accordance with agreed whistle blowing practices.

ADDITIONAL DETAILS


Whilst every effort has been made to explain the main duties and responsibilities of the post, each individual task undertaken may not be identified. Staff will be expected to comply with any reasonable request from a manager to undertake work of a similar level that is not specified in this job description. This job description will be reviewed annually and the Headteacher reserves the right to alter the content of this job description, after consultation with the post-holder, to reflect changes to the job or services provided, without altering the general character or level of responsibility.


Next steps & Pre-employment checks:


(Permitting you’re eligible for the role) Please expect to receive contact from our LMP Education Recruitment team, to discuss your application further.

Additionally, please be aware that upon a successful offer of employment, DBS checks and references will be obtained as part of your enrolment.

title: Business Administration Apprentice
description:
Are you curious about us? Because we’re curious about you!

The Curious Guys Limited is a national wealth management company based in a splendid Grade 2 listed building in Loughborough. We are seeking an eager beaver to help us with three companies:

  • The Curious Guys Limited - Wealth Management and Tax Planning business
  • Oak Shields Estate Planning Limited - Estate Planning (Wills, Powers of Attorney etc)
  • Three Sirens Limited - An Online Department Store

We are recruiting a Business Administration Apprentice. The role will provide an important clerical and administrative service to assist operations. This is an office-based role, and the apprentice will be involved in varied tasks such as printing, copying, answering calls and responding to emails. It’s an extremely varied role in a vivacious team; everyday is different and we laugh A LOT.

What we expect from the candidate:

  • Keep well-organised files and records of business activity.
  • Conduct clerical duties, including filing, answering telephone calls, relaying voice messages, responding to emails and preparing documents.
  • Interact courteously with clients, introducers and suppliers either on the phone, email or in person. Act as first response for visitors.
  • Collect, input, update and maintain data using various systems.
  • Prepare documents by printing, copying, laminating and binding
  • Arrange meetings and events, to include booking venues, refreshments and catering, and preparation of boardroom.
  • Exercise good diary management, to include ensuring company diary is in good order and that management are prepared for their commitments.
  • Maintain stationery and supplies via a stock-take system, requesting replenishment as necessary.
  • Assist with housekeeping requirements of the premises, noting any cleaning or maintenance issues.
  • Undertake business administration apprenticeship standard as guided.
  • Assist the Marketing Department with marketing administration.
  • Assist with one-off projects.

What training will the apprentice take and what qualification will the apprentice get at the end?

Business Administrator Level 3 Apprenticeship Standard:

  • Apprentices will be allocated a trainer assessor and training will be planned and delivered in conjunction with the employer to meet the individual needs of the apprentice
  • The apprentice will spend 20% of their working hours in off the job activities and training
  • On the job and off the job training will be delivered in the workplace

What is the expected career progression after this apprenticeship?

There is opportunity for the right candidate to progress to a permanent position of Junior Administrator.

Requirements and prospects

Desired skills and personal qualities

Communication skills, IT skills, Attention to detail, Organisation skills, Customer care skills, Administrative skills, Number skills, Team working, Non judgemental, Patience

Qualifications

Must provide GCSE results for English and Maths.

Things to consider

A high standard of personal presentation is mandatory for this role. Applicants must be able to comply to a business dress code and be able to cover tattoos or remove facial piercings at the request of the employer. Small nose studs and ear piercings are permitted.

About the employer

The Curious Guys provides wealth management services for their high-net-worth client base, from an attractive Grade II listed building in Loughborough. The site is located close to public transport links and is within walking distance from the town centre.

Employer

THE CURIOUS GUYS LTD

http://www.curiousguys.co.uk/

LOUGHBOROUGH

LE11 2AF

Training provider

Business administrator
Level 3 (A level)

  • Personal Costco annual membership (T&C Apply)
  • Hours: 37.5 per week, 10am to 6pm
  • Extended Christmas/New Year break (2 weeks) - paid or unpaid dependent upon holiday accrued
  • Holidays: 22 days with one day extra per year served, to a maximum of 25, plus statutory bank holidays
  • On-site free car parking, bus stop right outside, and secure bike rack

description:

title: Administrator
description:
Join the Church Farm Care family and make a real difference!

We are currently recruiting for an experienced Administrator to work in our care home - Church Farm at Rusticus in Cotgrave, Nottingham.

The Home Administrator is the the key point of contact on the telephone and for visitors to our care home in Cotgrave in Nottingham. The ideal candidate must be an excellent communicator with a compassionate approach.

Job purpose

To provide a flexible range of duties within the home to support the provision of a high standard and effective delivery of quality services. Supporting the management team and building strong and positive relations with all staff, residents, family members and visiting professionals.

Main Duties

  • Meet and greet family members, visiting professionals and visitors to the home.
  • Arrange transport and appointments for family members.
  • Answer the phone and take and act on messages. Process post and parcels.
  • Maintain spreadsheets and registers, issue contracts and update family members files.
  • Process recruitment and onboarding paperwork for new employees, arrange interviews, apply for DBS checks and set up on HR system.
  • Process staff rotas, approve timesheets, process absence and holidays on the HR system.

Experience required

  • Proven experience as an office administrator, office assistant or relevant role
  • Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities
  • Excellent organisational and leadership skills
  • Familiarity with office management procedures
  • Excellent knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Word and Excel).
  • Experience of using online HR/rota systems would be advantageous but not essential

Benefits

  • Real Living Wage employer.

  • Causal dress code.

About the role

Church Farm Care is a group of four care homes based in Nottingham specialising in dementia and nursing care.

We work tirelessly to ensure that everyone who lives and works with us are at the heart of everything that we do.

Professionals and families who visit and care alongside us are crucial partners and they Matter too.

Please apply on-line via Indeed or contact us via our website - www.churchfarmcare.co.uk

We look forward to hearing from you!

Administrator Ref code: JVE99095847 Customer Service & Call Centre, Office Support £22k - 25k per year Leicester, Leicestershire, England Permanent Office Based Job Title: Administrator Contract: Full Time, Permanent Location: Leicester, LE4 Salary: £22,000 - £25,000 The Commercial Division at SF Recruitment are currently recruiting an experienced Administrator to join their manufacturing client who is a continuously growing family run business. This opportunity is due to exciting business growth and the expansion of the commercial and production teams. As an Administrator you will be responsible for: - Raising and processing customer orders. - Maintaining contact with customers so that they are updated on expected delivery times and investigate any delayed deliveries. - Creating delivery notes and attaching these to the correct orders. - Carry out regular stock checks to support the inventory team of stock accuracy, and in demand products. - Maintain an accurately updated system of order status'. - Working closely with haulage and transport companies to schedule delivery bookings. - Providing additional administrative and customer support across internal departments in busier times. The successful Administrator will ideally have similar experience as listed above. What is essential is that you have: - Strong attention to detail. - Excellent communication skills both verbal and written. - Able to work to a high standard in a fast-paced environment. - IT Literate - experience using Microsoft Packages. It would be advantageous if you have experience with order processing or knowledge of dispatching processes. If you wish to progress an application forward, please click '' with a copy of your updated CV.


Emma Maloney

Email Emma

title: Sales Administrator
description:
Sales Administrator - Inchcape Derby

(Salary - £23,100)


As a Sales Administrator at Inchcape, not only do you get to work for a leading independent global automotive company, you will also receive a competitive salary, as well as some amazing company benefits, including;

  • Vehicle purchase discounts – There are plenty ways that you & your family can Drive with Us at Inchcape, from vehicle discounts to service offers. Own your dream car for less
  • A pension that pays – Our flexible pension scheme gives you the freedom to plan for the future in a way that suits you. Choose exactly how much you want to contribute on a monthly basis
  • Save as you earn plan – reap the rewards of Inchcape’s success and effortlessly grow your savings. Save every month for a set period in order to buy Inchcape shares at a discounted price
  • Life Assurance – we give you the peace of mind when you need it most
  • Employee Discounts with The Showroom – make your salary go further with the discounts and cashback offers available at over 1000 retailers
  • Cycle to work scheme – get a new bike, equipment or both
  • Employee Assistance Programme – We take employee wellbeing seriously at Inchcape, we offer a programme to support all our colleagues and families with whatever challenges they may face at work or at home 24/7 365 days a year
  • Holiday allowance rising with length of service – We reward long service with extra holiday
  • Great career development – Receive industry leading training from the brand you represent whilst you develop your skills with the Inchcape training team
  • And much more…

Job Description

As a Sales Administrator within our exciting and brand new central administration hubs, you will be working in a bustling and fast paced environment, supporting our retail sales teams behind the scenes to achieve an incredible customer experience in the purchase of a used vehicle. Working with our prestige automotive brand partners including BMW, MINI, Mercedes Benz and Audi to name a few, you’ll ensure a smooth, effective and compliant remote administration service to all of our sales teams across the UK.


This is an excellent opportunity to work within our recently established and talented centralised team of administrators based in the Retail Operations Centre above our superb bravoauto Derby Used Car Centre, with convenient commuting links and city centre location.


Main Responsibilities

The tasks of our Sales Administrators include;

  • Undertaking end to end sales administrative tasks once a vehicle has been sourced
  • Assisting the sales teams in processing vehicles through the whole Inchcape sales process
  • Accurate creation and maintenance of vehicle records
  • Invoicing vehicles to end-users and internally between our UK retail centres
  • Updating relevant systems in accordance with agreed processes
  • Carrying out ad hoc housekeeping activities as required
  • Responding to all internal and external queries in a professional and timely manner
  • Building and maintaining relationships with all of our retail centre teams

The Ideal Candidate

To be a success in this role as a Sales Administrator, you will have;

  • Previous sound administration experience
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, particularly Microsoft Excel & Word
  • Good verbal & written communication skills
  • Ability to work under pressure and adapt to change
  • Ability to collaborate and manage expectations, and work with ambiguity
  • Must be highly organised, accurate and show high attention to detail
  • Ability to work well in a team environment
  • Motor trade experience would be an advantage

We are excited about the future. Could we be a part of your future plans too?


Apply today!

At Inchcape we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, and believe that Inchcape is for Everyone. So if you’re excited about this role and you share our values to deliver great experiences through fresh thinking and working better together, we encourage you to apply. You may be just the right person for this or other roles. Please get in touch!

title: Administrator
description:
Build a Rewarding Career.

Doing things differently.


Subject Administrator

Salary- £26,060 - £27,363 per annum (pro rata)

Part time- 22.2 hours per week

About the Role

An opportunity now exists to join the administration team as a Subject Administrator in the School of Architecture, Design and the Built Environment based at the City Site, on a 22.2 hours per week with a mix of on campus and remote home working on offer. You will be providing frontline comprehensive administrative support, dealing with students, staff, and associated internal/external stakeholders. A commitment to providing an exceptional level of customer service and support is paramount.

You will be involved in all aspects of course administration, including student induction, management of student records, student assessments, quality assurance processes, and Boards of Examiners. An ability to prioritise your workload and to be effective in changing situations is essential. We are seeking a proactive individual with relevant previous experience of working in a busy administrative environment.

Submit a supporting document of no more than 1000 words to demonstrate how you meet the requirements of the role. For more details, please take a look at the role profile. We'll still consider applications even if you don't meet every single one of the requirements, so don't be put off if you don't match them perfectly.

The job description details the responsibilities of the role, and the person specification identifies the skills, knowledge, experience and competencies we are seeking. Please use these documents to assess your suitability, and refer to them when completing your supporting document.

Submission of a CV alone will not be accepted.

Interview Date: Week commencing the 26th February 2024

If you have queries about this role, please contact Samantha Marsh, School Administration Manager, via samantha.marsh@ntu.ac.uk

About Us

We are the School of Architecture, Design and the Built Environment (ADBE) at Nottingham Trent University. We make, create, design and build. We’re planners and problem solvers. We draw lines, and we break boundaries. We are 3,000 students, five departments and one school.

In the School of Architecture, Design and the Built Environment, we stand half way between science and philosophy; and between tradition and disruption. We embrace theoretical rigour and insist on providing hands-on experience for all our students. We celebrate design heritage, and we invite innovation.

We’re a nationally renowned stage for talent in making and design. We investigate the physicality of tools and tech, glass and grass, and bricks and mortar. We also explore the abstract excitement of ideas and creative philosophies.

For any informal queries about the role or the ADBE team, please contact Samantha Marsh, School Administration Manager, samantha.marsh@ntu.ac.uk.

Join Us

Find out more about our academic community at NTU, including the support we offer to academics at all stages of their careers at Support for academics | Nottingham Trent University

We also offer:

  • Between 25 and 35 days annual leave per year (dependent on grade) plus statutory bank holidays and 5 university closure days pro rata
  • Salary Sacrifice Retirement Savings Plan with life assurance and income protection. Available to colleagues who choose to opt out of the contractual pension scheme. Minimum colleague contributions of 0% matched with minimum NTU contributions of 8%.
  • Opportunity to receive a bonus for exceptional performance and contribution
  • Range of health and wellbeing services, voluntary benefits, discounts, and savings for all colleagues.
  • And a whole lot more…

Come and be part of our success. Apply today.

Safe and Inclusive

At NTU, we continue to build an inclusive culture that encourages, supports and celebrates the diverse voices and experiences of our students and colleagues. We welcome the unique contributions that you can bring and we encourage people from underrepresented communities and backgrounds to apply to join our team.

Please note that unfortunately, this role has been assessed as ineligible for sponsorship under the UK Visas & Immigration points-based immigration system. However, applications are welcome from candidates who do not currently have the right to work in the UK, but who would be eligible to obtain a valid visa via another route. Please consult the Home Office website for further information.

Please note that this role is covered by the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act (1974) and successful applicants will be asked to declare any unspent criminal convictions.

title: Administrator
description:
About the role


Own your career, and you can build something to be proud of at Balfour Beatty. By joining our Asset & Technology team as Hire Administrator - Modular Accommodation you’ll work with true experts who’ll share their knowledge and provide support, encouragement and invaluable feedback so you never stop learning. Bring us your capability, and we’ll help you take it much, much further.

To support the Modular Accommodation business, and associated activity streams, with administration of our hire process. Using key systems and software to ensure all records are up to date and billing correctly. Supporting the team with effective and efficient office administration and coordination; with adherence to processes and procedures.


What you'll be doing
  • Customer Service - Provide exceptional customer service by assisting clients with inquiries, recommending suitable equipment for their needs, and ensuring a positive hire experience.
  • Scheduling and Coordination - Effectively schedule equipment deliveries and collections, optimising routes and resources to ensure timely and cost-effective service.
  • Inventory Management - Maintain accurate records of equipment availability, update inventory databases, and collaborate with the procurement team to ensure an adequate supply of hire equipment.
  • Documentation - Prepare hire agreements, invoices, and other necessary documentation, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies.
  • Reporting - Super User for Hire IT system. Ownership of utilisation reporting & monitoring to ensure assets are correctly accounted for.
  • Communication - Liaise with Operations Teams and other relevant stakeholders to communicate delivery schedules, address concerns, and provide necessary information.
  • Issue Resolution - Address and resolve any issues or challenges that may arise during the hire process, ensuring customer satisfaction and maintaining positive relationships.
  • Procurement - Supplier payment processing including management of invoice query resolution, receipting of Purchase Orders in a timely manner. Administration of new/approved supplier process.

Who we're looking for
  • General office administration skills and experience (3 yrs +)
  • Computer literacy - skills in Microsoft (Word, Excel)
  • Strong planning & organisation skills
  • Communication skills
  • Thorough attention to detail
  • Strong commercial awareness
  • Ability to work diligently under light supervision inc. time management and priority setting skills

The following qualities/experience are desirable:

  • Experience in use of Insphire software application or similar
  • Experience working in construction industry environment
  • Experience working with Purchase Ledger &/or Credit Control departments
  • Basic technical/operational understanding of overall construction process

Why work for us


Day in, day out, our teams deliver some of the UK’s most ambitious, exciting and meaningful projects; developing, building and maintaining the vital infrastructure that supports national economies and strengthens communities.

Why join us?

As if contributing to and supporting work that makes life better for millions wasn’t rewarding enough, we offer a full range of benefits too. You’ll have the freedom to shape the package that’s right for you and your life. Here are some of our key benefits:

  • Smart working, giving you more flexibility such as staggered start and finish times, with up to 40% remote working, where roles allow.
  • 25 days paid annual leave (pro rata)
  • Family friendly policies which include 28 weeks full pay for maternity/adoption leave and four weeks full pay for paternity/partners leave
  • Pension, share incentive plan, volunteering leave, recognition schemes and much more…

About us


Asset & Technology Solutions provides innovative, safe and sustainable solutions to the Balfour Beatty projects across the UK. Our wide range of equipment and services includes HGV’s, tower and crawler cranes, piling equipment, CCTV and security services, survey services and drones, suction excavators, sweepers, modular accommodation and much more.

Diversity and inclusion

At Balfour Beatty we believe that diversity and inclusion are essential components of any successful, happy workplace. Through our Value Everyone Diversity and Inclusion Strategy and Action Plan, we are growing our diverse workforce and developing our inclusive culture where everyone is able to thrive and reach their full potential, regardless of their identity or background. To find out how we are making this a reality, visit www.balfourbeatty.com/diversityandinclusion

We are a Gold Award holder in the Ministry of Defence 'Employer Recognition Scheme' and actively encourage applications from Armed Forces personnel, veterans and reservists.

As a Disability Confident Employer, we are committed to working with people who have disabilities and long-term health conditions to remove barriers for them in obtaining employment. We are also committed to offering applicants with a disability an interview if they meet the minimum requirements for the role. For more info, visit: https://disabilityconfident.campaign.gov.uk/

We are looking to continually improve our resourcing process and ensure that it is fair and inclusive for all. If you have any feedback on the process, please share this with us at: candidaterecruitmentqueries@balfourbeatty.com


Job Reference: BBUK07451

title: Assistant Buyer
description:
Our buying teams - if it's possible - have to move even quicker than the rest of the business.

And they have to keep ahead of our customers too: second-guessing what they want and need before they do. As a Buying Administration Assistant you will support both the Buying Assistants and Buying Directors to stay ahead of the game, providing comprehensive and professional administrative support. If you are considering a career in buying, this could be the perfect first step.

We do things our own way at Aldi. But whatever we're doing, we must be getting it right. With a wave of impressive sales figures behind us, we're opening new stores at lightning speed. And to keep on top of that wave, our buying teams have to do something pretty special to keep our customers coming back for more.


Within the National Buying Department sits the National Buying Administration (NBA) Team who support the department’s Data Quality, Auditing, Supplier Management, Systems Support, Financial Planning and Analysis Functions.

NBA are seeking an Administrator to join the National Data Office (NDO) team - a team with exciting opportunities for growth and development.

The Administrator will work as part of a team, responsible for auditing, monitoring and reporting on the accuracy of master data held in our systems. The team goal is to ensure the department are following data entry and formatting standards, identify trends and training needs where this is not happening and be a point of contact for best practice, guidance and questions.

The role requires an individual with a consistently positive approach, high attention to detail and is passionate about quality. The Administrator must be a confident communicator as there will be interaction with internal personnel at different levels. The Administrator will be required to develop an in-depth knowledge of applications, data entry procedures and processes within the area of master data they are responsible for auditing.

The Administrator will be expected to demonstrate their ability to achieve and exceed department KPIs and run an organized and transparent desk to ensure the wider department is provided with data quality reports, audits and feedback within agreed timeframes and deadline.

The Administrator is expected to become an expert in their field and identify process improvements to aid the smooth running of the department.

If you’re a hardworking individual that’s ready to kick-start your career with an award-winning employer, apply to join #TeamAldi today!


Your New Role

  • Testing of data quality reports for accuracy against processes and procedures
  • Identifying any bugs in reports and reporting them to the relevant development teams via Jira
  • Generating and downloading data quality reports and formatting them into a useable format
  • Answering queries and questions from end users on data quality reports
  • Act as a point of contact for the end users and issue remediation to queries raised
  • Maintain strong relationships with the end users and the Training & Comms team
  • Investigating queries relating to data held in our systems
  • Ensuring data is up to date in relevant trackers and logs for management level reporting and updates

About You

  • Strong commercial acumen
  • Data entry, manipulation and interrogation of business data
  • Experience of analysing data within a retail setting
  • High levels of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Confident with MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint
  • Able to cope with multiple tasks
  • Comfortable dealing with complex data
  • Ability to proactively work towards challenging deadlines through multitasking and resilience
  • Meticulously follows rules and procedures to ensure work is completed to a high standard
  • Able to work under pressure and deliver against short deadlines
  • Can deliver solutions autonomously
  • High levels of initiative and proactivity
  • Strategic and critical thinker that is results-oriented and data driven
  • Intellectually curious and takes initiative

What You Get In Return

  • Salary details £25,100 rising to £30,875
  • Permanent Contract
  • Monday to Friday, 8am to 4:30pm, with the opportunity of 2 days a week remote working
  • 5 weeks’ annual leave plus Bank Holidays
  • In office flexi-time
  • Full training provided
  • Pension scheme
  • Private employee medical insurance after 4 years
  • Company sick pay scheme
  • Company maternity and adoption pay after 1 year and paternity leave pay after 2 years
  • Long service rewards
  • Access to MyBenefits, where you can find a wide range of benefits, including our bike to work scheme, shopping and cinema discounts, health cash plan, a FREE will, travel and discounted gym memberships, as well as a host of benefits to support your financial and wellbeing needs.
  • Access to a free,24/7, confidential virtual GP service for all Aldi Colleagues and their children (under the age of 16)


Aldi is an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and are dedicated to promoting a culture of inclusion, providing an environment in which collaboration, respect and fairness are essential. We value diversity and are dedicated to treating all of our colleagues and prospective colleagues fairly and with respect.

If you’re looking for a career that gives you more, apply today!

title: Project Administrator
description:
Project Administrator


Salary- £26,060- 27,363 per annum

Location- City Campus and Mansfield Campus

Full Time / Permanent


About the Role

There is now an exciting opportunity to join the administration team as a Project Administrator, based at our City and Mansfield Campus.

As a Project Administrator you will support the implementation of the Centre for Sustainable Construction & Retrofit in ADBE. To provide comprehensive administrative support to the Green Skills Bootcamp manager. To work across the School and with external clients to support the delivery of the Greenskills Bootcamp program and other courses.

An ability to prioritise your workload and to be effective in changing situations is key; you will be able to operate using your own initiative and professional judgement, and will possess the skills to multitask and complete tasks promptly and accurately. You will be an excellent team player with the proven ability to work well under pressure.

The successful candidate will have demonstrable experience of providing administrative support to senior members of staff, taking formal meeting minutes, tracking actions, and extensive experience of using Microsoft Office applications, in particular Outlook, SharePoint, Word and Excel.
