title: Administrator
description:
Job Description

My client is an engineering company based in Coventry and looking for a Transport Administrator to join their team, the successful candidate will assist with all aspects of documentation to co-ordinate the asset management of plant and equipment between Ryton plant division and contracts.
    To facilitate the administration of the plant division office and workshops
    To assist the Plant and resource Supervisor with the day-to-day asset management, transport, and yard operations within the plant division.
    Collate the daily information required for recording and processing asset management, working timesheets and plant maintenance and repair history.
    To assist in the maintenance of share point and other electronic storage systems within the plant department.
    Deal directly with our contracts over the telephone regarding documentation issues.
    Effectively communicate customer requirements to all other departments within the plant division.
    Assist in the collation of real time project costs.
The successful Candidate:
    Excellent communication skills
    Must have a full UK driving licence
    Self-starter able to progress duties with limited input from others.
    Flexibility, to be able to carry-out duties not part of the normal remit in the interests of the team
    Attention to detail.
    Previous experience in a plant or transport related office environment
    Previous experience of office and systems management
    Knowledge of InspHire asset management package or Microsoft Dynamics
This is a full-time permanent position offering a salary of up to £25,000 depending on experience.

title: Administrator
description:
Express Recruitment are proud to advertise for a local charitable organisation who put their clients at the heart of what they do. We are proud to be supporting our client with the recruitment of their newest Hub Support Administrator, to act as an office-based emotional support person for survivors of sexual abuse. The successful candidate will be a passionate individual with a range of telephone and administration skills, combined with knowledge of supporting vulnerable survivors of abuse.

Due to the nature of the role, candidates will need to be willing for us to process an Enhanced DBS on your behalf.

This is a part-time role with the following working patterns, and hybrid working options are available:

  • Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday, 9:00am-5:00pm
  • Wednesday, 11.30am – 7.30pm
  • Saturday Mornings, 1 in every 5

Although this role starts off on a Temporary basis, our client does offer a generous benefits package for those who become permanent employees of their organisation, which is inclusive of; extra leave for occasions such as birthdays, weekly emotional support meetings/EAP, ongoing training and development, and more.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Update multiple bespoke databases with sensitive client information
  • Signpost service users from a waiting list to external third-party organizations
  • Liaise with police, health and social services via telephone and email
  • Co-ordinate a high volume of appointments between clients and counsellors
  • Complete risk assessments and process referrals

Skills & Experience

  • Previous experience working directly with victims of abuse
  • Strong administrative skills, demonstrated through previous experiences
  • Ability to use IT systems
  • Strong data management skills
  • Empathetic and patient attitude essential
  • Great organisational skills, to manage a varied workload

About Express Recruitment

Express Recruitment has been offering exceptional recruitment solutions across the East Midlands since 1987, “exceeding expectations every time” of over 267,000 candidates.

We supply a diverse range of sectors including Engineering, Technology, Professional Services, Languages, Sales & Marketing, Call Centres, Commercial, Manufacturing, Local Authority, NHS, Education and Voluntary organisations.

Not quite found the right role for you yet? Let us do the scrolling for you! Your search for a new role has never been so easy, just fill in our contact form on https://bit.ly/3NHa9NR or give us a call on 0115 924 0010 and we will do the rest for you.

Vacancy Summary

Hours: Monday – Friday with occasional Saturdays, hybrid working available

Salary: c£12.00 per hour D.O.E

Location: Nottingham City Centre

Job Type: Temp to Perm, subject to 12 consecutive weeks in employment

Unfortunately, we are unable to contact all candidates due to the large volume of applications we receive. If you have not heard from a consultant within the next three days, please assume that you have not been successful on this occasion. Please do not hesitate to apply for other suitable roles in the future.

This vacancy is being advertised on behalf of Express Recruitment Ltd. The services advertised by Express Recruitment Ltd. are those of an Employment Agency.

title: Crm Lead
description:
CRM Lead

At Bellrock, we harness technology to give our customers an experience that not only leaves them with advanced building systems, but with peace of mind, and we unlock that by being technology-led but people-driven. When you’re part of Bellrock, you’ll get everything you need to be your best at work - because our people are the heart of our business and we’re all about helping them to shine.

You will be the administrator, trainer, and go-to expert for our CRM platform. You will work to improve user skill levels and increase user adoption. You will help sales and marketing teams drive growth through sales enablement and digital campaign support whilst providing them with timely, relevant, and accurate reports.

Your experience of working with CRM systems and external partners will allow you to take a best practice approach to the role, helping to achieve the best possible user experience and maximum system return on investment.

How will you be the change?

We believe every role is essential to providing that peace of mind for our customers - whatever part of the business you’re in - every role plays a part in driving us further and everyone can be the change. That’s how we deliver value for our customers, and building systems that lead the way.

And as a CRM Lead with Bellrock, you’ll do it by…

  • Be our CRM super admin.
  • Train, support and upskill the sales, marketing, and operations teams in using our CRM platform.
  • Own, manage and maintain data within the CRM system, working with sales, marketing, and operations teams to ensure accuracy and completeness.
  • Work with sales teams to ensure the business has an accurate forward view of sales opportunities and contract renewals.
  • Develop and maintain of a suite of reports for marketing, sales and operations.
  • Onboard new business units to support M&A activity.

What does it take?

If you’re ready to be the energy that helps us build our business, share our success, and really own it as a CRM Lead you’ll need…

  • Strong experience working with CRM systems as a system admin.
  • Previous experience of onboarding new users onto CRM systems, including training and support.
  • Previous experience with HubSpot SalesHub and MarketingHub is essential.
  • Experience with Operations Hub would be an advantage
  • Excellent organisational skills with great attention to detail.
  • Pro-active, able to show initiative and to drive activity within deadlines.
  • Data driven with a focus on quality and familiarity working with large data sets.
  • Excellent communication skills, able to engage effectively with colleagues at all levels.


Working arrangements

We embrace smarter working practices which offer our employees the opportunity to work their hours flexibly and remotely where their roles and business needs allow. In this role, the successful candidate would be required to work from the Leicester office.

What can we offer you?

25 days annual leave plus bank holidays + 1 additional day as a thank you (enjoy it, it’s on us)

Life cover

LifeWorks employee assistance and wellness program

Enhanced maternity, paternity and adoption leave

Salary sacrifice schemes: Cycle to work and Techscheme

Holiday purchase scheme of additional 5 days per year

Committed to paying real living wage

Offers and discount scheme

Healthcare Cashplan

MotorSave Scheme

Refer a friend scheme

Bright eyed

Liftshare

Helping you to shine

We’ve always encouraged new and different perspectives, that also means making ours a workplace that encourages diverse and unique voices, where everyone feels welcome, included and supported to be themselves and achieve more.

So, if you join us, you’ll find an inclusive workplace that recognises your hard work, offers lots of learning and development, flexible and hybrid working and support for your wellbeing, as well as benefits that can make a difference to your life.


Ready to start shining?

Our people are our passion, so we’re all about helping them to shine. That means putting everything in place for you to have a rewarding career with us. You can go far in your career with us behind you and our business will grow, too. So, if you’re ready to start your career journey with Bellrock we’re ready to welcome you. It’s a great place to be - the light, the energy, the solution. You.

Apply today.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Job description

We are seeking an administrative assistant to work part time joining our extremely busy sales and warranty team. The ideal candidate will be an enthusiastic and well-presented person with good time keeping skills, who enjoys working as part of a team but also able to work under pressure and their own initiative. This role is ideal for someone who is professional, a good communicator, excellent telephone manner and competent in maths and computer skills.

We are one of the country's leading turbocharger suppliers, supplying quality remanufactured turbochargers to the automotive industry. Our modern busy office is an excellent environment for the right candidate to thrive and grow within the business.

Experience in a similar role is preferred, but not essential as full training will be given.

Some of the tasks that the position involves will include:

  • Processing invoices on our dedicated computer system.
  • Raising warranty job cards.
  • Processing warranty paperwork.
  • Checking company email accounts for enquiries and dealing with them appropriately.
  • Filing.
  • Liaising with, and assisting department heads.
  • Answering telephone sales queries and processing quotes on our dedicated computer system. Looking up and identifying part numbers accurately.
  • Assisting the other administrators with various duties.
  • Processing courier deliveries and collections.

IMPORTANT: Please complete the skills assessments assigned to this application and make sure your CV is up to date with your current contact details. Failure to do so, may exclude you from consideration for the role.

The contract is initially for 12 months including a 3 month probationary period with a view to move to permanent contract after 12 months.

title: Assistant Buyer
description:
Our buying teams - if it's possible - have to move even quicker than the rest of the business.

And they have to keep ahead of our customers too: second-guessing what they want and need before they do. As a Buying Administration Assistant you will support both the Buying Assistants and Buying Directors to stay ahead of the game, providing comprehensive and professional administrative support. If you are considering a career in buying, this could be the perfect first step.

We do things our own way at Aldi. But whatever we're doing, we must be getting it right. With a wave of impressive sales figures behind us, we're opening new stores at lightning speed. And to keep on top of that wave, our buying teams have to do something pretty special to keep our customers coming back for more.


The National Buying Support Team is seeking an Administrator to join the team.

The successful candidate will come into the team and build a thorough understanding of the department’s applications mainly from a process point of view, but will also have opportunity see this from a technical perspective. They must be able to analyse and advise on areas of development and improvements as well as train users on how to use the systems. Working at the centre of the Buying department, this role provides a great opportunity to experience a high profile role within a large and busy office environment.

This role involves liaising with all teams within Buying, therefore confidence and assertiveness are required in order to build excellent working relationships. The successful candidate will be a good problem solver.

If you’re a hardworking individual that’s ready to kick-start your career with an award-winning employer, apply to join #TeamAldi today!

*This job listing is for a position that will beavailable in the future and the vacancy is not currently live. If yourapplication is successful, you will be placed in the Talent Pool, until asuitable position becomes available*

Your New Role

  • Understand the process of the department and how these processes interact with our systems and applications
  • Undertake user acceptance testing, providing feedback on testing results and be responsible for the decision making of which developments of the systems and reports will be released
  • Support users with queries, questions and requests related to the systems used within the Buying Department
  • First line support for the Buying Department in regards to system based questions and queries. Liaising with our National IT Team in cases which cannot be resolved in the first instance
  • Creating bespoke data extracts from the Data Warehouse, CBIS and other applications to aid the flow of information in the department and providing analysis and identify trends within the data to aid with decision making
  • Deliver one to one and classroom based training sessions and presentations on systems and applications, ranging from new starters to experienced users, from Administrator to Group Buying Director level
  • Create and maintain training documentation such as User Guides or Quick Reference Guides ensuring they are up to date and relevant
  • Liaising with colleagues and NIT to ensure that IT equipment is available as required
  • Maintaining department printers and toners and replenishing as required
  • Responsible for the processing and tracking of invoices and other administrative duties as required
  • Provide cover for colleagues where necessary
  • Support the delivery of the team strategy as required

About You

  • Experience in a busy office environment
  • Confident communicator, detail focused
  • High levels of accuracy
  • Comfortable dealing with complex data
  • High Levels of initiative and proactivity
  • Excellent time management
  • Ability to communicate professionally and effectively with all internal and external parties
  • Ability to manage a varied workload, conflicting deadlines and multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Working in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
  • Excellent people person
  • Previously worked as part of a team
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel

What You Get In Return

  • Salary details £25,100 rising to £30,875
  • Permanent Contract
  • Monday to Friday, 8am to 4:30pm, with the opportunity of 2 days a week remote working
  • 5 weeks’ annual leave plus Bank Holidays
  • In office flexi-time
  • Full training provided
  • Pension scheme
  • Private employee medical insurance after 4 years
  • Company sick pay scheme
  • Company maternity and adoption pay after 1 year and paternity leave pay after 2 years
  • Long service rewards
  • Access to MyBenefits, where you can find a wide range of benefits, including our bike to work scheme, shopping and cinema discounts, health cash plan, a FREE will, travel and discounted gym memberships, as well as a host of benefits to support your financial and wellbeing needs.
  • Access to a free,24/7, confidential virtual GP service for all Aldi Colleagues and their children (under the age of 16)


Aldi is an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and are dedicated to promoting a culture of inclusion, providing an environment in which collaboration, respect and fairness are essential. We value diversity and are dedicated to treating all of our colleagues and prospective colleagues fairly and with respect.

If you’re looking for a career that gives you more, apply today!

title: Administrator
description:
FOSTERING PEOPLE

Role: Administrator – 11 Months Fixed Term

Salary: £19,500 Per Annum

Benefits: 30 days' Annual Leave + Bank Holidays, Company Pension, Life Assurance x2, Employee Discount Scheme, Medical Cash Plan & On-site Free Parking

Location: Office Based - Nottingham

ABOUT US

Fostering People is a highly accredited community based fostering agency with over 20 years' experience of changing lives.

Fostering People first opened its doors in 2000, when a local social worker came up with the idea of starting a new, independent fostering service in the East Midlands.

Her idea was to provide plenty of excellent personal support, right in the heart of the local community. Today, this still holds true – except we’re now present in even more communities: Scotland, the North East, North West, West Midlands, East of England and Yorkshire. In these places, the excellence of our work means we’re the preferred choice of partner for many local authorities, who trust us to provide a high quality and caring local service. Just as importantly, so do foster parents in these communities.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We are seeking a reliable Administrator to join our friendly and dedicated team at Fostering People Nottingham.

DUTIES INCLUDE:

  • Undertake a wide range of administrative tasks and duties using keyboard, office and IT skills
  • Act as an admin support for foster carers and social workers
  • Co-ordination of training and meetings and events
  • Completion of monthly tasks according to deadlines
  • Recording of essential company information to third parties on our database (CHARMS)
  • Act as first point of contact for our customers and portray a positive, professional and helpful image of the organisation
  • Understand and follow unique processes
  • Note/Minute taking at meetings where appropriate
  • Cover reception duties (lunch/annual leaves)

ESSENTIAL CRITERIA:

  • Previous Administrative experience
  • Solid educational background to include GCSE Grade C (or equivalent) in English and Mathematics
  • Be able to evidence an understanding of the use of IT and electronic communications including the use of Microsoft Office in particular Word, Excel and Outlook email
  • A good knowledge of administrative systems and processes
  • Be able to demonstrate effective communication
  • Ability to work under pressure and handle changing priorities

For an informal discussion about this post please contact Sophie Weightman – Office Manager on 0115 9455445.

To be considered for this post, please complete an application.

No agencies please.

Fostering People is an equal opportunities employer and has been awarded the disability confident employer by the jobcentre plus. The successful applicant will be subject to a DBS check at enhanced level if successful for the position.

title: Human Resources Administrator
description:
• Reputable business offering fantastic company benefits
  • Flexitime and 1 day per week remote working

About Our Client

Market leading construction business known across the East Midlands for their top quality service. This highly reputable company is committed to fostering a positive and inclusive work environment. This is the perfect opportunity for a detail-oriented and proactive HR Systems Administrator to join a dynamic Human Resources team.

Job Description

As a HR Systems Administrator you will:

  • Administer and maintain iTrent (Human Resources Information System) to ensure accurate and up-to-date employee records.
  • Collaborate with HR and IT teams to implement system upgrades, enhancements, and integration.
  • Provide technical support to HR staff and end-users, troubleshooting and resolving system-related issues.
  • Conduct regular audits to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with company policies and regulations.
  • Create and maintain custom reports and dashboards to support HR analytics and decision-making.
  • Work with the L&D team to develop and deliver training programs for HR staff on system functionality and best practices.
  • Collaborate with vendors to resolve issues, implement new features, and stay abreast of system updates.
  • Ensure GDPR laws and legislation's are followed at all times
  • Provide admin support to the wider HR team including on boarding, support with employee life cycle and file management

The Successful Applicant

  • Proven experience as an HR Systems Administrator or in a similar role.
  • In-depth knowledge of HRIS and related technologies, ideally iTrent.
  • Strong understanding of HR processes and data management.
  • Excellent analytic and problem-solving skills.
  • Proficiency in data reporting and visualisation tools.
  • High level of attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
  • Qualification in HR is desirable but not essential.

What's on Offer

In return the business will offer fantastic benefits:

  • 1 Day per week remote working
  • 33 days annual leave entitlement plus bank holidays
  • Employee perks access- discount schemes across retail, hospitality and company discount
  • Free on site parking
  • Flexi working hours

title: Administrator
description:
Your new role


We have a fantastic opportunity for a permanent Administrator to join our Area 7 account. This role offers Hybrid working, based in either our Sandiacre depot (NG10 5ND) or Leicester (LE3 3GB).

Working with National Highways, Amey maintain over 700 kilometers of roads across the East Midlands, ensuring the 4.5 million citizens across the East Midlands experience better journeys every day.

We provide maintenance and response across a vast area of some of the UK's busiest motorways and strategic highways across the east midlands and north of England. As many as 180,000 vehicles a day use certain sections of this vital network.


The standard hours of work are 37.5 hours (Monday - Friday) on a hybrid basis.


Work-life balance and flexibility are key for our success. We empower our people to make choices that are right for them, with hybrid, part-time and flexible work patterns. And with a network of offices across the UK, we’re open to discussing working options that suit you.


You will be responsible for:

  • Ensuring our employees are paid accurately, to ensure our payroll team receive the correct inputs on time
  • Reviewing reasons why payroll errors are made and taking action to stop mistakes being repeated
  • Transacting all stock material issues from the do-forms
  • Providing the contracts we serve with a reliable service, day in and day out, by pooling our resources and working well as a team
  • Processing payroll using our do-form system
  • Creating spreadsheets from the do-form system to allocate labour, plant and materials

We want to hear from you if you have:

  • Full driving licence
  • Ability to work with/enter data into systems and databases
  • Previous administrative experience is desirable
  • Good verbal and written communication
  • Experience of working successfully in a diverse team
  • Previous experience of Microsoft Excel is essential

What can we offer you


When you join us, we can offer flexibility, career development, a choice of benefits and support that help you through all life’s ups and downs. It’s the reason why Investors in People put us among the top 1% of employers and we have a competitive reward and benefits program

  • Career Development - Exceptional development and progression plan
  • Pension – Generous Pension scheme which we will contribute to
  • Holidays - Minimum 24 days holiday + Bank Holidays
  • Choices - Our flexible benefits scheme is tailored by you, including buying additional annual leave, cycle2work scheme, charity giving and gym membership
  • Save with Amey - Our online voucher portal gives you access to thousands of discounts from leading retailers to help you save on shopping, days out, or nights in. It includes healthcare, free GP service, dental vouchers
  • Social Value - You’ll get 2 Community Involvement Days each year to volunteer for a charity of your choice and further opportunities to support fundraising initiatives
  • Company Car / Car allowance

We embrace difference and support individuals to work in ways that work best for them.

We are committed to working sustainably and by working in partnership with the communities we serve, so people and the planet are protected.

At Amey, you have freedom to perform because we know if nothing holds you back, together, we can be extraordinary.


Who is Amey?

  • We are at the heart of modern Britain, helping the economy to grow by designing, maintaining and transforming the nation’s strategic assets.
  • Our 11,000 people are behind the critical services the country relies on every day.
  • Our unique engineering and operations experience, together with data driven insight from our consulting business, delivers better results for our clients.
  • We are trusted partners of Government – both national and local – managing assets and complex projects that are vital to the sustainable growth of the country.

To find out more take a look at our website www.amey.co.uk


Application Guidance


Amey is committed to Inclusion and Diversity. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates, regardless of their race, gender, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

Please contact our recruitment team at peopleservices@amey.co.uk to discuss any access needs and reasonable adjustments that may be required at any point during the recruitment process.


Apply today – We are excited to hear from you!

#LI-EM1

title: Assistant Buyer
description:
Our buying teams - if it's possible - have to move even quicker than the rest of the business.

And they have to keep ahead of our customers too: second-guessing what they want and need before they do. As a Buying Administration Assistant you will support both the Buying Assistants and Buying Directors to stay ahead of the game, providing comprehensive and professional administrative support. If you are considering a career in buying, this could be the perfect first step.

We do things our own way at Aldi. But whatever we're doing, we must be getting it right. With a wave of impressive sales figures behind us, we're opening new stores at lightning speed. And to keep on top of that wave, our buying teams have to do something pretty special to keep our customers coming back for more.


The National Buying Administration Department are seeking a Buying Administrator to work on Business Partner (supplier) related activities.

The tasks carried out are key to the successful completion of onboarding Business Partners to ALDIs new ways of working. The Administrator would also be responsible for collating, sorting, and verifying the accuracy of Business Partner Information and entering onto the system accurately and at speed. The team’s goal is to take Business Partner queries from the desks of the wider department, centralize and create a hub of knowledge and experience for this process.

The role requires an individual with a consistently positive approach, high attention to detail and is passionate about quality. The Administrator must be a confident communicator as there will be interaction with both internal and external stakeholders.

The Administrator will be expected to demonstrate their ability to achieve and exceed department KPI’s and run an organized and transparent desk to ensure the wider department is kept up to date.

If you’re a hardworking individual that’s ready to kick-start your career with an award-winning employer, apply to join #TeamAldi today!

title: Warehouse Lead
description:
Job Description

Pertemps Kettering are recruiting exclusively on behalf of our client who are well established and the biggest company in their sector. They have many years of experience in the design and manufacture of premium quality equipment.

By building trust through sincere engagement, open relations and behaving with integrity, our clients’ decisions will be better informed and more suitably aligned to their customer needs. Only then will they add the necessary 'value add' to their proposition, relationships.

What are they looking for?
They are looking for a competent Service Controller to organise and direct the Service Admin & planning team of the After Sales Department. You will be responsible for assessing their work and give them feedback to maximise performance.

An excellent Service Controller must have customer service and leadership/ management experience.
The ideal candidate must possess great communication skills and be able to motivate and have a positive attitude. You will be organised and reliable as well as results oriented. The goal is to achieve excellent performance from your team that will bring sustainable business growth.

Service Controller (Office Team Leader) Job Description:
You will have a passion for delivering exceptional customer service with the determination to expand your knowledge and inspire others; you will demonstrate enthusiasm and self-motivation to excel in After Sales.

In your role as a Service Controller, you will be the main point of contact for customers, responsible for delivering best-in-class customer support, whilst working as an integral part of the team, being flexible and adapting the way that you work. Duties will include:
    Manages and oversee a team of Service & Planning Administrators.
    Oversee the planning of the Field Service and Workshop Engineers workload
    Motivates and supports staff through feedback and communication.
    Measures KPls such as inbound calls, call waiting, outstanding jobs, and call abandonment.
    Be the first point of contact for all incoming calls and apply customer escalation process through a triage system.
    Seeing calls and ticketed jobs through to completion through proactive monitoring and high-quality customer service.
    Assists the team with complex caseload and jobs.
    Improves quality of results by recommending changes.
    Provides product/service information by answering questions and helping.
    Keep track of employee attendance, and make sure work procedures are complied with.
    Assist in hiring and onboarding new employees.
    Prepares monthly performance reports.
    Creates targets and goals for improvement.
    Keep management informed on issues and problems.

What Do I need?
    It is essential that you have experience managing and leading a team.
    Proven track record of working in the delivery of exceptional customer service with critical thinking abilities.
    Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-changing and flexible environment.
    Strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate with a range of internal and external stakeholders.
    Commercial awareness and astute decision making based on a plethora of business requirements.
    Customer service skills including questioning, probing, listening, and establishing rapport.
    Demonstrable experience working with clients over the telephone and via email.
    Knowledge and ability to use various Ms Office Applications such as Ms outlook, Ms excel and Ms Word.
    Proactive approach and ability to communicate effectively with a wide range of people.
    Excellent attention to detail is essential.
    Experience in lifting equipment or vehicle mechanics preferable.
    Ability to work under pressure.
    A results orientated approach.

The Package:
    A competitive basis salary of £28,000.
    24 Days Holiday + 8 Bank Holiday Days Incremental Continuous Service Holiday
    Group life Assurance (after a qualifying period)
    On-site secure parking
    Access to an Employee Assistance Programme (mental health, professional financial advice)
    Discounted technology, gym memberships, high street vouchers, etc
    Great scope for progression and continued learning/development.
    Pension Scheme

Interested? Please

title: Administrative Assistant

The role would be based at one of our residential locations in the Coalville area, but you may also be required to work from other locations across the locality, as need arises. We are happy to discuss flexible working patterns including combining working from home alongside working from our residential locations.

Would you like to join a charity that makes a real difference? Our services in Leicestershire provide intensive, therapeutic and specialist support within residential settings. You will be joining our dedicated Leicestershire team, providing the necessary support for Children and Young People.

Please specify on your application any particular working pattern you may have in mind. You will be required to travel between locations, so either access to your own transport or the ability to access public transport is required.

As an Administrator, you will provide high quality administrative support within our Leicestershire range of services. It's important that you can work with lots of flexibility in your approach to work, as you will be managing multiple tasks at any one time. You will be competent and self-motivated with fantastic verbal and written communication skills.

What you will bring as an administrator:

Education/Knowledge

Experience

  • Substantial experience of IT systems including the use of word, Excel and database systems.

Substantial experience of general office procedures.
Relevant experience of dealing with external agencies.
Substantial experience of data inputting, maintaining records and producing statistical reports.
Substantial experience of telephone/reception duties.

Please note due to the high volume of applications for some posts, this advert might close before the displayed closing date. We recommend that you apply for this role as soon as possible.

title: Office Administrator
description:

As an Office Administrator at Cliniwaste, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of our office. You will provide essential administrative support to our team, ensuring a well-organised work environment and a positive experience for our clients and advisors.

Assist with data entry, filing, and record-keeping tasks, ensuring accuracy and organisation. Coordinate appointments, meetings, and office calendars to facilitate efficient scheduling. title: Assistant Buyer
description:
Our buying teams - if it's possible - have to move even quicker than the rest of the business.

And they have to keep ahead of our customers too: second-guessing what they want and need before they do. As a Buying Administration Assistant you will support both the Buying Assistants and Buying Directors to stay ahead of the game, providing comprehensive and professional administrative support. If you are considering a career in buying, this could be the perfect first step.

We do things our own way at Aldi. But whatever we're doing, we must be getting it right. With a wave of impressive sales figures behind us, we're opening new stores at lightning speed. And to keep on top of that wave, our buying teams have to do something pretty special to keep our customers coming back for more.


National Buying Administration are seeking an Administrator to join the Supplier Administration & Service Team - an area with exciting opportunities for growth and development.

The Administrator will work as part of a team, responsible for collating, sorting, and verifying the accuracy of New Supplier Information and entering onto the system accurately and at speed. The team goal is to take administration tasks concerning Suppliers from the desks of the wider department, centralize and create a hub of knowledge and experience for this process. The role would involve handling multiple tasks and projects at any one time and would require an individual who is able to multi-task whilst maintaining a passion to learn and be challenged.

The Administrator is expected to become an expert in their field and identify process improvements to aid the smooth running of the department.

If you’re looking for a career with a business that means more to it’s colleagues, join #TeamAldi today!


Your New Role

  • Follow data entry procedures
  • Keep information confidential and comply with data integrity and security policies
  • Demonstrate their ability to achieve and exceed department KPI’s
  • Run an organised and transparent desk to ensure the wider department is kept up to date with the progress of the New Supplier setup within agreed timeframes
  • Become an expert in their field and identify process improvements to aid the smooth running of the department.

About You

  • Data entry, manipulation and interrogation of business data
  • Experience of analysing data
  • Meticulously follows rules and procedures to ensure work is completed to the required Aldi standard - is process driven and does not 'cut corners’
  • High levels of accuracy
  • Confident with MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint
  • Comfortable dealing with high volumes of data
  • Ability to proactively work towards challenging deadlines through multitasking and resilience
  • Highly organised
  • Able to work under pressure and deliver against short deadlines
  • Can deliver solutions autonomously
  • High levels of initiative and proactivity
  • Intellectually curious and takes initiative

What You’ll get in Return

  • Salary details £25,100 rising to £30,875
  • Monday to Friday, 8am to 4:30pm, with the opportunity of 2 days a week remote working
  • 5 weeks’ annual leave plus Bank Holidays
  • In office flexi-time
  • Full training provided
  • Pension scheme
  • Private employee medical insurance after 4 years
  • Company sick pay scheme
  • Company maternity and adoption pay after 1 year and paternity leave pay after 2 years
  • Long service rewards
  • Access to MyBenefits, where you can find a wide range of benefits, including our bike to work scheme, shopping and cinema discounts, health cash plan, a FREE will, travel and discounted gym memberships, as well as a host of benefits to support your financial and wellbeing needs.
  • Access to a free,24/7, confidential virtual GP service for all Aldi Colleagues and their children (under the age of 16)


Aldi is an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and are dedicated to promoting a culture of inclusion, providing an environment in which collaboration, respect and fairness are essential. We value diversity and are dedicated to treating all of our colleagues and prospective colleagues fairly and with respect.

If you’re looking for a career that gives you more, apply today!

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Company Description


As our Cloud Engineer, you will design, implement, maintain and provide support for our cloud-based systems and applications. You'll be responsible for ensuring that our systems are designed for high availability and performance, and are able to scale to meet the demands of our growing business. The role will require you to work part of a team in developing and maintaining our automated build and deployment processes.

Join us at Greene King the country's leading pub company and brewer, where our mission is to pour happiness into lives and become the pride of great British hospitality. We have something special, deeply rooted in our 220-year brewing and pub history, creating the business we are proudly known for today. Still today our 39,000 strong team are the guardians of what’s wholly British, the pub experience.


Additional Information


In reward for your hard work, you will receive...

A competitive salary, pension contribution as well as:

  • 33 days Holiday – With the opportunity to buy an additional 5 days!
  • Life Assurance – Up to 4 times your salary!
  • Discounted Dental & Health Insurance
  • Discount of 33% for you and 15% for your loved ones on all of our brands – so you enjoy your favourite food and drink at a discount
  • Free employee assistance program – Mental Health, well-being, Financial, and Legal support because you matter!
  • Discount of 50% for you and 25% for your loved ones at our Greene King Inns and hotels. – so, you can enjoy a weekend away without breaking the bank
  • Refer a friend – Who do you know who could be interested in a new role? When they are placed, you could earn up to £1,500 for referring them!
  • Retail discounts – Receive up to 30% of at Superdrug, exclusive discounts with Three mobile along with many more…
  • The chance to further your career across our well-known brands – As one of the industry's top apprenticeship providers, we can provide training and development at each level of your career

Job Description


In your role as Cloud engineer you will...

  • Develop and maintain Azure cloud infrastructure, including virtual networks, storage accounts, and virtual machines
  • Design and implement cloud-based solutions using Azure services such as App Services, Functions, and Logic Apps
  • Monitor and troubleshoot cloud-based applications and services, automate cloud-based deployments using Azure DevOps
  • Implement security best practices for cloud-based applications and services, design and implement cost-effective cloud-based solutions including designing and implement backup and disaster recovery solutions
  • Develop and maintain Azure automation scripts
  • Monitor and optimize cloud-based resources for performance and cost
  • Participate in the design and implementation of cloud-based solutions for customer

What you will bring....

  • Hard working with the ability to work under pressure with the self-motivation and ability to work unsupervised
  • Persistent, tenacious and diligent with keen attention to detail
  • Good customer communication skills
  • Azure Cloud Services, Azure App Services, Azure Functions, Azure Automation
  • Team Collaboration and Productivity
  • Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills

Knowledge of:

  • Cloud Infrastructure Design, Cloud-based Application Development
  • Azure Logic Apps
  • Linux and Windows Server Operating Systems
  • Software Development / Deployment pipelines
  • Development and DevOps processes
  • Web Application Firewalls
  • Azure Active Directory, Virtual Networks, Storage Accounts, Virtual Machines
  • Cloud Security Best Practices, Resource Optimization, Scalability, Performance Monitoring, Cloud-based Solution Implementation
  • Backup and Disaster Recovery
  • Team Collaboration and Productivity
  • Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills

Qualifications


Qualified in / studying towards relevant qualifications for role or equivalent

  • Microsoft Azure Fundamentals
  • Microsoft Azure Administrator
  • Microsoft Azure Architect Design
  • Microsoft Azure Architect Technologies

title: Data Administrator
description:
Our Incora Story is really taking off – we’d love you to join us for the journey!

We are currently seeking a fantastic German speaking Data Administrator to join us at our site in Derby. The successful candidate will be fluent in both English and German.

As the leading supply chain solutions business in the aerospace industry, our customers are at the heart of our business.

As a Data Administrator your role will be to update current data and process new data to ensure that it remains accurate and up to date for customers.

You will use pricing files from either the customer or internal procurement to ensure correct pricing is on the system and conduct data audits when necessary.

You will work in a team environment, whilst also working cross functionally to drive customer service and performance.

This entry level role is a great opportunity for someone looking to grow and develop a career within an evolving organisation.

About You

You will have excellent attention to detail and have gained some data entry experience in a previous role.

Ideally, you will know your way around Excel, however, training will be given. It is also desirable for you to have some knowledge or understanding of how a supply chain operates.

You will be an enthusiastic and willing learner with a readiness to work in a global, fast paced, dynamic working environment.

You will be a German speaker with the ability to communicate both verbally and in written form at a fluent, professional level.

Most importantly you will be passionate about our Incora Values and exceeding customer expectations:

  • Courage - Take ownership for issues and problems.
  • Collaboration - Share knowledge and experience with others
  • Commitment - Focus on ensuring internal and external customer expectations are met in a timely way.

In return we will offer the things that matter:

  • Starting salary between £22,000 - £25,000.
  • We want you to share in the success of Incora, so every employee is eligible for one of our incentive programs.
  • We want you to enjoy life as well as work so we offer great holiday benefits such as 25 days holiday plus 8 bank holidays with a holiday buying scheme with the ability to buy up to 5 additional days
  • We want you to have peace of mind regarding your future with our generous Company pension scheme including 4 times salary life cover
  • We want to help you look after you and your family by providing healthcare cash plans saving you money and helping you to stay well
  • We want to support you and the people that matter to you with our flexible working and family friendly policies and practices
  • Incora cares about our environmental impact and that’s why we reward people who use green transport to travel to work with our Green Travel Allowance
  • We believe every little helps by offering a generous discount portal only available to Incora employees
  • Very importantly we want to be with you to help your career take off and become part of the Incora Story

So, if you feel you have all of this, and want to be part of developing the Incora Story apply now - we can’t wait to hear from you!

We are passionate about Diversity & Inclusion and we welcome applications from all persons regardless of their age, race, gender, disability, religion/belief, or sexual orientation.

Incora™ is a leading, global provider of innovative supply chain solutions. Our promise to our customers is to reduce complexity and increase reliability so they can deliver mission-critical solutions that improve our world. We exist to enable the mission critical.

With a strong foundation in the aerospace and defence markets, we also utilize our expertise to serve industrial manufacturing, marine, pharmaceuticals, and beyond. We manage all aspects of supply chain from procurement to warehouse management, from logistics to on-site customer services.

We pride ourselves on offering:

  • Industry-leading capabilities
  • Innovative solutions
  • Greater customer value
  • Trusted supplier relationships
  • Business growth and operational efficiency

title: Office Administrator
description:
We are working with an established client based in Lamport, Northants, they have a requirement for a permanent Office Administrator to undertake responsibility for a variety of Administration duties supporting the Team Manager in an existing team of 7. This is a varied, busy role and requires candidates with previous experience in a similar role. Due to the rural location of this role it is essential you have your own transport.




The Role

title: Administrator
description:
Cameo is a leading provider of Enterprise IT & Telephony services, operating within the IT Channel! At Cameo, we operate in a very fast-paced and dynamic environment, with so many opportunities for learning and development to progress you throughout your career…

Job title

Quotes Administrator

Department

Quotes & Implementation

Location

Office Based in Broughton Astley, Leicester

The Job Role

As a Quotes and Implementation Analyst you will manage opportunities by actioning quote requests received from customers directly or the Revenue Team via e-mail. You’ll provide technical quote preparation and produce quotes in a standardised format by using our bespoke internal quoting system.

You will also be responsible for implementing all orders received for either new or renewal business, ensuring processes are followed at all times.

Job purpose

The primary focus of the role is delivering quote requests within deadlines to a high standard consistently and efficiently ensuring we get it right everytime. As a Team member you’ll own and manage requests, reviewing information provided and ensuring the highest level of accuracy is achieved.

Once confident in quoting you’ll then be trained in implementation and be responsible for processing contracts within our system for customers.

The role encompasses a range of responsibilities, providing support and expertise to our internal teams in every aspect of the Quotes and Implementation journey from start to finish. Alongside various teams in the business we work to deliver pricing for a variety of opportunities: from hardware maintenance, project work and much more!

Key Responsibilities

  • Own and manage both incoming and outgoing requests for quotes in our Quotes inbox.
  • Manage deadlines on the quotes to ensure these are hit.
  • Analyse information provided by customers to pick out relevant equipment and recognise additional requirements.
  • Achieve a high level of understanding of our products and services in order to provide accurate quotations.
  • Add comprehensive details about parts to internal pricebooks to enable accurate quote preparation.
  • Prepare quotes using our internal bespoke system, often working on multiple opportunities at once whilst pricing is finalised by our Bid Team.
  • Follow set processes when quoting.
  • Engage an incredible attention to detail to achieve 100% accuracy at all times.
  • Ensuring best working practice and process is being adhered to and driving the “right first time” way of working.
  • Work as a team with other colleagues across the Quote & Implementation inboxes, particularly during busier periods or holidays to achieve team KPIs.
  • Encourage customer satisfaction, identifying areas for improvements and supporting the team managers to ensure processes and procedures are effective and relevant.
  • Ensure that each customer touch point throughout the process has the customer at the forefront of the actions and decisions.
  • Liaise with various departments as needed, completing support tasks as required.
  • Work through the Implementation inbox, processing orders for hardware maintenance.
  • Implement any necessary actions required for a variety of contract types.
  • Answer customer queries across both inboxes, as part of this a grasp of internal procedures is essential.
  • Process cancellation and amendment requests from customers.
  • Ensure continuous personal development by being curious around technology developments - Identifying training requirements with own skill gap analysis.

Additional information

We are looking for an applicant who has experience in managing data and is competent in following processes. Some technical knowledge is desirable, although extensive training will be provided.

The ideal person for this role will have data analytical skills along with order processing/Implementation experience and have the ability to excel in a fast paced environment, delivering first class customer service.

The successful candidate will be excited about the opportunity to work with a driven team that delivers an industry leading service.

Experience providing excellent customer service.

Experience in working to and meeting tight deadlines and the ability to work well under pressure, especially during busier periods.

Analyse and interpret detailed and sometimes poorly defined information; make sound and accurate judgments based on knowledge.

Affinity for working on multiple projects at once without compromising on excellence.

Experience working with processes and ability to follow set guidelines.

Previous experience in a quotes or processing role.

A superuser of G Workspace and Google Sheets or Microsoft Office.

Transferable skills / knowledge

An incredible attention to detail is essential.

Amazing communication skills.

Ability to collaborate with other team members and build relationships both internally and externally.

Experience managing and achieving Team KPI’s.

Specialist training

A keen desire to learn the Techy stuff.

Experience in a Tech role or a genuine interest in Tech.

Personal competencies
and qualities

Very organised and punctual.

Flexibility to adapt to changing requirements.

Positive Can Do attitude - someone who likes to ensure things are done right the first time.

Be collaborative and open to opportunities in the business.

Full and clean driving licence.

What can you expect from us?

Personal growth within a supportive and collaborative role.

The chance to gain experience working within a fast-paced Communications and IT company.

Working with a team of highly skilled Individuals.

Empowerment within your role to make decisions and improve processes to help further the performance of Cameo.

Competitive salary.

Chance for internal progression.

Access to private healthcare (once probation period has been passed).

title: Administrator
description:
Company Description


Warrens (Part of the Culina Group) provides baked goods transport and warehouse services and has a trusted reputation for customer care, flexibility, speed and responsiveness. Warrens are a primary distributor for Tesco & JS, also working with but not limited to other daily FMCG customers such as major supermarkets with a tremendous industry reputation for its dedication towards its services.

At Culina Group we have a winning culture, we believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive… A place where you're valued, challenged, and inspired!


Job Description


We now have an exciting opportunity for an individual wanting to kickstart their career in transport and logistics to support the operation with dispatching and debriefing drivers. This role will provide exposure and progression opportunities throughout Warrens and the wider group.

Shift: 4 on 4 off nights, 18:00- 06:00

Salary: £24,878.40 per annum plus £2000 night allowance

Reporting to the Transport Supervisor, the Transport Administrator will be responsible for provision of administrative support and creation of accurate data.

Key duties of a Transport Administrator:

  • Accurate data collation to support on time collections and deliveries
  • Monitoring and maintaining records for agency drivers
  • Inputting and monitoring drivers’ holidays and sickness absence, maintaining the time-keeping and attendance system and processing sick notes
  • Regularly updating the WTD system, ensuring the data is up to date and accurate
  • Creating and providing daily reports to the Transport department regarding tachograph information
  • Receiving and monitoring fuel deliveries, maintaining the fuel monitoring system
  • Support investigation of any driver wage queries
  • Providing various reports / spreadsheets for internal departments in a timely manner
  • Carrying out any other formal and legal duties
  • Contribute to on time operations by tracking both client collections and retailer deliveries.
  • Escalation both internally and direct to the client in the event of delays or likely impact to schedule
  • Supporting rebooking and redeliveries

Qualifications

  • Previous experience gained in a similar role is preferred but not essential as training will be provided.
  • Excellent administration skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to succeed in a pressurised environment
  • Able to work using own initiative and with little supervision
  • Good knowledge of MS Office, in particular Excel, Word, Outlook (or equivalent)

Additional Information


As part of our drive to make Warrens a great place to work. We are proud to be an inclusive and diverse organisation where we are committed to employee development and recognising success for hard working performers.

Our dedicated learning and development programmes are open to every employee to give you the opportunity to shape your own future within logistics and continue to work in an environment where team culture thrives.

Our People are the driving force behind our success, which is why we offer a wide range of benefits which include:

  • Annual Leave – Competitive holiday entitlement of 20 Days including bank holidays
  • Pension scheme – we want colleagues to enjoy a comfortable retirement so we offer a great contribution of 4% employee and 4% employer
  • Life Assurance - x2 your annual salary
  • Wellness – Via our Employee Assistance Programme we offer immediate access to a confidential telephone counselling and legal information service that operates 24 hours a days, 365 days a year
  • Eye Care Vouchers – We can provide you with substantial savings with free eye tests and discounts on prescription glasses
  • Reward & Recognition – We recognise that employees have gone the extra mile via Employee of the month and year, special recognition and long service awards.
  • Everyday discounts - via our benefit platform you will have access to over 50 retailer discounts for everyday savings!

If you meet the requirements for the above role and are looking for your next career opportunity please apply now and become a part of our #WinningTeam!

title: 2nd Line Support Engineer
description:
2nd Line IT Support Engineer

Bold IT are a well-established IT managed services provider with a proven track record of delivering exceptional service since 1993. We provide project delivery, IT support, business telecoms and cyber security to over 120 businesses nationwide and internationally.

A Microsoft Solutions partner, certified to ISO 9001 and Cyber Essentials; we are looking for engineers with a passion for IT who are excited to be a part of our growing team.

This exciting role will place you at the heart of a fast-growing and agile MSP which has experienced 80% year on growth in the B2B sector, providing successful candidates with the ideal environment to develop their skills and career.

Job Description:

This role will work closely with the technical director and service delivery manager to assist them in providing high-quality support, both remotely and on-premises, when required. In addition, you will be involved in various infrastructure projects, such as server migrations, network configurations and VoIP installations. Candidates with experience providing cyber security and Azure to customers are also desirable.

Essential Skills

· A minimum of 3 years previous experience within an IT support position, preferably with an IT MSP.

· Experience in delivering Cyber Security solutions, such as SATT, dark-web monitoring and cloud based infrastructure monitoring

· Excellent Office 365 knowledge (including One Drive, SharePoint & Exchange)

· Experience in deploying and troubleshooting Windows OS for both servers and workstations

· Strong understanding of Active Directory and Hyper-V configuration and management.

· Experience with helpdesk PSAs/RMM systems

· Network device installation such as printers, firewalls, switches and routers.

· Desktop & Laptop repair and troubleshooting

· DNS, DHCP, VPN, LAN, WAN troubleshooting and implementation

· Full UK driving license and access to own vehicle

· Able to work to industry best practise standards

· Experience in migrating on-premises infrastructure to the cloud

· A strong understanding of Firewalls and networking (Palo Alto & Ubiquiti desirable)

Desirable Skills

· VoIP implementation and management

· Experience in providing cyber security

· Microsoft Azure experience including AZ-104 certification

· Disaster recovery planning and monitoring

· Microsoft 365 Certified: Enterprise Administrator Expert (MS-101 & MS-102)

· Server 2012 R2, 2016, 2019 & 2022 administration

Personal Attributes:

The candidate must possess a strong work ethic, be passionate about IT, and commit to self-directed learning to obtain industry qualifications. A high level of interpersonal skills and an ability to communicate effectively with our customers is vital to the role. Working independently with great attention to detail is also considered essential.

Candidates must possess a current UK driving license and have access to their own vehicle.

Compensation:

£28,000 to £32,000 per annum depending on experience + bonuses

Training, both In-house and with 3rd parties

Microsoft Certification costs covered

Paid annual leave on your birthday

Free Parking

Career development and career path planning.

title: Sales Administrator
description:
• Reputable business offering progression
  • Flexible hybrid working options

About Our Client

Market leading engineering business based in Rugby. This nationwide business has a fantastic reputation working with customers from the construction, automotive and engineering industry. Due to growth in business they are seeking a pro-active Sales Administrator to join the team on a full time, permanent basis.

Job Description

As a sales administrator you will:

  • Manage incoming export sales requests via email and telephone and prepare quotations for external customers
  • Liaise with freight contacts to prepare export documentation including declarations
  • Liaise with external suppliers and customers to update and maintain product information internally
  • Work alongside internal sales executives to provide assistance to customers via inbound enquiries
  • Accurately process quotes through the internal systems
  • Work with accounts team to raise accurate credit notes
  • Provide adhoc administrative support to other departments when required

The Successful Applicant

As a Sales Administrator you will have:

title: Data Administrator
description:
Our Incora Story is really taking off – we’d love you to join us for the journey!

We are currently seeking a fantastic German speaking Data Administrator to join us at our site in Derby. The successful candidate will be fluent in both English and German.

As the leading supply chain solutions business in the aerospace industry, our customers are at the heart of our business.

As a Data Administrator your role will be to update current data and process new data to ensure that it remains accurate and up to date for customers.

You will use pricing files from either the customer or internal procurement to ensure correct pricing is on the system and conduct data audits when necessary.

You will work in a team environment, whilst also working cross functionally to drive customer service and performance.

This entry level role is a great opportunity for someone looking to grow and develop a career within an evolving organisation.

About You

You will have excellent attention to detail and have gained some data entry experience in a previous role.

Ideally, you will know your way around Excel, however, training will be given. It is also desirable for you to have some knowledge or understanding of how a supply chain operates.

You will be an enthusiastic and willing learner with a readiness to work in a global, fast paced, dynamic working environment.

You will be a German speaker with the ability to communicate both verbally and in written form at a fluent, professional level.

Most importantly you will be passionate about our Incora Values and exceeding customer expectations:

  • Courage - Take ownership for issues and problems.
  • Collaboration - Share knowledge and experience with others
  • Commitment - Focus on ensuring internal and external customer expectations are met in a timely way.

In return we will offer the things that matter:

  • Starting salary between £22,000 - £25,000.
  • We want you to share in the success of Incora, so every employee is eligible for one of our incentive programs.
  • We want you to enjoy life as well as work so we offer great holiday benefits such as 25 days holiday plus 8 bank holidays with a holiday buying scheme with the ability to buy up to 5 additional days
  • We want you to have peace of mind regarding your future with our generous Company pension scheme including 4 times salary life cover
  • We want to help you look after you and your family by providing healthcare cash plans saving you money and helping you to stay well
  • We want to support you and the people that matter to you with our flexible working and family friendly policies and practices
  • Incora cares about our environmental impact and that’s why we reward people who use green transport to travel to work with our Green Travel Allowance
  • We believe every little helps by offering a generous discount portal only available to Incora employees
  • Very importantly we want to be with you to help your career take off and become part of the Incora Story

So, if you feel you have all of this, and want to be part of developing the Incora Story apply now - we can’t wait to hear from you!

We are passionate about Diversity & Inclusion and we welcome applications from all persons regardless of their age, race, gender, disability, religion/belief, or sexual orientation.

Incora™ is a leading, global provider of innovative supply chain solutions. Our promise to our customers is to reduce complexity and increase reliability so they can deliver mission-critical solutions that improve our world. We exist to enable the mission critical.

With a strong foundation in the aerospace and defence markets, we also utilize our expertise to serve industrial manufacturing, marine, pharmaceuticals, and beyond. We manage all aspects of supply chain from procurement to warehouse management, from logistics to on-site customer services.

We pride ourselves on offering:

  • Industry-leading capabilities
  • Innovative solutions
  • Greater customer value
  • Trusted supplier relationships
  • Business growth and operational efficiency

title: Administrator
description:
Cameo is a leading provider of Enterprise IT & Telephony services, operating within the IT Channel! At Cameo, we operate in a very fast-paced and dynamic environment, with so many opportunities for learning and development to progress you throughout your career…

Job title

Quotes Administrator

Department

Quotes & Implementation

Location

Office Based in Broughton Astley, Leicester

The Job Role

As a Quotes and Implementation Analyst you will manage opportunities by actioning quote requests received from customers directly or the Revenue Team via e-mail. You’ll provide technical quote preparation and produce quotes in a standardised format by using our bespoke internal quoting system.

You will also be responsible for implementing all orders received for either new or renewal business, ensuring processes are followed at all times.

Job purpose

The primary focus of the role is delivering quote requests within deadlines to a high standard consistently and efficiently ensuring we get it right everytime. As a Team member you’ll own and manage requests, reviewing information provided and ensuring the highest level of accuracy is achieved.

Once confident in quoting you’ll then be trained in implementation and be responsible for processing contracts within our system for customers.

The role encompasses a range of responsibilities, providing support and expertise to our internal teams in every aspect of the Quotes and Implementation journey from start to finish. Alongside various teams in the business we work to deliver pricing for a variety of opportunities: from hardware maintenance, project work and much more!

Key Responsibilities

  • Own and manage both incoming and outgoing requests for quotes in our Quotes inbox.
  • Manage deadlines on the quotes to ensure these are hit.
  • Analyse information provided by customers to pick out relevant equipment and recognise additional requirements.
  • Achieve a high level of understanding of our products and services in order to provide accurate quotations.
  • Add comprehensive details about parts to internal pricebooks to enable accurate quote preparation.
  • Prepare quotes using our internal bespoke system, often working on multiple opportunities at once whilst pricing is finalised by our Bid Team.
  • Follow set processes when quoting.
  • Engage an incredible attention to detail to achieve 100% accuracy at all times.
  • Ensuring best working practice and process is being adhered to and driving the “right first time” way of working.
  • Work as a team with other colleagues across the Quote & Implementation inboxes, particularly during busier periods or holidays to achieve team KPIs.
  • Encourage customer satisfaction, identifying areas for improvements and supporting the team managers to ensure processes and procedures are effective and relevant.
  • Ensure that each customer touch point throughout the process has the customer at the forefront of the actions and decisions.
  • Liaise with various departments as needed, completing support tasks as required.
  • Work through the Implementation inbox, processing orders for hardware maintenance.
  • Implement any necessary actions required for a variety of contract types.
  • Answer customer queries across both inboxes, as part of this a grasp of internal procedures is essential.
  • Process cancellation and amendment requests from customers.
  • Ensure continuous personal development by being curious around technology developments - Identifying training requirements with own skill gap analysis.

Additional information

We are looking for an applicant who has experience in managing data and is competent in following processes. Some technical knowledge is desirable, although extensive training will be provided.

The ideal person for this role will have data analytical skills along with order processing/Implementation experience and have the ability to excel in a fast paced environment, delivering first class customer service.

The successful candidate will be excited about the opportunity to work with a driven team that delivers an industry leading service.

Experience providing excellent customer service.

Experience in working to and meeting tight deadlines and the ability to work well under pressure, especially during busier periods.

Analyse and interpret detailed and sometimes poorly defined information; make sound and accurate judgments based on knowledge.

Affinity for working on multiple projects at once without compromising on excellence.

Experience working with processes and ability to follow set guidelines.

Previous experience in a quotes or processing role.

A superuser of G Workspace and Google Sheets or Microsoft Office.

Transferable skills / knowledge

An incredible attention to detail is essential.

Amazing communication skills.

Ability to collaborate with other team members and build relationships both internally and externally.

Experience managing and achieving Team KPI’s.

Specialist training

A keen desire to learn the Techy stuff.

Experience in a Tech role or a genuine interest in Tech.

Personal competencies
and qualities

Very organised and punctual.

Flexibility to adapt to changing requirements.

Positive Can Do attitude - someone who likes to ensure things are done right the first time.

Be collaborative and open to opportunities in the business.

Full and clean driving licence.

What can you expect from us?

Personal growth within a supportive and collaborative role.

The chance to gain experience working within a fast-paced Communications and IT company.

Working with a team of highly skilled Individuals.

Empowerment within your role to make decisions and improve processes to help further the performance of Cameo.

Competitive salary.

Chance for internal progression.

Access to private healthcare (once probation period has been passed).
