title: System Engineer
description:
About the Role:
How you will contribute:

  • Work closely with the Infrastructure IT team and other relevant departments to understand their requirements and translate them into practical and effective IT solutions.
  • Contribute to the ongoing evaluation and implementation of new technologies and tools, recommending appropriate additions or enhancements to the existing infrastructure. Additionally, the role will involve monitoring system performance, conducting routine maintenance tasks, and implementing security protocols to safeguard against potential threats.
  • Executing and overseeing the deployment of hardware and software solutions, as well as integrating them into the existing infrastructure.
  • Deploy, configure, and maintain VMware infrastructure, ensuring efficient virtualization and resource utilization
  • Implement and manage multi-factor authentication solutions for enhanced security across various systems and applications.
  • Deploy, configure, and maintain Windows Server 2016, 2019 and 2022 infrastructure, ensuring optimal performance and security.
  • Manage and monitor Endpoint security Platforms including detection and respond to advanced threats.
  • Implement and maintain web and reverse proxy solutions, ensuring secure and reliable access to internal and external resources.
  • Oversee, configure and manage email security and threat protection platforms
  • Implement and manage backups and replication using platforms such as Commvault, Veeam, and Zerto for replication and disaster recovery purposes in Tier 4 datacenter environments.
  • Participate in an on-call Rota, providing remote support, incident management, and problem resolution following ITIL processes.
  • Stay up to date with the latest industry trends and emerging technologies, proactively making recommendations for improvement.
  • Collaborating with stakeholders and IT teams to design and deploy new systems and technologies that meet the organization's needs and objectives. This involves analyzing requirements, selecting appropriate hardware and software, and configuring systems for optimal performance.
  • Overseeing the installation, configuration, and maintenance of servers, both physical and virtual, to support various applications and services. They ensure servers are up-to-date, secure, and perform at their best capacity.
  • Implementing security measures and protocols to safeguard the organization's IT infrastructure from potential threats and cyberattacks. This may include setting up firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and access controls.
  • Constantly monitoring the health and performance of IT systems to identify and address potential problems proactively. They may perform routine maintenance tasks, apply software updates, and optimize configurations.
  • Investigating and resolving technical issues related to hardware, software, and network components. Troubleshooting may involve diagnosing problems, working with vendors, and collaborating with other IT specialists to find solutions.
  • Implementing and managing data backup strategies to ensure data integrity and availability. They may also create and maintain disaster recovery plans to minimize downtime in case of system failures or emergencies.
  • Maintaining comprehensive documentation of system configurations, processes, and procedures. They may also generate reports on system performance, security incidents, and other relevant metrics.
  • Staying up to date with emerging technologies and trends in the IT industry. They assess the potential benefits and drawbacks of new technologies to make informed recommendations to the organization.

Your Key Skills/Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience)
  • Certifications such as ITIL Foundation, CompTIA A+, Net +, Microsoft Certified: Modern Desktop Administrator Associate, or similar, VMWare VCP.
  • Passionate individual with strong proactive work attitude, self starter, adaptable who welcomes challenge and problem solving
  • Solid experience in managing and maintaining Windows Server environments.
  • Strong knowledge of Endpoint protection for threat detection and response.
  • Proficiency in web and reverse proxy technologies, such as Nginx or Apache.
  • Experience in implementing and managing web security and cloud services such as Zscaler.
  • Deep understanding of Microsoft Active Directory, DNS, and DHCP.
  • Familiarity with email security platforms, their administration and deployment.
  • Working knowledge of Certificate Authorities and digital certificates.
  • Experience with Azure cloud services and Office365 administration.
  • Proficiency in backup and replication technologies, such as Commvault, Veeam, and Zerto.
  • Solid understanding of VMware infrastructure and virtualization technologies, particularly in Tier 4 datacentre environment

Compensation
DP World offers exciting and challenging roles within a growing international organization. We strive to hire and develop the right people, locally and globally, stimulating personal growth and self-development within an informal atmosphere. We offer a market competitive compensation package.

About DP World
Trade is the lifeblood of the global economy, creating opportunities and improving the quality of life for people around the world. DP World exists to make the world’s trade flow better, changing what’s possible for the customers and communities we serve globally.
With a dedicated, diverse and professional team of more than 103,000 employees spanning 75 countries on six continents, DP World is pushing trade further and faster towards a seamless supply chain that’s fit for the future.
We’re rapidly transforming and integrating our businesses - Ports and Terminals, Marine Services, Logistics and Technology – and uniting our global infrastructure with local expertise to create stronger, more efficient end-to-end supply chain solutions that can change the way the world trades. The DP World family comprises of syncreon, Imperial and P&O.
What's more, we're reshaping the future by investing in innovation. From intelligent delivery systems to automated warehouse stacking, we’re at the cutting edge of disruptive technology, pushing the sector towards better ways to trade, minimising disruptions from the factory floor to the customer’s door.
WE MAKE TRADE FLOW
TO CHANGE WHAT'S POSSIBLE FOR EVERYONE
DP World is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO). We strongly believe that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success and we make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We believe that employees are happiest when they’re empowered to be their true, authentic selves. So, please come as you are. We can’t wait to meet you.

By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize DP World to transmit and store your information in the world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.

Job Segment: Logistics, Systems Engineer, Supply Chain, System Administrator, Cloud, Operations, Engineering, Technology

Work Location: Hybrid remote

title: Sales Support Representative
description:
We're looking for a Sales Support Administrator to provide administrative support to our sales teams. The role is broad and busy meaning that there's lots to do and plenty to learn. In the role, you'll always be one step ahead, foreseeing things that need to be done and focusing on quality to ensure that the team adds value, saves time, and makes things simple for our sales team.


What you'll be getting up to

  • To quality control any contract submissions that come through from our internal sales team or our external partners - this will involve call listening against the supplier's verbal scripts and/or verifying information on a written document.
  • Repair contract errors on the sales teams/external partner's behalf where possible - this may involve customer contact.
  • To help the sales team/external partners with resolving any contract issues where required.
  • To help the sales team/external partners with any pricing issues they may be experiencing.
  • Liaising with suppliers either written or verbally to resolve any issues with contract submissions


Who are we

We're Utility Bidder. Since our launch in 2009, we've helped more than 75,000 UK businesses switch energy suppliers and save over 45% on their energy bills. Our mission is to become the number 1 energy broker within the UK.


Why join Team UB?

  • We're an award-winning business: with a fantastic reputation behind us and an exciting future ahead.
  • We have huge ambitions and we're growing fast: There really is no better place to make a big impact and unlock your potential than with us here at UB.
  • Continuous development: You can expect a personal development plan, designed to support your long-term goals and career.
  • How we work: At UB, you're treated like an adult to operate in what style works for you, we don't micromanage.
  • Our office space: Our team is based in our newly refurbished office in the heart of Corby.
  • Fun + collaborative culture: Life at UB is fun, fast, collaborative, and supportive. We go the extra mile to ensure our people are happy, motivated, and fulfilling their potential.
  • Plenty of perks: There are many incentives to reward you for your results along the way, outside of purely a financial bonus: monthly lunches, early finishes, an annual all expenses paid trip abroad, summer and winter parties, team building events and many more. You also have your very own games area in the office!


What's on offer?

  • Office hours 9:00am - 5.30pm Monday to Friday - we're also happy to discuss flexible working arrangements.
  • 25 days holiday (plus bank holidays) - and if that's not enough you can also buy & sell holidays too.
  • Free parking
  • Yearly company-wide holiday (Ibiza 2023)
  • Summer and Winter Socials
  • Employee Assistance Programme - with 24/7 access to a Remote GP
  • Cycle to Work Scheme & Tech Scheme
  • Pension Scheme
  • Life Assurance cover
  • Ongoing opportunities to progress your career


If you're ready to take your career to the next level, apply today and become part of #TeamUB!


Your application will be processed via Occupop our applicant tracking system


The controller of your data is Utility Bidder Ltd with its registered office in Corby, UK. The data is collected for the

purposes of recruitment for the position given in the advertisement. All data provided in this application is processed using a third party supplier

'Occupop' with data stored on their systems.


Providing personal information is voluntary but we will be unable to process your application. Detailed

information on the processing of personal data by Utility Bidder Ltd can be found in our Privacy

Policy.


I agree to the processing of my personal data by Utility Bidder Ltd for the purposes of this recruitment process for the position specified in the advertisement. By applying to this job you also accept the Privacy Policy of Occupop.

title: Intake Coordinator
description:
St. James's Place (SJP) works in partnership to plan, grow and protect our clients’ financial futures. We deliver personalised, face-to-face financial advice to our clients, who trust us to manage their money to reach their goals. We provide this service via the Partnership, a network of qualified, expert advisors. We put financial wellbeing and responsible business choices at the heart of everything we do. We believe in the value of difference and know that diverse teams can help us problem and innovate for clients.

We look for people to join SJP to make an impact and to contribute to our culture which is based around long term relationships, doing the right thing, and being the best version of ourselves.

Coordinator Intake Management

Location: Nottingham Office / Cirencester Office

Workplace Type: On-Site

Employment Type: 14 month Fixed-Term Contract

Seniority: Entry Level

The main purpose of the role is to be responsible for the organisation and delivery of programme events across Terms 1-4 of the Early Years programme, whilst building and developing strong relationships with recruits and being the main point of contact of multiple intakes over the period of a year.

You will ensure recruit experience is not compromised by proactively planning ahead, keeping key stakeholders informed of changes and effective problem solving.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Having full ownership and accountability for the organization, consistency & timely delivery of programme events, both virtual and face to face across Terms 1 – 4 of Early Years.
  • Supporting the Academy Training Consultants and Managers with the scheduling of events, ensuring timely and accurate communication with recruits about the events and being responsible for resolving unexpected issues utilising problem-solving skills to come up with pragmatic solutions.
  • Building and developing internal and external stakeholder relationships, including Partners and Advisers within Early Years.
  • Loading Learning & Development content onto the system for recruits in a timely manner and working with the Team Manager - Intake Management to monitor budget and expenses for event.
  • Using initiative to flag suggestions for process improvement and supporting other team members with cover as and when required.

Who we’re looking for:

An experienced administrator with strong organisational skills and the following:

  • Strong IT capability including Microsoft Office skills: Word, Excel & PowerPoint.
  • Ability to build strong relationships with others, internally and externally and with excellent written and verbal communication skills, appropriate to all levels.
  • High attention to detail, working with accuracy and precision and able to work independently, prioritising own workload.
  • A varied and comprehensive knowledge of how all the different roles operate within Early Years and the wider Operating Model.
  • A high degree of problem-solving skills, being able to work effectively with key stakeholders to resolve issues without compromising the recruit experience.

Special Requirements

  • Travel or overnight stays will be required to attend intake events.
  • Subject to the SJP Share Dealing policy and Share Dealing codes due to the access to confidential company information.

What's in it for you?

  • Non-Contributory Pension – 10% (increasing with length of service up to 15%) with further pension matching.
  • Parental leave – 6 months full pay
  • 28 days holiday entitlement plus bank holidays (based on full-time equivalent) with the option to buy up to an additional 5 days holiday

Flexible Working
We know that everyone works best in different ways, at different times and in different environments. We have introduced a hybrid working policy to provide greater flexibility for part-time work, job-sharing, remote working, and flexibility on hours. Our people are encouraged to work in a flexible way that suits their lifestyle, so please ask the question and start a conversation!

Research tells us that applicants (especially those from underrepresented groups) can be put off from applying for a role if they do not meet all the criteria or have been on an extended career-break. If you think you would be a good match for this role and can demonstrate some transferable experience please apply, regardless of whether you tick every box.

What's next?

Our team will be in touch. As a business regulated by the FCA we would advise you to familiarise yourself with the conduct regulations and in particular consumer duty obligations prior to an interview with SJP.

title: Database Administrator
description:
Would you like to work for a dynamic technology company in Nottingham? Data is at the heart of everything we do, and by joining the TDX Group we want you to help lead the way by utilising your hands-on DBA skills and expertise!

This is an exciting opportunity to join TDX as we continue our transformation to Google Cloud. This role offers the opportunity to work with public and private sector clients, partner with Google to evolve our software, daily interaction with colleagues across the business including operations, analysts and technology and work on leading technologies.

As well as helping to maintain and improve our existing capabilities (which are primarily Microsoft based - MS SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS), we are looking for someone to help drive and shape best practices around how we manage and use our data and partner with our MS SQL Server DBA Team Lead. As our transformation gathers pace we need skilled individuals like you to help us migrate to the cloud, moving and re-shaping our data as we go.

Training opportunities will be provided via Coursera as well as the chance to partner and learn from others. You will also be actively encouraged and sponsored to become Google certified!

About TDX Group - An Equifax Company

We've been a pioneer in the debt recovery industry for over a decade, helping businesses drive fair and appropriate consumer treatment by using data and intelligence.

We meet the exacting standards of our clients who are some of the biggest banking, retail and utility names as well as the UK government. The key to TDX's success has been the scope to build and deliver industry-leading performance portfolios, combining precise execution with high quality analytical insight and continuous creativity to our partners.

What you’ll do

  • Balance good practice, maintainability, company goals, regulatory requirements, security and user needs into solutions

  • Maintaining the day-to-day availability of all database servers

  • Responsible for implementing and maintaining a strong approach to system monitoring

  • Experience in managing high performance and availability of the databases that support critical business systems in a 24/7 environment

  • You will manage the databases through the entire product lifecycle including design, development, testing and deployment and also run / maintenance tasks (backups, incident management, managing performance etc).

  • Work independently to implement medium-large solutions.

  • Identify and the implement automatable activities in order to improve efficiency and makes recommendations on other areas for improvement

  • Define and enhance quality assurance and quality control processes to reduce the number of production incidents

  • Develop, manage and test back-up and recovery plans

What experience you need

  • MS SQL Server DBA skills; working with SQL20016 to SQL2019

    • Administering and configuring SQL Server for optimal use

    • SQL Maintenance: Backups/Integrity checks/Index Maintenance

    • Using Monitoring tools/Working with SQL Server error logs

    • Experience of TDE and TLS

    • SQL Replication

    • Upgrading/patching SQL Server

    • Experience in complex T-SQL Code

    • Documentation of processes

  • Junior to mid DBA currently

  • Experience of database development in a large complex environment

  • Strong data modeling and design skills, performance tuning of MS SQL Server databases

  • Be available for the on call rota

  • SC clearance is required on joining

What could set you apart

  • Active Cloud Certification strongly preferred

  • Experience of databases in cloud, especially on Google Platform - e.g. Cloud SQL, Big Query

  • Migration of SQL Databases from Data Centers to Cloud Platforms

  • Working with clients and security teams on yearly security audits

  • Working on large databases that are multiple terabytes in size

  • Understanding of MS SQL Server BI toolset - SSAS (OLAP Cubes), SSIS, SSRS

  • GITHub and Jenkins experience

  • Good understanding of agile methodologies

#LI-KB1

title: Warranty Administrator
description:

  • Length: Permanent
  • Salary: TBC
Description

Job description

Established over 25 years ago, Sutton Park Group now represents 3 Motor Manufacturers from 7 locations across the West Midlands, Staffordshire and Warwickshire and is one of the best privately owned Motor Groups in the region.

As we are committed to growing our business, an opportunity has arisen for a highly organised, committed Warranty Auditor to join the teams at our Renault Dealerships

We are looking for someone that has a desire to succeed, has outstanding communication and influencing skills and also possesses a proven track record of success.

Main Duties:

  • Review the warranty/ debtor accounts, ensuring the age profile of all debts are within acceptable limits. Any recoverable amounts must be identified and written off on a timely basis.

Relevant Experience & Qualifications Required:

  • Excellent communication, organisation and inter-personal skills.

Company Benefits:

When you join the Sutton Park team you will have the opportunity to develop a fast-moving progressive career, and assume accountability for delivering the highest levels of service. We believe that by identifying your potential and investing in your future, you will be able to develop skills and gain the experience that will enhance your career prospects.
In addition to receiving a competitive salary and compay car, you will also have access to a range of other benefits including preferential Sales and Service rates, entry into a Company Pension scheme after a qualifying period.

title: PHP Developer
description:
We are looking for an experienced PHP / Laravel developer to join our Development team. You will be responsible for the build, maintenance and upgrade of websites and applications. If you have excellent programming skills and a passion for developing applications or improving existing ones, we would like to meet you.

You will predominantly work on all of our PHP based projects with a focus on maintaining and enhancing our existing Laravel websites.

KEY TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES

  • PHP 7 – Object Orientated
  • MySQL 5.6+
  • HTML5 / CSS3(SASS) / Javascript
  • Responsive Design
  • Laravel / WordPress
  • Version Controlling (Git)

MUST HAVES

  • Write clean code to develop functional web applications
  • Troubleshoot and debug applications
  • Manage cutting-edge technologies to improve legacy applications
  • Collaborate with Front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server side logic
  • Gather and address technical and design requirements
  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use
  • Liaise with developers, designers and system administrators to identify new features
  • Team Player with great communication skills

JOB DESCRIPTION

ATTITUDE & APPLICATION

  • Take responsibility for the performance and delivery of your own work

  • Be organised and effectively mange your time and workload

FIFTEEN SKILLS

Ability to live by the Fifteen culture and values: Mutual respect, listen, have fun, ability to innovate and exceed customer expectations on time every time.

HOURS AND ENVIRONMENT:

APPLICATIONS

If you have the knowledge and skills to manage this important part of our business, email careers@fifteendesign.co.uk

title: Administrator
description:
Our client is highly respected in their field and are currently looking for an Administrator to join their team based at their Derby office on Pride Park. The main purpose of this role is to provide administrative support to the Sales department/Director. Key responsibilities will include:

  • Typing of a variety of documents including emails, letters, memos, reports, presentations, minutes.
  • Diary management for the Area Sales Director.
  • Booking travel/accommodation for the Area Sales Director
  • Monitoring the Area Sales Directors emails.
  • Processing expense claims/credit card statements for the Area Sales Director.
  • Arranging meeting and meeting rooms, welcoming visitors and arranging tea/coffee/lunches

  • Organising and maintaining all relevant training records.
  • Collating monthly and quarterly commission claims for submission to Payroll.
  • Plotting and updating the staffing rota.

  • Collating and distributing weekly/ monthly sales reports.
  • Answering calls from customers / employees

It is envisaged that the successful candidate will be an experienced administrator who is highly organised with a flexible approach and a proven ability to multi-task. You should also have excellent communication skills and be adept in using Word, Excel and PowerPoint.

If you are looking for a new challenge and want to work for a great company with an excellent reputation, please apply now. However, if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours, kindly assume that you have been unsuccessful on this occasion. (agy)

title: Systems Administrator
description:
A new opportunity has opened up within our team to be one of the custodians of our internal systems. You'll be ensuring the tech, gear, and software we use remains best practice, is well maintained, and delights our team and clients.

Imagine this – it’s Monday morning. You’re working from the office today and you have a smile on your face as you leave your home for the trip into work. You know that when you arrive, you’ll be spending the day tinkering with the latest in technology software, security, production kit, and computers. You’ll be sharing a beverage of your choice with team mates who are excited to tell you about a client launch that’s about to happen or a workshop that will be hosted later in the week. You love these conversations because you’re aware that you’ll be part of these events during the week. Whether it’s ensuring the workshop set up has all the remote facilities it needs or reinforcing some of our technology infrastructure for an upcoming launch – you feel connected in the team.

This is a highlight of what life is like as an Augie, and particularly what life could be like for you if you become our Internal Systems Administrator. We have done a lot of work over the last few years to establish a strong foundation in latest hardware, a standard operating system, and delighting our clients with technology that is seamless. If you’re someone who is always looking for ways to make this area of a business better, more effective, maybe even more automated…and you’d like to do that within a team that values belonging, effort, and play, then we’d love to hear from you.

This role in the words of August team members

It’s not every day you get to hear about a role from the person who was in it, or who they work with. Take a look at these behind the scenes chats to learn more about this unique Internal Systems Administrator role and the quality team you’ll be working with.

The job in 55 words or less

  • Set up and maintenance of team hardware - we're all Mac users and this will include support systems for provisioning our Standard Operating System.
  • Studio hardware management - docking stations at our desks, monitors, conference hardware (we have a pretty awesome kit), and content studio hardware.
  • User account management - setting up new August team members, making safe prior user accounts, day to day maintenance via on site DC and Office 365.
  • Ensuring the in house network system is top notch - fileservers, back ups, studio internet connection, and VPN.

Does this sound like you?

  • Minimum 6 years' experience in a Sys Admin or DevOps Engineer role (if you have slightly less experience, we still encourage you to apply!)
  • Experience with, and an interest in, continuing to improve data and infrastructure security practices for our clients and us.
  • Participating in a supportive culture where team conversations can revolve around belonging and feedback.
  • While you can work autonomously, team and client connection and communication is important to you.
  • A desire to learn new technologies, to push/challenge the technical capability within our team and to grow with the role, regardless of your experience.
  • Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science or Electronics Engineering experience with set up and management of open source software stacks.

You get extra credit for

  • Experience with becoming ISO certified
  • Set up and training in AI models
  • Qualifications in data security

What you will get

Working at August is not just another agency job. While we take our work seriously, we really enjoy the company of the people we work with and we don’t take ourselves too seriously. It takes time to find the right people to join our team. There’s a level of trust and flexibility that is hard to describe, but here goes nothing. You’ll enjoy the freedom to create and contribute to sophisticated projects the way you want, combined with a robustness of process that ensures you have total support to focus all your energy and inspiration on compelling design and technical challenges. If you’d like more detail, we’d love you to ask us about it!

Our values play an important part in everything we do at August. They help us deliver epic work for clients around the world and they’ve seen us through some difficult times. As a team member, you’ll continue to develop not just your technical craft, but other valuable qualities such as powerful communication skills, commercial and business nous, and handy insights into totally random stuff, like a quick and easy killer dumpling recipe, or the engineering magic behind the latest SpaceX test flight (again, you might want to ask us!). When we hire someone to join the team, we’re interested and invested in all the different parts that make up you – because ultimately, that’s what makes August.

As a team member, you can also expect:

  • A competitive salary package with various incentives and rewards.
  • Flexible and hybrid working is part of our daily jam.
  • Working within a highly motivated, talented and technology–driven team.
  • A team of people who will invest in your career progression
    and development.
  • Generous company policies that help you grow and balance life.
  • Many other perks we will discuss when we meet you.

Apply Now

Applications for this role are open now and we are actively hiring to fill this spot in our team.

If you have questions about this role or about August, feel free to contact us and ask for Sarah.

To apply for this position, you need to:

  • Mention one of our clients in your application.
  • Provide your CV, outlining your skills and experience.
  • Include a covering letter explaining why you are perfect for this role.
  • If you have a personal website or folio site, feel free to include it in your application; we’d love to check it out.

Are you a recruiter?

We understand you work in a competitive industry and you will be tempted to contact us with potential candidates for this and other listed roles. We respectfully request that you do not contact us regarding applicants for
this role and please do not send us unsolicited applications.

About August

August is an independent award-winning digital consultancy headquartered in Melbourne, Australia. We aim to nudge the world just enough to make a change. Help us to make it happen.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at August. We don’t discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Development Operations Engineer
description:
A rare opportunity has opened up (seriously, this one is rare) to work within our high performing technology-led team where your role is focused on maintaining and growing the latest in good infrastructure technology and practices - both for our clients and us.

No one at August has titles so this was was a tricky role to name! There are however, some titles you could attribute to this role that would make sense to someone outside August. These titles would sound like Hosting SysAdmin, Hosting Manager, Systems Administrator, DevOps Hosting…you get where we’re going?

You’ll become a custodian of our client hosting infrastructure and be able to deliver support that makes the Nights Watch look…a little tame. This role works predominantly with Hashistack in AWS. If you don’t have experience with that, don’t worry – we’re known for investing in our team and we’ll onboard you plus ensure you’re always supported. We’re a team after all.

When you’re working with the other developers and helping them out on code deploys, you’ll be working in your familiar environments of GitHub, BuildKite, and Docker. We love open source and expect that you do too if you’re reading this.

The August team is smart and nimble; working together to help our clients change and build innovative applications. We are committed to learning and sharing something new every day.

While we expect this to be a full time role, we’re always open to chatting about part time options.

DevOps Engineers work within our diverse team to ensure our infrastructure is top notch and our clients are receiving the best experience we can provide them. We are fixated on improving our clients’ outcomes. We expect that you’re someone who values this as well.

This role in the words of August team members

It’s not every day you get to hear about a role from the person who was in it, or who they work with. Take a look at these behind the scenes chats to learn more about this unique DevOps role and the quality team you’ll be working with.

The job in 55 words or less

  • Being the custodian and delivering delightful support of our client hosting infrastructure - you'll be working with a fully spec'd out Hashistack in AWS.
  • You'll be providing DevOps support for code deploys by the team and you love working with tech such as GitHub, BuildKite, and Docker.
  • Monitoring and logging of all services we're working with.
  • Interacting with clients and team members when they need your specialist expertise.
  • Building relationships with our clients' technical teams so that we can continue our reputation for silky smooth dev work.
  • Helping us delight our clients beyond their expectations.

Does this sound like you?

  • Minimum 6 years' experience in a Sys Admin or DevOps Engineer role (if you have slightly less experience, we still encourage you to apply!)
  • Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science or Electronics Engineering experience with set up and management of open source software stacks.
  • A desire to learn new technologies, to push/challenge the technical capability within our team and to grow with the role, regardless of your experience.
  • While you can work autonomously, team and client connection and communication is important to you.
  • Participating in a supportive culture where team conversations can revolve around belonging and feedback.
  • Experience with, and an interest in, continuing to improve data and infrastructure security practices for our clients and us.

You get extra credit for

  • Experience with becoming ISO certified
  • Set up and training in AI models
  • Supporting developers in building out containerised workloads
  • Qualifications in data security

What you will get

Working at August is not just another agency job. While we take our work seriously, we really enjoy the company of the people we work with and we don’t take ourselves too seriously. It takes time to find the right people to join our team. There’s a level of trust and flexibility that is hard to describe, but here goes nothing. You’ll enjoy the freedom to create and contribute to sophisticated projects the way you want, combined with a robustness of process that ensures you have total support to focus all your energy and inspiration on compelling design and technical challenges. If you’d like more detail, we’d love you to ask us about it!

Our values play an important part in everything we do at August. They help us deliver epic work for clients around the world and they’ve seen us through some difficult times. As a team member, you’ll continue to develop not just your technical craft, but other valuable qualities such as powerful communication skills, commercial and business nous, and handy insights into totally random stuff, like a quick and easy killer dumpling recipe, or the engineering magic behind the latest SpaceX test flight (again, you might want to ask us!). When we hire someone to join the team, we’re interested and invested in all the different parts that make up you – because ultimately, that’s what makes August.

As a team member, you can also expect:

  • A competitive salary package with various incentives and rewards.
  • Flexible and hybrid working is part of our daily jam.
  • Working within a highly motivated, talented and technology–driven team.
  • A team of people who will invest in your career progression
    and development.
  • Generous company policies that help you grow and balance life.
  • Many other perks we will discuss when we meet you.

Apply Now

Applications for this role are open now and we are actively hiring to fill this spot in our team.

If you have questions about this role or about August, feel free to contact us and ask for Sarah.

To apply for this position, you need to:

  • Mention one of our clients in your application.
  • Provide your CV, outlining your skills and experience.
  • Include a covering letter explaining why you are perfect for this role.
  • If you have a personal website or folio site, feel free to include it in your application; we’d love to check it out.

Are you a recruiter?

We understand you work in a competitive industry and you will be tempted to contact us with potential candidates for this and other listed roles. We respectfully request that you do not contact us regarding applicants for
this role and please do not send us unsolicited applications.

About August

title: Sales Administrator
description:
Our client is an established business based on Centrum 100 in Burton. Due to incoming business they are set to expand considerably over the next two years and as such, have an exciting opportunity for a Sales Administrator to add to their team. With accurate and thorough administration skills and an outgoing personality your general duties will entail:

  • Placing orders with suppliers
  • Updating clients on delivery details
  • Arranging fitment of accessories
  • Completion of post-delivery documentation
  • Diary management
  • Maintenance of records

Our client is looking to appoint someone with exceptional customer service skills who is used to working with processes and systems. You should also be IT literate and have excellent interpersonal skills. If you can work under pressure and you are looking for a new challenge, we would love for you to apply. However, if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours, kindly assume you have been unsuccessful on this occasion. (agy)

title: Scheduler
description:
We are currently working with an innovative, family-run SME who are seeking a Scheduling Administrator to join their Maintenance team based in Enderby. Your role will be to be responsible for the day-to-day planning of the Maintenance Teams workload. This includes planning the rounds and calls to be done by each Maintenance Technician, planning in additional visits to respond to issues flagged up, and communicating the above to the relevant parties. Additionally you will work with the team to ensure that new calls are added to the system and visited promptly, and that rounds are kept do-able and as efficient as possible.

Responsibilities:
  • Plan the coming weeks workload for the Maintenance Technicians
  • Upload this work into the system, and issue to the team
  • Ensure that customer complaints and issues are handled promptly, and that the Customer Service team is updated
  • Ensure that customer complaints are resolved within 3 working days of the complaint being received.
  • Run reports on calls that have been missed that day, and ensure these are planned back in the same day.
  • Keep JobLogic fully up to date with any changes, new visits etc.
  • Make sure that Technicians are kept fully informed regarding their workload, especially around any changes to their day / extra calls that are required etc.
  • Report each week to your line manager and the Head of Operations on Maintenance Team performance
  • Actively look for inefficiencies, improvements, and better ways of operating, and feed these back to your line manager.
  • Report successes and problems to your line manager and help find and implement solutions to issues that need resolving. Compile non-conformity reports where required.
  • Attend weekly Team Meetings and Operations Meetings as required.
Requirements:
  • Highly organised and capable of running multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • A clear thinker, who can quickly find logical, cost-effective, efficient solution to issues.
  • Proactive, with the ability to thrive in reactive situations.
  • Can cope with things going wrong and the unexpected occurring, and quickly find new solutions and ways around these problems.
  • A good grasp of the geography and road network of the UK.
  • Excellent communication and people skills.
  • Strong analytical and time management skills.
  • Systems orientated, and a confident user of IT.
  • Education that demonstrates the competency to fulfil this role.
  • Previous experience in a similar role.
  • UK Driving license.
Benefits:
Salary- £30,000- £35,000
Hours- 7am- 15.50pm Monday- Friday

title: Database Administrator
description:
SQL Server Database Administrator / DBA

Burton upon Trent / Hybrid Working

c£45,000 + Bonus + Excellent Benefits
We’re looking for an experienced SQL Server DBA to join an awesome IT Team based in Burton upon Trent to manage the development and support of MS SQL Databases that support their applications. Delivering a first-class service, you will ensure the optimal performance and security of all production databases, advise of potential risks and mitigations, and proactively take steps to ensure smooth performance.

We are looking for strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills, along with;
  • Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
  • In-depth SQL Server Database Administration experience
  • Experience of managing multiple MS SQL 2014 & MS SQL 2016
  • Strong self-sufficiency and initiative working on projects
  • Practical experience monitoring and tuning a database to provide high availability service
  • Experience of Transactional SQL and DTS stored procedures
  • Practical experience in managing the internal and external MS SQL database security
  • Experience with High Availability Databases

Working as part of a multi-discipline team, the role includes;
  • Responsibility for ensuring availability and performance of the databases
  • Working to ensure that the associated hardware resources are allocated to the databases and a high resilience (including performance tuning as required)
  • Proactively monitoring database systems to ensure secure services with minimum downtime (SQL Server 2014 & SQL Server 2016)
  • Responsibility for providing meaningful analysis to support any informed decisions regarding resource management
  • Troubleshooting and problem solving in the SQL environment
  • Taking ownership and to be the point of contact for escalated queries in the event of issues
  • Responsibility for Installation, configuration and upgrading of Microsoft SQL Server software and related products (for example SSRS)
  • Responsibility for implementation and release of database changes, service packs etc. according to agreed timescales and costs
  • Establishing and maintaining sound backup and recovery policies and procedures
  • Responsible for restoration of the environment in the event of invoking Disaster Recovery
  • Implementing and maintaining database security (create and maintain users and roles, assign privileges)
  • Application Support for various applications, for example Dynamics NAV 2018 & EDI data flows
If you think you’ve got what it takes, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Database Administrator
description:
A young and rapidly expanding company we are growing our technical team. We are looking for a skilled SQL Server DBA Consultant to come on board and join our highly experienced team of Database Administrators who have a proven track record in delivering market leading Database Managed Services.


Your role will be to provide DBA support and Strategic Consultancy through remote and onsite delivery.


Required Skills:


  • Expert SQL Server skills (additional Oracle knowledge advantageous)
  • At least 4 years’ Database Administration experience
  • Ability to communicate with all levels within the customer environment, up to and including C-Level
  • Capability to generate confidence in your technical proficiency
  • Ability to recognise the opportunity for ongoing services and to position accordingly with the customer
  • Multiple version capability with understanding of future technology road-map
  • Expertise in complex environments - i.e. Virtualised and Clustered Systems
  • Expertise in High Availability architectures and setting up back-up and recovery procedures
  • Excellent written skills and report production a must

Key Responsibilities:


  • To provide high quality DBA support services to business clients
  • To deliver work in adherence with security and operational processes
  • To be reliable, punctual and to work with agreed service level agreements
  • To help develop and mentor junior members of the technical team
  • To give full commitment to developing skills and attending training courses as provided

Remuneration:


  • Up to £50k + Bonus
  • Company pension
  • Lap-top & phone
  • Expenses

title: Billing Administrator
description:
Role: Billings Administrator
Salary: Up to £28,000
Benefits : 33 days holidays with ability to increase by 4 days, healthcare and cycle to work schemes, social events and death in service
Location: Nottingham (NG8)
Type: Permanent

Overview

2fawcett are recruiting for a Billings Administrator, to join a company located in Nottingham on a permanent basis. This Billings Administrator will be joining a leading global innovator who deliver solutions across the workplace.

As the Billings Administrator you will be reporting into a finance manager your main areas of responsibility are billing and credit control working collaboratively within our fast-paced finance team.

The Role & Responsibilities of the Billings Administrator

Credit control when required.
Account reconciliation where required.
Obtain credit reports, assess, and open accounts for new customers within credit control guidelines
Monthly review of debtors with Finance Manager
Daily interface of invoices and credits raised on ERP system into finance system
Daily monitoring &/or input of e-commerce transactions
Month end procedures and Ledger Management
Review and develop reporting and procedures to ensure best practice

Requirements of the Billings Administrator

Ideally will have experience of credit control / billings
Comfortable using Microsoft Excel

What will you get in return

33 days holidays with ability to increase by 4 days
Healthcare scheme
Cycle to work scheme
Companywide social events
Death in service

Monday - Friday 9am – 5:30pm

  • Company events
  • Company pension

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Data Administrator
description:
Our Incora Story is really taking off – we’d love you to join us for the journey!

We are currently seeking a fantastic German speaking Data Administrator to join us at our site in Derby. The successful candidate will be fluent in both English and German.

As the leading supply chain solutions business in the aerospace industry, our customers are at the heart of our business.

As a Data Administrator your role will be to update current data and process new data to ensure that it remains accurate and up to date for customers.

You will use pricing files from either the customer or internal procurement to ensure correct pricing is on the system and conduct data audits when necessary.

You will work in a team environment, whilst also working cross functionally to drive customer service and performance.

This entry level role is a great opportunity for someone looking to grow and develop a career within an evolving organisation.

About You

You will have excellent attention to detail and have gained some data entry experience in a previous role.

Ideally, you will know your way around Excel, however, training will be given. It is also desirable for you to have some knowledge or understanding of how a supply chain operates.

You will be an enthusiastic and willing learner with a readiness to work in a global, fast paced, dynamic working environment.

You will be a German speaker with the ability to communicate both verbally and in written form at a fluent, professional level.

Most importantly you will be passionate about our Incora Values and exceeding customer expectations:

  • Courage - Take ownership for issues and problems.
  • Collaboration - Share knowledge and experience with others
  • Commitment - Focus on ensuring internal and external customer expectations are met in a timely way.

In return we will offer the things that matter:

  • Starting salary between £22,000 - £25,000.
  • We want you to share in the success of Incora, so every employee is eligible for one of our incentive programs.
  • We want you to enjoy life as well as work so we offer great holiday benefits such as 25 days holiday plus 8 bank holidays with a holiday buying scheme with the ability to buy up to 5 additional days
  • We want you to have peace of mind regarding your future with our generous Company pension scheme including 4 times salary life cover
  • We want to help you look after you and your family by providing healthcare cash plans saving you money and helping you to stay well
  • We want to support you and the people that matter to you with our flexible working and family friendly policies and practices
  • Incora cares about our environmental impact and that’s why we reward people who use green transport to travel to work with our Green Travel Allowance
  • We believe every little helps by offering a generous discount portal only available to Incora employees
  • Very importantly we want to be with you to help your career take off and become part of the Incora Story

So, if you feel you have all of this, and want to be part of developing the Incora Story apply now - we can’t wait to hear from you!

We are passionate about Diversity & Inclusion and we welcome applications from all persons regardless of their age, race, gender, disability, religion/belief, or sexual orientation.

Incora™ is a leading, global provider of innovative supply chain solutions. Our promise to our customers is to reduce complexity and increase reliability so they can deliver mission-critical solutions that improve our world. We exist to enable the mission critical.

With a strong foundation in the aerospace and defence markets, we also utilize our expertise to serve industrial manufacturing, marine, pharmaceuticals, and beyond. We manage all aspects of supply chain from procurement to warehouse management, from logistics to on-site customer services.

We pride ourselves on offering:

  • Industry-leading capabilities
  • Innovative solutions
  • Greater customer value
  • Trusted supplier relationships
  • Business growth and operational efficiency

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £22,000.00-£25,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Additional leave
  • Company pension
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Free or subsidised travel
  • On-site parking
  • Referral programme
  • Sick pay
  • Store discount
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Yearly bonus

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Derby

Reference ID: VN3257

title: Office Administrator
description:
We are working with an established client based in Lamport, Northants, they have a requirement for a permanent Office Administrator to undertake responsibility for a variety of Administration duties supporting the Team Manager in an existing team of 7. This is a varied, busy role and requires candidates with previous experience in a similar role. Due to the rural location of this role it is essential you have your own transport.




The Role




  • Always ensure the fair treatment of customers



  • Ensure compliance with Data Protection legislation



  • Ensure personal compliance with the applicable Conduct rules



  • Fully comply with all company processes and procedures



  • In carrying out the main accountabilities of the role ensure that all regulatory and statutory standards are met



  • Liaise with and support the Team Managers and Senior Managers.



  • Other ad-hoc duties as required by your Line Manager



  • Ensure Complaints are managed in accordance with the process and requirements, where applicable



  • Load client instructions onto in-house CRM system



  • Manage day to day client queries



  • To check, quality control, amend, reject reports to Clients



  • Ensure all reports satisfy the terms of SLAs





The Candidate






  • IT Literate

  • Attention to detail is essential



  • Professional manner



  • Very strong verbal and written communication skills as there will be phone work involved



  • Experience working with confidential information



  • Able to manage and prioritise your own workload

This is a permanent office based role, the working hours will be 8.30am to 5pm Monday to Friday, our client offers a competitive salary and benefits package, which includes free on-site parking and fabulous views from the office of the Northamptonshire countryside.

title: Administrator
description:
Cameo is a leading provider of Enterprise IT & Telephony services, operating within the IT Channel! At Cameo, we operate in a very fast-paced and dynamic environment, with so many opportunities for learning and development to progress you throughout your career…

Job title

Quotes Administrator

Department

Quotes & Implementation

Location

Office Based in Broughton Astley, Leicester

The Job Role

As a Quotes and Implementation Analyst you will manage opportunities by actioning quote requests received from customers directly or the Revenue Team via e-mail. You’ll provide technical quote preparation and produce quotes in a standardised format by using our bespoke internal quoting system.

You will also be responsible for implementing all orders received for either new or renewal business, ensuring processes are followed at all times.

Job purpose

The primary focus of the role is delivering quote requests within deadlines to a high standard consistently and efficiently ensuring we get it right everytime. As a Team member you’ll own and manage requests, reviewing information provided and ensuring the highest level of accuracy is achieved.

Once confident in quoting you’ll then be trained in implementation and be responsible for processing contracts within our system for customers.

The role encompasses a range of responsibilities, providing support and expertise to our internal teams in every aspect of the Quotes and Implementation journey from start to finish. Alongside various teams in the business we work to deliver pricing for a variety of opportunities: from hardware maintenance, project work and much more!

Key Responsibilities

  • Own and manage both incoming and outgoing requests for quotes in our Quotes inbox.
  • Manage deadlines on the quotes to ensure these are hit.
  • Analyse information provided by customers to pick out relevant equipment and recognise additional requirements.
  • Achieve a high level of understanding of our products and services in order to provide accurate quotations.
  • Add comprehensive details about parts to internal pricebooks to enable accurate quote preparation.
  • Prepare quotes using our internal bespoke system, often working on multiple opportunities at once whilst pricing is finalised by our Bid Team.
  • Follow set processes when quoting.
  • Engage an incredible attention to detail to achieve 100% accuracy at all times.
  • Ensuring best working practice and process is being adhered to and driving the “right first time” way of working.
  • Work as a team with other colleagues across the Quote & Implementation inboxes, particularly during busier periods or holidays to achieve team KPIs.
  • Encourage customer satisfaction, identifying areas for improvements and supporting the team managers to ensure processes and procedures are effective and relevant.
  • Ensure that each customer touch point throughout the process has the customer at the forefront of the actions and decisions.
  • Liaise with various departments as needed, completing support tasks as required.
  • Work through the Implementation inbox, processing orders for hardware maintenance.
  • Implement any necessary actions required for a variety of contract types.
  • Answer customer queries across both inboxes, as part of this a grasp of internal procedures is essential.
  • Process cancellation and amendment requests from customers.
  • Ensure continuous personal development by being curious around technology developments - Identifying training requirements with own skill gap analysis.

Additional information

We are looking for an applicant who has experience in managing data and is competent in following processes. Some technical knowledge is desirable, although extensive training will be provided.

The ideal person for this role will have data analytical skills along with order processing/Implementation experience and have the ability to excel in a fast paced environment, delivering first class customer service.

The successful candidate will be excited about the opportunity to work with a driven team that delivers an industry leading service.

Experience providing excellent customer service.

Experience in working to and meeting tight deadlines and the ability to work well under pressure, especially during busier periods.

Analyse and interpret detailed and sometimes poorly defined information; make sound and accurate judgments based on knowledge.

Affinity for working on multiple projects at once without compromising on excellence.

Experience working with processes and ability to follow set guidelines.

Previous experience in a quotes or processing role.

A superuser of G Workspace and Google Sheets or Microsoft Office.

Transferable skills / knowledge

An incredible attention to detail is essential.

Amazing communication skills.

Ability to collaborate with other team members and build relationships both internally and externally.

Experience managing and achieving Team KPI’s.

Specialist training

A keen desire to learn the Techy stuff.

Experience in a Tech role or a genuine interest in Tech.

Personal competencies
and qualities

Very organised and punctual.

Flexibility to adapt to changing requirements.

Positive Can Do attitude - someone who likes to ensure things are done right the first time.

Be collaborative and open to opportunities in the business.

Full and clean driving licence.

What can you expect from us?

Personal growth within a supportive and collaborative role.

The chance to gain experience working within a fast-paced Communications and IT company.

Working with a team of highly skilled Individuals.

Empowerment within your role to make decisions and improve processes to help further the performance of Cameo.

Competitive salary.

Chance for internal progression.

Access to private healthcare (once probation period has been passed).

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £20,000.00-£25,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Additional leave
  • Casual dress
  • Company pension
  • On-site gym
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Office Administrator
description:
GLB Property Services Limited require a full-time administrator/marketing assistant, the job role briefly comprises of the following,

  • Sales chasing
  • Assistance with property marketing
  • Administration for new & current business

The ideal candidate needs to be organised with strong administration skills, good with systems, a good team player with lots of common sense and happy to work in a small friendly team where flexibility is important. title: Administrator
description:
Company Description


Warrens (Part of the Culina Group) provides baked goods transport and warehouse services and has a trusted reputation for customer care, flexibility, speed and responsiveness. Warrens are a primary distributor for Tesco & JS, also working with but not limited to other daily FMCG customers such as major supermarkets with a tremendous industry reputation for its dedication towards its services.

At Culina Group we have a winning culture, we believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive… A place where you're valued, challenged, and inspired!


Job Description


We now have an exciting opportunity for an individual wanting to kickstart their career in transport and logistics to support the operation with dispatching and debriefing drivers. This role will provide exposure and progression opportunities throughout Warrens and the wider group.

Shift: 4 on 4 off nights, 18:00- 06:00

Salary: £24,878.40 per annum plus £2000 night allowance

Reporting to the Transport Supervisor, the Transport Administrator will be responsible for provision of administrative support and creation of accurate data.

Key duties of a Transport Administrator:

  • Accurate data collation to support on time collections and deliveries
  • Monitoring and maintaining records for agency drivers
  • Inputting and monitoring drivers’ holidays and sickness absence, maintaining the time-keeping and attendance system and processing sick notes
  • Regularly updating the WTD system, ensuring the data is up to date and accurate
  • Creating and providing daily reports to the Transport department regarding tachograph information
  • Receiving and monitoring fuel deliveries, maintaining the fuel monitoring system
  • Support investigation of any driver wage queries
  • Providing various reports / spreadsheets for internal departments in a timely manner
  • Carrying out any other formal and legal duties
  • Contribute to on time operations by tracking both client collections and retailer deliveries.
  • Escalation both internally and direct to the client in the event of delays or likely impact to schedule
  • Supporting rebooking and redeliveries

Qualifications

  • Previous experience gained in a similar role is preferred but not essential as training will be provided.
  • Excellent administration skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to succeed in a pressurised environment
  • Able to work using own initiative and with little supervision
  • Good knowledge of MS Office, in particular Excel, Word, Outlook (or equivalent)

Additional Information


As part of our drive to make Warrens a great place to work. We are proud to be an inclusive and diverse organisation where we are committed to employee development and recognising success for hard working performers.

Our dedicated learning and development programmes are open to every employee to give you the opportunity to shape your own future within logistics and continue to work in an environment where team culture thrives.

Our People are the driving force behind our success, which is why we offer a wide range of benefits which include:

  • Annual Leave – Competitive holiday entitlement of 20 Days including bank holidays
  • Pension scheme – we want colleagues to enjoy a comfortable retirement so we offer a great contribution of 4% employee and 4% employer
  • Life Assurance - x2 your annual salary
  • Wellness – Via our Employee Assistance Programme we offer immediate access to a confidential telephone counselling and legal information service that operates 24 hours a days, 365 days a year
  • Eye Care Vouchers – We can provide you with substantial savings with free eye tests and discounts on prescription glasses
  • Reward & Recognition – We recognise that employees have gone the extra mile via Employee of the month and year, special recognition and long service awards.
  • Everyday discounts - via our benefit platform you will have access to over 50 retailer discounts for everyday savings!

If you meet the requirements for the above role and are looking for your next career opportunity please apply now and become a part of our #WinningTeam!

title: 2nd Line Support Engineer
description:
2nd Line IT Support Engineer

Bold IT are a well-established IT managed services provider with a proven track record of delivering exceptional service since 1993. We provide project delivery, IT support, business telecoms and cyber security to over 120 businesses nationwide and internationally.

A Microsoft Solutions partner, certified to ISO 9001 and Cyber Essentials; we are looking for engineers with a passion for IT who are excited to be a part of our growing team.

This exciting role will place you at the heart of a fast-growing and agile MSP which has experienced 80% year on growth in the B2B sector, providing successful candidates with the ideal environment to develop their skills and career.

Job Description:

This role will work closely with the technical director and service delivery manager to assist them in providing high-quality support, both remotely and on-premises, when required. In addition, you will be involved in various infrastructure projects, such as server migrations, network configurations and VoIP installations. Candidates with experience providing cyber security and Azure to customers are also desirable.

Essential Skills

· A minimum of 3 years previous experience within an IT support position, preferably with an IT MSP.

· Experience in delivering Cyber Security solutions, such as SATT, dark-web monitoring and cloud based infrastructure monitoring

· Excellent Office 365 knowledge (including One Drive, SharePoint & Exchange)

· Experience in deploying and troubleshooting Windows OS for both servers and workstations

· Strong understanding of Active Directory and Hyper-V configuration and management.

· Experience with helpdesk PSAs/RMM systems

· Network device installation such as printers, firewalls, switches and routers.

· Desktop & Laptop repair and troubleshooting

· DNS, DHCP, VPN, LAN, WAN troubleshooting and implementation

· Full UK driving license and access to own vehicle

· Able to work to industry best practise standards

· Experience in migrating on-premises infrastructure to the cloud

· A strong understanding of Firewalls and networking (Palo Alto & Ubiquiti desirable)

Desirable Skills

· VoIP implementation and management

· Experience in providing cyber security

· Microsoft Azure experience including AZ-104 certification

· Disaster recovery planning and monitoring

· Microsoft 365 Certified: Enterprise Administrator Expert (MS-101 & MS-102)

· Server 2012 R2, 2016, 2019 & 2022 administration

Personal Attributes:

The candidate must possess a strong work ethic, be passionate about IT, and commit to self-directed learning to obtain industry qualifications. A high level of interpersonal skills and an ability to communicate effectively with our customers is vital to the role. Working independently with great attention to detail is also considered essential.

Candidates must possess a current UK driving license and have access to their own vehicle.

Compensation:

£28,000 to £32,000 per annum depending on experience + bonuses

Training, both In-house and with 3rd parties

Microsoft Certification costs covered

Paid annual leave on your birthday

Free Parking

Career development and career path planning.

title: System Engineer
description:
About the Role:
How you will contribute:

  • Work closely with the Infrastructure IT team and other relevant departments to understand their requirements and translate them into practical and effective IT solutions.
  • Contribute to the ongoing evaluation and implementation of new technologies and tools, recommending appropriate additions or enhancements to the existing infrastructure. Additionally, the role will involve monitoring system performance, conducting routine maintenance tasks, and implementing security protocols to safeguard against potential threats.
  • Executing and overseeing the deployment of hardware and software solutions, as well as integrating them into the existing infrastructure.
  • Deploy, configure, and maintain VMware infrastructure, ensuring efficient virtualization and resource utilization
  • Implement and manage multi-factor authentication solutions for enhanced security across various systems and applications.
  • Deploy, configure, and maintain Windows Server 2016, 2019 and 2022 infrastructure, ensuring optimal performance and security.
  • Manage and monitor Endpoint security Platforms including detection and respond to advanced threats.
  • Implement and maintain web and reverse proxy solutions, ensuring secure and reliable access to internal and external resources.
  • Oversee, configure and manage email security and threat protection platforms
  • Implement and manage backups and replication using platforms such as Commvault, Veeam, and Zerto for replication and disaster recovery purposes in Tier 4 datacenter environments.
  • Participate in an on-call Rota, providing remote support, incident management, and problem resolution following ITIL processes.
  • Stay up to date with the latest industry trends and emerging technologies, proactively making recommendations for improvement.
  • Collaborating with stakeholders and IT teams to design and deploy new systems and technologies that meet the organization's needs and objectives. This involves analyzing requirements, selecting appropriate hardware and software, and configuring systems for optimal performance.
  • Overseeing the installation, configuration, and maintenance of servers, both physical and virtual, to support various applications and services. They ensure servers are up-to-date, secure, and perform at their best capacity.
  • Implementing security measures and protocols to safeguard the organization's IT infrastructure from potential threats and cyberattacks. This may include setting up firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and access controls.
  • Constantly monitoring the health and performance of IT systems to identify and address potential problems proactively. They may perform routine maintenance tasks, apply software updates, and optimize configurations.
  • Investigating and resolving technical issues related to hardware, software, and network components. Troubleshooting may involve diagnosing problems, working with vendors, and collaborating with other IT specialists to find solutions.
  • Implementing and managing data backup strategies to ensure data integrity and availability. They may also create and maintain disaster recovery plans to minimize downtime in case of system failures or emergencies.
  • Maintaining comprehensive documentation of system configurations, processes, and procedures. They may also generate reports on system performance, security incidents, and other relevant metrics.
  • Staying up to date with emerging technologies and trends in the IT industry. They assess the potential benefits and drawbacks of new technologies to make informed recommendations to the organization.

Your Key Skills/Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience)
  • Certifications such as ITIL Foundation, CompTIA A+, Net +, Microsoft Certified: Modern Desktop Administrator Associate, or similar, VMWare VCP.
  • Passionate individual with strong proactive work attitude, self starter, adaptable who welcomes challenge and problem solving
  • Solid experience in managing and maintaining Windows Server environments.
  • Strong knowledge of Endpoint protection for threat detection and response.
  • Proficiency in web and reverse proxy technologies, such as Nginx or Apache.
  • Experience in implementing and managing web security and cloud services such as Zscaler.
  • Deep understanding of Microsoft Active Directory, DNS, and DHCP.
  • Familiarity with email security platforms, their administration and deployment.
  • Working knowledge of Certificate Authorities and digital certificates.
  • Experience with Azure cloud services and Office365 administration.
  • Proficiency in backup and replication technologies, such as Commvault, Veeam, and Zerto.
  • Solid understanding of VMware infrastructure and virtualization technologies, particularly in Tier 4 datacentre environment

Compensation
DP World offers exciting and challenging roles within a growing international organization. We strive to hire and develop the right people, locally and globally, stimulating personal growth and self-development within an informal atmosphere. We offer a market competitive compensation package.

About DP World
Trade is the lifeblood of the global economy, creating opportunities and improving the quality of life for people around the world. DP World exists to make the world’s trade flow better, changing what’s possible for the customers and communities we serve globally.
With a dedicated, diverse and professional team of more than 103,000 employees spanning 75 countries on six continents, DP World is pushing trade further and faster towards a seamless supply chain that’s fit for the future.
We’re rapidly transforming and integrating our businesses - Ports and Terminals, Marine Services, Logistics and Technology – and uniting our global infrastructure with local expertise to create stronger, more efficient end-to-end supply chain solutions that can change the way the world trades. The DP World family comprises of syncreon, Imperial and P&O.
What's more, we're reshaping the future by investing in innovation. From intelligent delivery systems to automated warehouse stacking, we’re at the cutting edge of disruptive technology, pushing the sector towards better ways to trade, minimising disruptions from the factory floor to the customer’s door.
WE MAKE TRADE FLOW
TO CHANGE WHAT'S POSSIBLE FOR EVERYONE
DP World is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO). We strongly believe that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success and we make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We believe that employees are happiest when they’re empowered to be their true, authentic selves. So, please come as you are. We can’t wait to meet you.

By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize DP World to transmit and store your information in the world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.

Work Location: Hybrid remote

title: Sales Support Representative
description:
We're looking for a Sales Support Administrator to provide administrative support to our sales teams. The role is broad and busy meaning that there's lots to do and plenty to learn. In the role, you'll always be one step ahead, foreseeing things that need to be done and focusing on quality to ensure that the team adds value, saves time, and makes things simple for our sales team.


What you'll be getting up to

  • To quality control any contract submissions that come through from our internal sales team or our external partners - this will involve call listening against the supplier's verbal scripts and/or verifying information on a written document.
  • Repair contract errors on the sales teams/external partner's behalf where possible - this may involve customer contact.
  • To help the sales team/external partners with resolving any contract issues where required.
  • To help the sales team/external partners with any pricing issues they may be experiencing.
  • Liaising with suppliers either written or verbally to resolve any issues with contract submissions


Who are we

We're Utility Bidder. Since our launch in 2009, we've helped more than 75,000 UK businesses switch energy suppliers and save over 45% on their energy bills. Our mission is to become the number 1 energy broker within the UK.


Why join Team UB?

  • We're an award-winning business: with a fantastic reputation behind us and an exciting future ahead.
  • We have huge ambitions and we're growing fast: There really is no better place to make a big impact and unlock your potential than with us here at UB.
  • Continuous development: You can expect a personal development plan, designed to support your long-term goals and career.
  • How we work: At UB, you're treated like an adult to operate in what style works for you, we don't micromanage.
  • Our office space: Our team is based in our newly refurbished office in the heart of Corby.
  • Fun + collaborative culture: Life at UB is fun, fast, collaborative, and supportive. We go the extra mile to ensure our people are happy, motivated, and fulfilling their potential.
  • Plenty of perks: There are many incentives to reward you for your results along the way, outside of purely a financial bonus: monthly lunches, early finishes, an annual all expenses paid trip abroad, summer and winter parties, team building events and many more. You also have your very own games area in the office!


What's on offer?

  • Office hours 9:00am - 5.30pm Monday to Friday - we're also happy to discuss flexible working arrangements.
  • 25 days holiday (plus bank holidays) - and if that's not enough you can also buy & sell holidays too.
  • Free parking
  • Yearly company-wide holiday (Ibiza 2023)
  • Summer and Winter Socials
  • Employee Assistance Programme - with 24/7 access to a Remote GP
  • Cycle to Work Scheme & Tech Scheme
  • Pension Scheme
  • Life Assurance cover
  • Ongoing opportunities to progress your career


If you're ready to take your career to the next level, apply today and become part of #TeamUB!


Your application will be processed via Occupop our applicant tracking system

purposes of recruitment for the position given in the advertisement. All data provided in this application is processed using a third party supplier

'Occupop' with data stored on their systems.

information on the processing of personal data by Utility Bidder Ltd can be found in our Privacy

Policy.
